" [Lucian]73-lucian had heard of [these sage counsels]1870-these sage counsels , and through it [them]1870-these sage counsels as [he]73-lucian listened to the bitter complaints of [the gaunt , hungry old women]1871-the gaunt , hungry old women . In [the back street by which [he]73-lucian passed out of [the town]387-the town]1872-the back street by which he passed out of the town [he]73-lucian saw [a large "[92-mr. dixon] healthy " boy]1874-a large " healthy " boy kicking a sick cat ; [the poor creature]1875-the poor creature had just strength enough to crawl under an outhouse door ; probably to die in torments . [He]73-lucian did not find much satisfaction in thrashing [the boy]1780-the boy , but [he]73-lucian did it with hearty good will . Further on , at the corner where [the turnpike]1877-the turnpike used to be , was a big notice , announcing a meeting at [the school - room]597-the school - room in aid of [the missions to [the Portuguese]487-the portuguese]1879-the missions to the portuguese . "[655-the lord bishop of the diocese] Under the Patronage of [the Lord Bishop of [the Diocese]656-the diocese]655-the lord bishop of the diocese , " was the imposing headline ; [the Reverend Merivale Dixon]135-merivale , [vicar of [Caermaen]7-caermaen]1881-vicar of caermaen , was to be in the chair , supported by [Stanley Gervase]136-stanley gervase , [Esq .]1882-esq . , [J.P.]137-j.p. , and by [many of [the clergy]1884-the clergy and gentry of [the neighborhood]1885-the neighborhood]1883-many of the clergy and gentry of the neighborhood . [Senhor Diabo]138-senhor diabo , "[655-the lord bishop of the diocese] formerly [a Romanist priest]657-a romanist priest , now [an evangelist in [Lisbon]20-lisbon]658-an evangelist in lisbon , " would address the meeting . "[655-the lord bishop of the diocese] Funds are urgently needed to carry on this good work , " concluded the notice . So [he]73-lucian lay well back in the shade of the hedge , and thought whether some sort of an article could not be made by vindicating [the terrible Yahoos]1886-the terrible yahoos ; one might point out that [they]1886-the terrible yahoos were in many respects [a simple and unsophisticated race , whose faults were the result of [their]1886-the terrible yahoos enslaved position , while such virtues as [they]1886-the terrible yahoos had were all [their]1886-the terrible yahoos own]1887-a simple and unsophisticated race , whose faults were the result of their enslaved position , while such virtues as they had were all their own . [They]1886-the terrible yahoos might be compared , [he]73-lucian thought , much to [their]1886-the terrible yahoos advantage , with more complex civilizations . There was no hint of anything like the Beit system of publishing in existence amongst [them]1886-the terrible yahoos ; [the great Yahoo nation]1888-the great yahoo nation would surely never feed and encourage [a scabby Houyhnhnm]1889-a scabby houyhnhnm , expelled for [his]1889-a scabby houyhnhnm foulness from [the horse - community]1890-the horse - community , and [the witty dean]1891-the witty dean , in all [his]1891-the witty dean minuteness , had said nothing of "[655-the lord bishop of the diocese] safe " [Yahoos]139-yahoos . On reflection , however , [he]73-lucian did not feel quite secure of this part of [his]73-lucian defense ; [he]73-lucian remembered that [the leading brutes]1892-the leading brutes had [favorites]1893-favorites , who were employed in certain simple domestic offices about [[their]1892-the leading brutes masters]1894-their masters , and it seemed doubtful whether the contemplated vindication would not break down on this point . [He]73-lucian smiled queerly to [himself]73-lucian as [he]73-lucian thought of these comparisons , but [his]73-lucian heart burned with a dull fury . Throwing back [his]73-lucian unhappy memory , [he]73-lucian recalled all the contempt and scorn [he]73-lucian had suffered ; as [a boy]1771-a boy [he]73-lucian had heard [the masters]354-the masters murmuring [their]354-the masters disdain of [him]73-lucian and of [his]73-lucian desire to learn other than ordinary school work . As [a young man]1897-a young man [he]73-lucian had suffered the insolence of [these wretched people]1898-these wretched people about [him]73-lucian ; [their]1898-these wretched people cackling laughter at [his]73-lucian poverty jarred and grated in [his]73-lucian ears ; [he]73-lucian saw the acrid grin of [some miserable idiot woman]1899-some miserable idiot woman , some creature beneath the swine in intelligence and manners , merciless , as [he]73-lucian went by with [his]73-lucian eyes on the dust , in [his]73-lucian ragged clothes . [He]73-lucian and [[his]73-lucian father]341-his father seemed to pass down an avenue of jeers and contempt , and contempt from such animals as these ! This putrid filth , molded into human shape , made only to fawn on the rich and [beslaver]1901-beslaver [them]1898-these wretched people , thinking no foulness too foul if it were done in honor of [those in power and authority]1902-those in power and authority ; and no refined cruelty of contempt too cruel if it were contempt of [the poor and humble and oppressed]1903-the poor and humble and oppressed ; it was to [this obscene and ghastly throng]1904-this obscene and ghastly throng that [he]73-lucian was something to be pointed at . And [these men]1905-these men and [women]1906-women spoke of sacred things , and knelt before the awful altar of [God]140-god , before the altar of tremendous fire , surrounded as [they]1905-these men professed by [Angels]141-angels and [Archangels]1907-archangels and [all the Company of Heaven]1908-all the company of heaven ; and in [[their]1905-these men very church]1909-their very church [they]1905-these men had one aisle for [the rich]1910-the rich and another for [the poor]1911-the poor . And the species was not peculiar to [Caermaen]7-caermaen ; [the rich business men in [London]11-london]1912-the rich business men in london and [the successful brother author]1913-the successful brother author were probably amusing [themselves]1912-the rich business men in london at the expense of [the poor struggling creature [they]1912-the rich business men in london had injured and wounded]1914-the poor struggling creature they had injured and wounded ; just as [the "[655-the lord bishop of the diocese] healthy " boy]1915-the " healthy " boy had burst into a great laugh when the miserable sick cat cried out in bitter agony , and trailed its limbs slowly , as it crept away to die . [Lucian]73-lucian looked into [his]73-lucian own life and [his]73-lucian own will ; [he]73-lucian saw that in spite of [his]73-lucian follies , and [his]73-lucian want of success , [he]73-lucian had not been consciously malignant , [he]73-lucian had never deliberately aided in oppression , or looked on it with enjoyment and approval , and [he]73-lucian felt that when [he]73-lucian lay dead beneath [the earth]333-the earth , eaten by swarming worms , [he]73-lucian would be in a purer company than now , when [he]73-lucian lived amongst [human creatures]1917-human creatures . And [he]73-lucian was to call [this loathsome beast]1918-this loathsome beast , all sting and filth , [brother]1919-brother ! "[0-i] [I]0-i had rather call [the devils [[my]0-i brothers]660-my brothers]659-the devils my brothers , " [he]0-i said in [his]0-i heart , "[0-i] [I]0-i would fare better in hell . " Blood was in [his]0-i eyes , and as [he]0-i looked up the sky seemed of blood , and [the earth]333-the earth burned with fire . The sun was sinking low on [the mountain]1921-the mountain when [he]0-i set out on the way again . [Burrows]88-dr. burrows , [the doctor]550-the doctor , coming [home]308-home in [[his]550-the doctor trap]1924-his trap , met [him]0-i a little lower on [the road]287-the road , and gave [him]0-i a friendly good - night . "[0-i] A long way round on [this road]661-this road , is n't it ? " said [the doctor]550-the doctor . "[0-i] As [you]0-i have come so far , why do n't [you]0-i try the short cut across [the fields]314-the fields ? [You]0-i will find it easily enough ; second stile on the left hand , and then go straight ahead . " [He]550-the doctor thanked [Dr. Burrows]88-dr. burrows and said [he]550-the doctor would try the short cut , and [Burrows]88-dr. burrows span on homeward . [He]550-the doctor was [a gruff and honest bachelor]1927-a gruff and honest bachelor , and often felt very sorry for [the lad]1928-the lad , and wished [he]550-the doctor could help [him]1928-the lad . As [he]550-the doctor drove on , it suddenly occurred to [him]550-the doctor that [Lucian]73-lucian had an awful look on [his]73-lucian face , and [he]550-the doctor was sorry [he]550-the doctor had not asked [him]73-lucian to jump in , and to come to supper . A hearty slice of beef , with strong ale , whisky and soda afterwards , a good pipe , and certain Rabelaisian tales which [the doctor]550-the doctor had treasured for many years , would have done [the poor fellow]1631-the poor fellow a lot of good , [he]550-the doctor was certain . [He]550-the doctor half turned round on [his]550-the doctor seat , and looked to see if [Lucian]73-lucian were still in sight , but [he]550-the doctor had passed the corner , and [the doctor]550-the doctor drove on , shivering a little ; the mists were beginning to rise from [the wet banks of [the river]1634-the river]1932-the wet banks of the river . [Lucian]73-lucian trailed slowly along [the road]287-the road , keeping a look out for the stile [the doctor]550-the doctor had mentioned . It would be a little of an adventure , [he]73-lucian thought , to find [his]73-lucian way by [an unknown track]1936-an unknown track ; [he]73-lucian knew the direction in which [[his]73-lucian home]1651-his home lay , and [he]73-lucian imagined [he]73-lucian would not have much difficulty in crossing from [one stile]1938-one stile to another . [The path]1939-the path led [him]73-lucian up [a steep bare field]1940-a steep bare field , and when [he]73-lucian was at the top , [the town]387-the town and [the valley winding up to the north]1942-the valley winding up to the north stretched before [him]73-lucian . [The river]1634-the river was stilled at the flood , and the yellow water , reflecting the sunset , glowed in its deep pools like dull brass . [These burning pools]1944-these burning pools , the level meadows fringed with shuddering reeds , the long dark sweep of [the forest]452-the forest on [the hill]268-the hill , were all clear and distinct , yet the light seemed to have clothed them with a new garment , even as voices from [the streets of [Caermaen]7-caermaen]1855-the streets of caermaen sounded strangely , mounting up thin with the smoke . There beneath [him]73-lucian lay [the huddled cluster of [Caermaen]7-caermaen]1948-the huddled cluster of caermaen , the ragged and uneven roofs that marked [the winding and sordid streets]1949-the winding and sordid streets , here and there a pointed gable rising above [[its]7-caermaen meaner fellows]1950-its meaner fellows ; beyond [he]73-lucian recognized the piled mounds that marked [the circle of [the amphitheatre]1952-the amphitheatre]1951-the circle of the amphitheatre , and the dark edge of trees that grew where the Roman wall whitened and waxed old beneath the frosts and rains of eighteen hundred years . Thin and strange , mingled together , the voices came up to [him]73-lucian on [the hill]268-the hill ; it was as if an outland race inhabited [the ruined city]1954-the ruined city and talked in a strange language of strange and terrible things . The sun had slid down the sky , and hung quivering over the huge dark dome of [the mountain]1921-the mountain like a burnt sacrifice , and then suddenly vanished . In the afterglow the clouds began to writhe and turn scarlet , and shone so strangely reflected in the pools of [the snake - like river]1956-the snake - like river , that [one]1691-one would have said the still waters stirred , the fleeting and changing of the clouds seeming to quicken the stream , as if it bubbled and sent up gouts of blood . But already about [the town]387-the town the darkness was forming ; fast , fast the shadows crept upon [it]387-the town from [the forest]452-the forest , and from all sides banks and wreaths of curling mist were gathering , as if [a ghostly leaguer]1960-a ghostly leaguer were being built up against [the city]1961-the city , and [the strange race who lived in [its]1961-the city streets]1962-the strange race who lived in its streets . Suddenly there burst out from the stillness the clear and piercing music of the réveillé , calling , recalling , iterated , reiterated , and ending with one long high fierce shrill note with which [the steep hills]1963-the steep hills rang . Perhaps [a boy in the school band]1964-a boy in the school band was practicing on [his]1964-a boy in the school band bugle , but for [Lucian]73-lucian it was magic . For [him]73-lucian it was the note of the Roman trumpet , tuba mirum spargens sonum , filling all [the hollow valley]1965-the hollow valley with its command , reverberated in dark places in [the far forest]1966-the far forest , and resonant in [the old graveyards]1967-the old graveyards without the walls . In [his]73-lucian imagination [he]73-lucian saw the earthen gates of [the tombs]1968-the tombs broken open , and the serried legion swarming to the eagles . Century by century [they]1969-they passed by ; [they]1969-they rose , dripping , from [the river bed]1970-the river bed , [they]1969-they rose from the level , [their]1969-they armor shone in [the quiet orchard]1971-the quiet orchard , [they]1969-they gathered in ranks and companies from [the cemetery]1972-the cemetery , and as the trumpet sounded , [the hill fort above [the town]387-the town]1973-the hill fort above the town gave up [its]1973-the hill fort above the town dead . By [hundreds and thousands the ghostly battle]1975-hundreds and thousands the ghostly battle surged about the standard , behind the quaking mist , ready to march against the moldering walls [they]1969-they had built so many years before . [He]73-lucian turned sharply ; it was growing very dark , and [he]73-lucian was afraid of missing [his]73-lucian way . At first [the path]1939-the path led [him]73-lucian by the verge of a wood ; there was a noise of rustling and murmuring from the trees as if [they]1969-they were taking evil counsel together . A high hedge shut out the sight of [the darkening valley]1977-the darkening valley , and [he]73-lucian stumbled on mechanically , without taking much note of the turnings of the track , and when [he]73-lucian came out from the wood shadow to [the open country]1978-the open country , [he]73-lucian stood for a moment quite bewildered and uncertain . [A dark wild twilight country]1979-a dark wild twilight country lay before [him]73-lucian , confused dim shapes of trees near at hand , and a hollow below [his]73-lucian feet , and [the further hills and woods]1980-the further hills and woods were dimmer , and all the air was very still . Suddenly the darkness about [him]73-lucian glowed ; a furnace fire had shot up on [the mountain]1921-the mountain , and for a moment the little world of [the woodside]1982-the woodside and [the steep hill]1983-the steep hill shone in a pale light , and [he]73-lucian thought [he]73-lucian saw [his]73-lucian path beaten out in the turf before [him]73-lucian . The great flame sank down to a red glint of fire , and it led [him]73-lucian on down [the ragged slope]1984-the ragged slope , [his]73-lucian feet striking against ridges of ground , and falling from beneath [him]73-lucian at a sudden dip . The bramble bushes shot out long prickly vines , amongst which [he]73-lucian was entangled , and lower [he]73-lucian was held back by wet bubbling earth . [He]73-lucian had descended into [a dark and shady valley , beset and tapestried with gloomy thickets]1985-a dark and shady valley , beset and tapestried with gloomy thickets ; the weird wood noises were the only sounds , strange , unutterable mutterings , dismal , inarticulate . [He]73-lucian pushed on in what [he]73-lucian hoped was the right direction , stumbling from stile to gate , peering through mist and shadow , and still vainly seeking for [any known landmark]1986-any known landmark . Presently another sound broke upon the grim air , the murmur of water poured over stones , gurgling against the old misshapen roots of trees , and running clear in a deep channel . [He]73-lucian passed into the chill breath of [the brook]1680-the brook , and almost fancied [he]73-lucian heard two voices speaking in its murmur ; there seemed a ceaseless utterance of words , an endless argument . With a mood of horror pressing on [him]73-lucian , [he]73-lucian listened to the noise of waters , and the wild fancy seized [him]73-lucian that [he]73-lucian was not deceived , that [two unknown beings]1988-two unknown beings stood together there in the darkness and tried the balances of [his]73-lucian life , and spoke [his]73-lucian doom . The hour in the matted thicket rushed over the great bridge of years to [his]73-lucian thought ; [he]73-lucian had sinned against [the earth]333-the earth , and [the earth]333-the earth trembled and shook for vengeance . [He]73-lucian stayed still for a moment , quivering with fear , and at last went on blindly , no longer caring for [the path]1939-the path , if only [he]73-lucian might escape from the toils of [that dismal shuddering hollow]1992-that dismal shuddering hollow . As [he]73-lucian plunged through the hedges the bristling thorns tore [his]73-lucian face and hands ; [he]73-lucian fell amongst stinging - nettles and was pricked as [he]73-lucian beat out [his]73-lucian way amidst the gorse . [He]73-lucian raced headlong , [his]73-lucian head over [his]73-lucian shoulder , through a windy wood , bare of undergrowth ; there lay about the ground moldering stumps , the relics of trees that had thundered to their fall , crashing and tearing to earth , long ago ; and from these remains there flowed out a pale thin radiance , filling the spaces of the sounding wood with a dream of light . [He]73-lucian had lost all count of the track ; [he]73-lucian felt [he]73-lucian had fled for hours , climbing and descending , and yet not advancing ; it was as if [he]73-lucian stood still and the shadows of [the land]462-the land went by , in a vision . But at last a hedge , high and straggling , rose before [him]73-lucian , and as [he]73-lucian broke through it , [his]73-lucian feet slipped , and [he]73-lucian fell headlong down [a steep bank]1994-a steep bank into [a lane]1995-a lane . [He]73-lucian lay still , half - stunned , for a moment , and then rising unsteadily , [he]73-lucian looked desperately into the darkness before [him]73-lucian , uncertain and bewildered . In front [it]1996-it was black as [a midnight cellar]1997-a midnight cellar , and [he]73-lucian turned about , and saw a glint in the distance , as if a candle were flickering in [a farm - house]1998-a farm - house window . [He]73-lucian began to walk with trembling feet towards the light , when suddenly something pale started out from the shadows before [him]73-lucian , and seemed to swim and float down the air . [He]73-lucian was going down hill , and [he]73-lucian hastened onwards , and [he]73-lucian could see the bars of a stile framed dimly against the sky , and [the figure]1999-the figure still advanced with that gliding motion . Then , as [the road]287-the road declined to [the valley]270-the valley , [the landmark [he]73-lucian had been seeking]2002-the landmark he had been seeking appeared . To [his]73-lucian right there surged up in the darkness [the darker summit of [the Roman fort]347-the roman fort]2003-the darker summit of the roman fort , and the streaming fire of the great full moon glowed through the bars of the wizard oaks , and made a halo shine about [the hill]268-the hill . [He]73-lucian was now quite close to the white appearance , and saw that it was only [a woman]1770-a woman walking swiftly down [the lane]278-the lane ; the floating movement was an effect due to the somber air and the moon 's glamour . At the gate , where [he]73-lucian had spent so many hours gazing at [the fort]1672-the fort , [they]2009-they walked foot to foot , and [he]73-lucian saw it was [Annie Morgan]75-annie . "[73-lucian] Good evening , [Master Lucian]73-lucian , " said [the girl]1768-the girl , "[73-lucian] it 's very dark , [sir]1765-sir , indeed . " "[75-annie] Good evening , [Annie]75-annie , " [he]73-lucian answered , calling [her]75-annie by [her]75-annie name for the first time , and [he]73-lucian saw that [she]75-annie smiled with pleasure . "[1765-sir] [You]73-lucian are out late , are n't [you]73-lucian ? " "[1639-nobody] Yes , [sir]1765-sir ; but [I]0-i 've been taking a bit of supper to [old Mrs. Gibbon]74-old mrs. gibbon . [She]75-annie 's been very poorly the last few days , and there 's [nobody]1639-nobody to do anything for [her]75-annie . " Then there were really people who helped [one another]2011-one another ; kindness and pity were not mere myths , fictions of "[1639-nobody] society , " as useful as [Doe]142-doe and [Roe]143-roe , and as non - existent . The thought struck [Lucian]73-lucian with a shock ; the evening 's passion and delirium , the wild walk and physical fatigue had almost shattered [him]73-lucian in body and mind . [He]73-lucian was "[1639-nobody] degenerate , " decadent , and the rough rains and blustering winds of life , which [a stronger man]2012-a stronger man would have laughed at and enjoyed , were to [him]73-lucian "[666-a bounder] hail - storms and fire - showers . " After all , [Messrs Beit]121-messrs beit , [the publishers]2013-the publishers , were [only sharp men of business]2014-only sharp men of business , and [these terrible Dixons]2015-these terrible dixons and [Gervases]103-the gervases and [Colleys]144-colleys merely [the ordinary limited clergy]2016-the ordinary limited clergy and gentry of [a quiet country town]2017-a quiet country town ; sturdier sense would have dismissed [Dixon]135-merivale as [an old humbug]2018-an old humbug , [Stanley Gervase]136-stanley gervase , Esquire , [J.P.]137-j.p. , as a "[667-a shoddy lot] bit of [a bounder]666-a bounder , " and [the ladies]2019-the ladies as "[667-a shoddy lot] rather [a shoddy lot]667-a shoddy lot . " But [he]73-lucian was walking slowly now in painful silence , [his]73-lucian heavy , lagging feet striking against the loose stones . [He]73-lucian was not thinking of [the girl beside [him]73-lucian]2020-the girl beside him ; only something seemed to swell and grow and swell within [his]73-lucian heart ; it was all the torture of [his]73-lucian days , weary hopes and weary disappointment , scorn rankling and throbbing , and the thought "[0-i] [I]0-i had rather call the devils [[my]0-i brothers]660-my brothers and live with [them]660-my brothers in hell . " [He]73-lucian choked and gasped for breath , and felt involuntary muscles working in [his]73-lucian face , and the impulses of [a madman]2021-a madman stirring [him]73-lucian ; [he]73-lucian [himself]73-lucian was in truth the realization of the vision of [Caermaen]7-caermaen that night , [a city with moldering walls beset by [the ghostly legion]2023-the ghostly legion]2022-a city with moldering walls beset by the ghostly legion . Life and [the world]286-the world and the laws of the sunlight had passed away , and the resurrection and kingdom of the dead began . [The Celt]145-the celt assailed [him]73-lucian , becoming from the weird wood [he]73-lucian called [the world]286-the world , and [[his]73-lucian far - off ancestors]2026-his far - off ancestors , [the "[0-i] little people]2027-the " little people , " crept out of [[their]2026-his far - off ancestors caves]2028-their caves , muttering charms and incantations in hissing inhuman speech ; [he]73-lucian was beleaguered by desires that had slept in [his]73-lucian race for ages . "[0-i] [I]0-i am afraid [you]0-i are very tired , [Master Lucian]73-lucian . Would [you]0-i like [me]0-i to give [you]0-i [my]0-i hand over this rough bit ? " [He]73-lucian had stumbled against a great round stone and had nearly fallen . [The woman]2029-the woman 's hand sought [his]73-lucian in the darkness ; as [he]73-lucian felt the touch of the soft warm flesh [he]73-lucian moaned , and a pang shot through [his]73-lucian arm to [his]73-lucian heart . [He]73-lucian looked up and found [he]73-lucian had only walked a few paces since [Annie]75-annie had spoken ; [he]73-lucian had thought [they]2030-their had wandered for hours together . The moon was just mounting above the oaks , and the halo round [the dark hill]2031-the dark hill brightened . [He]73-lucian stopped short , and keeping [his]73-lucian hold of [Annie]75-annie 's hand , looked into [her]2029-the woman face . A hazy glory of moonlight shone around [them]2030-their and lit up [their]2030-their eyes . [He]73-lucian had not greatly altered since [his]73-lucian boyhood ; [his]73-lucian face was pale olive in color , thin and oval ; marks of pain had gathered about the eyes , and [his]73-lucian black hair was already stricken with grey . But the eager , curious gaze still remained , and what [he]73-lucian saw before [him]73-lucian lit up [his]73-lucian sadness with a new fire . [She]75-annie stopped too , and did not offer to draw away , but looked back with all [her]75-annie heart . [They]2030-their were alike in many ways ; [her]75-annie skin was also of that olive color , but [her]75-annie face was sweet as a beautiful summer night , and [her]75-annie black eyes showed no dimness , and the smile on the scarlet lips was like a flame when it brightens [a dark and lonely land]2032-a dark and lonely land . "[0-i] [You]669-you are sorely tired , [Master Lucian]73-lucian , let [us]670-us sit down here by the gate . " It was [Lucian]73-lucian who spoke next : "[0-i] [[My]0-i dear]671-my dear , [[my]0-i dear]671-my dear . " And [their]2030-their lips were together again , and [their]2030-their arms locked together , [each holding the other]2033-each holding the other fast . And then [the poor lad]2034-the poor lad let [his]2034-the poor lad head sink down on [[his]2034-the poor lad sweetheart]2035-his sweetheart 's breast , and burst into a passion of weeping . The tears streamed down [his]2034-the poor lad face , and [he]2034-the poor lad shook with sobbing , in the happiest moment that [he]2034-the poor lad had ever lived . [The woman]2029-the woman bent over [him]2034-the poor lad and tried to comfort [him]2034-the poor lad , but [his]2034-the poor lad tears were [his]2034-the poor lad consolation and [his]2034-the poor lad triumph . [Annie]75-annie was whispering to [him]2034-the poor lad , [her]75-annie hand laid on [his]2034-the poor lad heart ; [she]75-annie was whispering beautiful , wonderful words , that soothed [him]2034-the poor lad as a song . [He]2034-the poor lad did not know what they meant . "[674-they] [Annie]75-annie , [dear]1625-dear , dear [Annie]75-annie , what are [you]75-annie saying to [me]0-i ? [I]0-i have never heard such beautiful words . Tell [me]0-i , [Annie]75-annie , what do [they]674-they mean ? " [She]75-annie laughed , and said it was only nonsense that [the nurses]2037-the nurses sang to [the children]2038-the children . "[75-annie] No , no , [you]75-annie are not to call [me]0-i [Master Lucian]73-lucian any more , " [he]0-i said , when [they]2039-they parted , "[676-you] [you]75-annie must call [me]0-i [Lucian]73-lucian ; and [I]0-i , [I]0-i worship [you]75-annie , [[my]0-i dear]671-my dear [Annie]75-annie . " [He]0-i fell down before [her]75-annie , embracing [her]75-annie knees , and adored , and [she]75-annie allowed [him]0-i , and confirmed [his]0-i worship . [He]0-i followed slowly after [her]75-annie , passing the path which led to [[her]75-annie home]2040-her home with a longing glance . [Nobody]1639-nobody saw any difference in [Lucian]73-lucian when [he]73-lucian reached [the rectory]272-the rectory . [He]73-lucian came in with [his]73-lucian usual dreamy indifference , and told how [he]73-lucian had lost [his]73-lucian way by trying the short cut . [He]73-lucian said [he]73-lucian had met [Dr. Burrows]88-dr. burrows on [the road]287-the road , and that [he]73-lucian had recommended [the path]1939-the path by [the fields]314-the fields . Then , as dully as if [he]73-lucian had been reading some story out of a newspaper , [he]73-lucian gave [[his]73-lucian father]341-his father the outlines of the Beit case , producing the pretty little book called The Chorus in [Green]19-green . [The parson]1635-the parson listened in amazement . "[676-you] [You]676-you mean to tell [me]0-i that [you]676-you wrote this book ? " [he]0-i said . [He]0-i was quite roused . "[676-you] No ; not all of it . Look ; that bit is mine , and that ; and the beginning of this chapter . Nearly the whole of the third chapter is by [me]0-i . " [He]0-i closed the book without interest , and indeed [he]0-i felt astonished at [[his]73-lucian father]341-his father 's excitement . The incident seemed to [him]0-i unimportant . "[677-these scoundrels] And [you]676-you say that eighty or ninety pages of this book are [yours]676-you , and [these scoundrels]677-these scoundrels have stolen [your]676-you work ? " "[0-i] Well , [I]0-i suppose [they]677-these scoundrels have . [I]0-i 'll fetch the manuscript , if [you]676-you would like to look at it . " The manuscript was duly produced , wrapped in brown paper , with [Messrs Beit]121-messrs beit 's address label on it , and the post - office dated stamps . "[0-i] And the other book has been out a month . " [The parson]1635-the parson , forgetting the sacerdotal office , and [his]1635-the parson good habit of grinning , swore at [Messrs Beit]121-messrs beit and [Mr. Ritson]132-mr. ritson , calling [them]677-these scoundrels [damned thieves]2050-damned thieves , and then began to read the manuscript , and to compare it with the printed book . "[678-my poor fellow] Why , it 's splendid work . [[My]0-i poor fellow]678-my poor fellow , " [he]0-i said after a while , "[676-you] [I]0-i had no notion [you]676-you could write so well . [I]0-i used to think of such things in the old days at [Oxford]14-oxford ; ' [old Bill]146-old bill , ' [the tutor]679-the tutor , used to praise [my]0-i essays , but [I]0-i never wrote anything like this . And [this infernal ruffian of [a Ritson]132-mr. ritson]680-this infernal ruffian of a ritson has taken all [your]676-you best things and mixed them up with [his]680-this infernal ruffian of a ritson own rot to make it go down . Of course [you]676-you 'll expose [the gang]681-the gang ? " [Lucian]73-lucian was mildly amused ; [he]73-lucian could n't enter into [[his]73-lucian father]341-his father 's feelings at all . [He]73-lucian sat smoking in one of the old easy chairs , taking the rare relish of a hot grog with [his]73-lucian pipe , and gazing out of [his]73-lucian dreamy eyes at [the violent old parson]2052-the violent old parson . [He]73-lucian was pleased that [[his]73-lucian father]341-his father liked [his]73-lucian book , because [he]341-his father knew [him]73-lucian to be [a deep and sober scholar]2054-a deep and sober scholar and [a cool judge of good letters]2055-a cool judge of good letters ; but [he]73-lucian laughed to [himself]73-lucian when [he]73-lucian saw the magic of print . [The parson]1635-the parson had expressed no wish to read the manuscript when it came back in disgrace ; [he]1635-the parson had merely grinned , said something about boomerangs , and quoted [Horace]131-horace with relish . Whereas now , before the book in its neat case , lettered with [another man]611-another man 's name , [his]1635-the parson approbation of the writing and [his]1635-the parson disapproval of [the "[682-you] scoundrels]2058-the " scoundrels , " as [he]1635-the parson called [them]2058-the " scoundrels , were loudly expressed , and , though [a good smoker]2059-a good smoker , [he]1635-the parson blew and puffed vehemently at [his]1635-the parson pipe . "[682-you] [You]682-you 'll expose [the rascals]683-the rascals , of course , wo n't [you]682-you ? " [he]1635-the parson said again . "[0-i] Oh no , [I]0-i think not . It really does n't matter much , does it ? After all , there are some very weak things in the book ; does n't it strike [you]682-you as ' young ? ' [I]0-i have been thinking of another plan , but [I]0-i have n't done much with it lately . But [I]0-i believe [I]0-i 've got hold of a really good idea this time , and if [I]0-i can manage to see the heart of it [I]0-i hope to turn out a manuscript worth stealing . But it 's so hard to get at the core of an ideaâ€”the heart , as [I]0-i call it , "[0-i] [he]0-i went on after a pause . " It 's like having a box [you]682-you ca n't open , though [you]682-you know there 's something wonderful inside . But [I]685-these fellows do believe [I]685-these fellows 've a fine thing in [my]685-these fellows hands , and [I]685-these fellows mean to try [my]685-these fellows best to work it . "[685-these fellows] [Lucian]73-lucian talked with enthusiasm now , but [[his]73-lucian father]341-his father , on [his]73-lucian side , could not share these ardors . It was [his]73-lucian part to be astonished at excitement over a book that was not even begun , the mere ghost of a book flitting elusive in the world of unborn masterpieces and failures . [He]73-lucian had loved good letters , but [he]73-lucian shared unconsciously in the general belief that literary attempt is always pitiful , though [he]73-lucian did not subscribe to the other half of the popular faithâ€”that literary success is a matter of very little importance . [He]73-lucian thought well of books , but only of printed books ; in manuscripts [he]73-lucian put no faith , and the paulo - post - futurum tense [he]73-lucian could not in any manner conjugate . [He]73-lucian returned once more to the topic of palpable interest . "[685-these fellows] But about this dirty trick [these fellows]685-these fellows have played on [you]686-you . [You]686-you wo n't sit quietly and bear it , surely ? It 's only a question of writing to the papers . " "[0-i] [They]685-these fellows would n't put the letter in . And if [they]685-these fellows did , [I]0-i should only get laughed at . Some time ago [a man]687-a man wrote to [the Reader]618-the reader , complaining of [his]687-a man play being stolen . [He]687-a man said that [he]687-a man had sent a little one - act comedy to [Burleigh]147-burleigh , [the great dramatist]689-the great dramatist , asking for [his]687-a man advice . [Burleigh]147-burleigh gave [his]147-burleigh advice and took the idea for [his]147-burleigh own very successful play . So [the man]647-the man said , and [I]0-i daresay it was true enough . But [the victim]691-the victim got nothing by [his]691-the victim complaint . ' A pretty state of things , ' [everybody]423-everybody said . ' Here 's a [Mr. Tomson]148-mr. tomson , that [no one]302-no one has ever heard of , bothers [Burleigh]147-burleigh with [his]147-burleigh rubbish , and then accuses [him]147-burleigh of petty larceny . Is it likely that [a man of [Burleigh]147-burleigh 's position]694-a man of burleigh 's position , [a playwright who can make [his]694-a man of burleigh 's position five thousand a year easily , would borrow from [an unknown Tomson]696-an unknown tomson]695-a playwright who can make his five thousand a year easily , would borrow from an unknown tomson ? ' [I]0-i should think it very likely , indeed , " [Lucian]73-lucian went on , chuckling , "[0-i] but that was [their]697-their verdict . No ; [I]0-i do n't think [I]0-i 'll write to the papers . " "[578-my boy] Well , well , [[my]0-i boy]578-my boy , [I]0-i suppose [you]578-my boy know [your]578-my boy own business best . [I]0-i think [you]578-my boy are mistaken , but [you]578-my boy must do as [you]578-my boy like . " "[578-my boy] It 's all so unimportant , " said [Lucian]73-lucian , and [he]73-lucian really thought so . [He]73-lucian had sweeter things to dream of , and desired no communion of feeling with [that madman who had left [Caermaen]7-caermaen]2060-that madman who had left caermaen some few hours before . [He]73-lucian felt [he]73-lucian had made a fool of [himself]73-lucian , [he]73-lucian was ashamed to think of the fatuity of which [he]73-lucian had been guilty , such boiling hatred was not only wicked , but absurd . [A man]687-a man could do no good who put [himself]687-a man into a position of such violent antagonism against [his]687-a man fellow - creatures ; so [Lucian]73-lucian rebuked [his]73-lucian heart , saying that [he]73-lucian was old enough to know better . But [he]73-lucian remembered that [he]73-lucian had sweeter things to dream of ; there was a secret ecstasy that [he]73-lucian treasured and locked tight away , as a joy too exquisite even for thought till [he]73-lucian was quite alone ; and then there was that scheme for a new book that [he]73-lucian had laid down hopelessly some time ago ; it seemed to have arisen into life again within the last hour ; [he]73-lucian understood that [he]73-lucian had started on a false tack , [he]73-lucian had taken the wrong aspect of [his]73-lucian idea . Of course the thing could n't be written in that way ; it was like trying to read a page turned upside down ; and [he]73-lucian saw those characters [he]73-lucian had vainly sought suddenly disambushed , and a splendid inevitable sequence of events unrolled before [him]73-lucian . It was a true resurrection ; the dry plot [he]73-lucian had constructed revealed itself as a living thing , stirring and mysterious , and warm as life itself . [The parson]1635-the parson was smoking stolidly to all appearance , but in reality [he]1635-the parson was full of amazement at [[his]1635-the parson own son]2063-his own son , and now and again [he]1635-the parson slipped sly furtive glances towards [the tranquil young man in the arm - chair by the empty hearth]2064-the tranquil young man in the arm - chair by the empty hearth . In the first place , [Mr. Taylor]79-mr. taylor was genuinely impressed by what [he]79-mr. taylor had read of [Lucian]73-lucian 's work ; [he]79-mr. taylor had so long been accustomed to look upon all effort as futile that success amazed [him]79-mr. taylor . In the abstract , of course , [he]79-mr. taylor was prepared to admit that [some people]468-some people did write well and got published and made money , just as [other persons]2066-other persons successfully backed [an outsider]2067-an outsider at heavy odds ; but it had seemed as improbable that [Lucian]73-lucian should show even the beginnings of achievement in one direction as in the other . Then [the boy]1780-the boy evidently cared so little about it ; [he]1780-the boy did not appear to be proud of being worth robbing , nor was [he]1780-the boy angry with [the robbers]2069-the robbers . [He]1780-the boy sat back luxuriously in the disreputable old chair , drawing long slow wreaths of smoke , tasting [his]1780-the boy whisky from time to time , evidently well at ease with [himself]1780-the boy . [The father]2070-the father saw [him]1780-the boy smile , and it suddenly dawned upon [him]2070-the father that [[his]2070-the father son]1798-his son was very handsome ; [he]1798-his son had such kind gentle eyes and a kind mouth , and [his]1798-his son pale cheeks were flushed like [a girl]2072-a girl 's . [Mr. Taylor]79-mr. taylor felt moved . What [a harmless young fellow]2073-a harmless young fellow [Lucian]73-lucian had been ; no doubt a little queer and different from [others]2074-others , but wholly inoffensive and patient under disappointment . And [Miss Deacon]90-miss deacon , [her]90-miss deacon contribution to the evening 's discussion had been characteristic ; [she]90-miss deacon had remarked , firstly , that writing was a very unsettling occupation , and secondly , that it was extremely foolish to entrust [[one]1691-one 's property]2076-one 's property to people of whom [one knew nothing]2077-one knew nothing . [Father]149-father and [son]481-son had smiled together at these observations , which were probably true enough . [Mr. Taylor]79-mr. taylor at last left [Lucian]73-lucian along ; [he]0-i shook hands with a good deal of respect , and said , almost deferentially : "[699-you] [You]699-you must n't work too hard , [old fellow]700-old fellow . [I]0-i would n't stay up too late , if [I]0-i were [you]699-you , after that long walk . [You]699-you must have gone miles out of [your]699-you way . " "[699-you] [I]0-i 'm not tired now , though . [I]0-i feel as if [I]0-i could write [my]0-i new book on the spot " ; and [the young man]2079-the young man laughed a gay sweet laugh that struck [the father]2070-the father as a new note in [[his]2070-the father son]1798-his son 's life . [He]2079-the young man sat still a moment after [[his]2079-the young man father]341-his father had left [the room]2083-the room . [He]2079-the young man cherished [his]2079-the young man chief treasure of thought in [its]2083-the room secret place ; [he]2079-the young man would not enjoy it yet . [He]2079-the young man drew up a chair to the table at which [he]2079-the young man wrote or tried to write , and began taking pens and paper from the drawer . There was a great pile of ruled paper there ; all of it used , on one side , and signifying many hours of desperate scribbling , of heart - searching and rack of [his]2079-the young man brain ; an array of poor , eager lines written by a waning fire with waning hope ; all useless and abandoned . [He]2079-the young man took up the sheets cheerfully , and began in delicious idleness to look over these fruitless efforts . A page caught [his]2079-the young man attention ; [he]2079-the young man remembered how [he]2079-the young man wrote it while a November storm was dashing against the panes ; and there was another , with a queer blot in one corner ; [he]2079-the young man had got up from [his]2079-the young man chair and looked out , and all [the earth]333-the earth was white fairyland , and the snowflakes whirled round and round in the wind . Then [he]2079-the young man saw the chapter begun of a night in March : a great gale blew that night and rooted up one of the ancient yews in [the churchyard]2085-the churchyard . [He]2079-the young man had heard the trees shrieking in [the woods]331-the woods , and the long wail of the wind , and across the heaven a white moon fled awfully before the streaming clouds . And all these poor abandoned pages now seemed sweet , and past unhappiness was transmuted into happiness , and the nights of toil were holy . [He]2079-the young man turned over half a dozen leaves and began to sketch out the outlines of the new book on the unused pages ; running out a skeleton plan on one page , and dotting fancies , suggestions , hints on others . [He]2079-the young man wrote rapidly , overjoyed to find that loving phrases grew under [his]2079-the young man pen ; a particular scene [he]2079-the young man had imagined filled [him]2079-the young man with desire ; [he]2079-the young man gave [his]2079-the young man hand free course , and saw the written work glowing ; and action and all the heat of existence quickened and beat on the wet page . Happy fancies took shape in happier words , and when at last [he]2079-the young man leant back in [his]2079-the young man chair [he]2079-the young man felt the stir and rush of the story as if it had been some portion of [his]2079-the young man own life . [He]2079-the young man read over what [he]2079-the young man had done with a renewed pleasure in the nimble and flowing workmanship , and as [he]2079-the young man put the little pile of manuscript tenderly in the drawer [he]2079-the young man paused to enjoy the anticipation of tomorrow 's labor . And thenâ€”but[341-his father] the rest of the night was given to tender and delicious things , and when [he]701-he went up to bed a scarlet dawn was streaming from [the east]702-the east . For days [Lucian]73-lucian lay in a swoon of pleasure , smiling when [he]73-lucian was addressed , sauntering happily in the sunlight , hugging recollection warm to [his]73-lucian heart . [Annie]75-annie had told [him]73-lucian that [she]75-annie was going on a visit to [[her]75-annie married sister]1778-her married sister , and said , with a caress , that [he]73-lucian must be patient . [He]73-lucian protested against [her]75-annie absence , but [she]75-annie fondled [him]73-lucian , whispering [her]75-annie charms in [his]73-lucian ear till [he]73-lucian gave in and then [they]704-they said good - bye , [Lucian]73-lucian adoring on [his]73-lucian knees . The parting was as strange as the meeting , and that night when [he]73-lucian laid [his]73-lucian work aside , and let [himself]73-lucian sink deep into the joys of memory , all the encounter seemed as wonderful and impossible as magic . " And [you]73-lucian really do n't mean to do anything about [those rascals]2087-those rascals ? "[341-his father] said [[his]73-lucian father]341-his father . " [Rascals]150-rascals ? Which rascals ? Oh , [you]73-lucian mean [Beit]121-messrs beit . [I]96-edward dixon had forgotten all about it . No ; [I]96-edward dixon do n't think [I]96-edward dixon shall trouble . [They]2087-those rascals 're not worth powder and shot . "[96-edward dixon] And [he]73-lucian returned to [his]73-lucian dream , pacing slowly from the medlar to the quince and back again . It seemed trivial to be interrupted by such questions ; [he]73-lucian had not even time to think of the book [he]73-lucian had recommenced so eagerly , much less of this labor of long ago . [He]73-lucian recollected without interest that it cost [him]73-lucian many pains , that it was pretty good here and there , and that it had been stolen , and it seemed that there was nothing more to be said on the matter . [He]73-lucian wished to think of the darkness in [the lane]278-the lane , of the kind voice that spoke to [him]73-lucian , of the kind hand that sought [his]73-lucian own , as [he]73-lucian stumbled on the rough way . So far , it was wonderful . Since [he]73-lucian had left [school]374-school and lost the company of [the worthy barbarians who had befriended [him]73-lucian [there]1751-there]708-the worthy barbarians who had befriended him there , [he]73-lucian had almost lost the sense of kinship with humanity ; [he]73-lucian had come to dread the human form as [men dread the hood of the cobra]710-men dread the hood of the cobra . To [Lucian]73-lucian [a man]687-a man or [a woman]1770-a woman meant something that stung , that spoke words that rankled , and poisoned [his]73-lucian life with scorn . At first such malignity shocked [him]73-lucian : [he]73-lucian would ponder over words and glances and wonder if [he]73-lucian were not mistaken , and [he]73-lucian still sought now and then for sympathy . [The poor boy]713-the poor boy had romantic ideas about [women]1906-women ; [he]713-the poor boy believed [they]1906-women were merciful and pitiful , very kind to [the unlucky and helpless]715-the unlucky and helpless . [Men]1715-men perhaps had to be different ; after all , the duty of [a man]687-a man was to get on in [the world]286-the world , or , in plain language , to make money , to be successful ; to cheat rather than to be cheated , but always to be successful ; and [he]713-the poor boy could understand that [one who fell below this high standard]719-one who fell below this high standard must expect to be severely judged by [[his]719-one who fell below this high standard fellows]720-his fellows . For example , there was [young Bennett]151-bennett , [[Miss Spurry]152-miss spurry 's nephew]721-miss spurry 's nephew . [Lucian]73-lucian had met [him]151-bennett once or twice when [he]73-lucian was spending [his]73-lucian holidays with [Miss Spurry]152-miss spurry , and [the two young fellows]722-the two young fellows compared literary notes together . [Bennett]151-bennett showed some beautiful things [he]151-bennett had written , over which [Lucian]73-lucian had grown both sad and enthusiastic . It was such exquisite magic verse , and so much better than anything [he]73-lucian ever hoped to write , that there was a touch of anguish in [his]73-lucian congratulations . But when [Bennett]151-bennett , after many vain prayers to [[his]151-bennett aunt]723-his aunt , threw up a safe position in [the bank]724-the bank , and betook [himself]151-bennett to [a [London]11-london garret]725-a london garret , [Lucian]73-lucian was not surprised at the general verdict . [Mr. Dixon]92-mr. dixon , as [a clergyman]479-a clergyman , viewed the question from a high standpoint and found it all deplorable , but the general opinion was that [Bennett]151-bennett was [a hopeless young lunatic]727-a hopeless young lunatic . [Old Mr. Gervase]153-mr. gervase went purple when [his]153-mr. gervase name was mentioned , and [the young Dixons]728-the young dixons sneered very merrily over the adventure . " [I]96-edward dixon always thought [he]151-bennett was [a beastly young ass]2088-a beastly young ass , "[96-edward dixon] said [Edward Dixon]96-edward dixon , " but [I]96-edward dixon did n't think [he]151-bennett 'd chuck away [his]151-bennett chances like that . Said [he]151-bennett could n't stand [a bank]2089-a bank ! [I]96-edward dixon hope [he]151-bennett 'll be able to stand bread and water . That 's [all those littery fellows]2090-all those littery fellows get , [I]96-edward dixon believe , except [Tennyson]154-tennyson and [Mark Twain]155-mark twain and [those sort of people]2091-those sort of people . "[2092-a very nice young fellowâ€”"clever] [Lucian]73-lucian of course sympathized with [the unfortunate Bennett]151-bennett , but such judgments were after all only natural . [The young man]2079-the young man might have stayed in [the bank]724-the bank and succeeded to [[his]2079-the young man aunt]723-his aunt 's thousand a year , and [everybody]423-everybody would have called [him]2079-the young man [a very nice young fellowâ€”"clever]2092-a very nice young fellowâ€”"clever , too . "[2093-the " young ass "] But [he]2079-the young man had deliberately chosen , as [Edward Dixon]96-edward dixon had said , to chuck [his]2079-the young man chances away for the sake of literature ; piety and a sense of the main chance had alike pointed the way to a delicate course of wheedling , to a little harmless practicing on [Miss Spurry]152-miss spurry 's infirmities , to frequent compliances of a soothing nature , and [the " young ass "]2093-the " young ass "[156-agatha] had been blind to the direction of [one and the other]733-one and the other . It seemed almost right that [the vicar]415-the vicar should moralize , that [Edward Dixon]96-edward dixon should sneer , and that [Mr. Gervase]153-mr. gervase should grow purple with contempt . [Men]1715-men , [Lucian]73-lucian thought , were like [judges]736-judges , who may pity [the criminal]737-the criminal in [their]1715-men hearts , but are forced to vindicate the outraged majesty of the law by a severe sentence . [He]73-lucian felt the same considerations applied to [his]73-lucian own case ; [he]73-lucian knew that [[his]73-lucian father]341-his father should have had more money , that [his]73-lucian clothes should be newer and of a better cut , that [he]73-lucian should have gone to [the university]739-the university and made [good friends]740-good friends . If such had been [his]73-lucian fortune [he]73-lucian could have looked [[his]73-lucian fellow - men]741-his fellow - men proudly in the face , upright and unashamed . Having put on the whole armor of [a first - rate [West End tailor]743-west end tailor , with money in [his]73-lucian purse]742-a first - rate west end tailor , with money in his purse , having taken anxious thought for the morrow , and having [some useful friends]744-some useful friends and good prospects ; in such a case [he]73-lucian might have held [his]73-lucian head high in [a gentlemanly and Christian community]745-a gentlemanly and christian community . As it was [he]73-lucian had usually avoided the reproachful glance of [[his]73-lucian fellows]720-his fellows , feeling that [he]73-lucian deserved [their]720-his fellows condemnation . But [he]73-lucian had cherished for a long time [his]73-lucian romantic sentimentalities about [women]1906-women ; literary conventions borrowed from [the minor poets]748-the minor poets and pseudo - medievalists , or so [he]73-lucian thought afterwards . But , fresh from school , wearied a little with the perpetual society of [barbarian though worthy boys]749-barbarian though worthy boys , [he]73-lucian had in [his]73-lucian soul a charming image of womanhood , before which [he]73-lucian worshipped with mingled passion and devotion . It was a nude figure , perhaps , but the shining arms were to be wound about the neck of [a vanquished knight]750-a vanquished knight ; there was rest for the head of [a wounded lover]751-a wounded lover ; the hands were stretched forth to do works of pity , and the smiling lips were to murmur not love alone , but consolation in defeat . Here was the refuge for a broken heart ; here the scorn of [men]1715-men would but make tenderness increase ; here was all pity and all charity with loving - kindness . It was a delightful picture , conceived in the " come rest on this bosom , "[156-agatha] and " [a ministering angel thou]2094-a ministering angel thou "[156-agatha] manner , with touches of allurement that made devotion all the sweeter . [He]73-lucian soon found that [he]73-lucian had idealized a little ; in the affair of [young Bennett]151-bennett , while [the men]753-the men were contemptuous [the women]754-the women were virulent . [He]73-lucian had been rather fond of [Agatha Gervase]156-agatha , and [she]156-agatha , so [other ladies]755-other ladies said , had " set [her]156-agatha cap "[156-agatha] at [him]73-lucian . Now , when [he]73-lucian rebelled , and lost the goodwill of [[his]73-lucian aunt]723-his aunt , dear [Miss Spurry]152-miss spurry , [Agatha]156-agatha insulted [him]73-lucian with all conceivable rapidity . " After all , [Mr. Bennett]151-bennett , "[156-agatha] [she]156-agatha said , " [you]151-bennett will be nothing better than [a beggar]2095-a beggar ; now , will [you]151-bennett ? "[82-barnes] It was the practical side of all this that astonished [Lucian]73-lucian . [He]73-lucian saw that in reality there was no high - flown quixotism in [a woman]1770-a woman 's nature ; the smooth arms , made [he]73-lucian had thought for caressing , seemed muscular ; the hands meant for the doing of works of pity in [his]73-lucian system , appeared dexterous in the giving of " stingers , "[91-mrs. dixon] as [Barnes]82-barnes might say , and the smiling lips could sneer with great ease . Nor was [he]73-lucian more fortunate in [his]73-lucian personal experiences . As has been told , [Mrs. Dixon]91-mrs. dixon spoke of [him]73-lucian in connection with " judgments , "[91-mrs. dixon] and [the younger ladies]782-the younger ladies did not exactly cultivate [his]73-lucian acquaintance . Theoretically [they]782-the younger ladies " adored "[782-the younger ladies] books and thought poetry " too sweet , "[782-the younger ladies] but in practice [they]782-the younger ladies preferred talking about mares and fox - terriers and [[their]782-the younger ladies neighbors]783-their neighbors . [They]782-the younger ladies were [nice girls]784-nice girls enough , very like [other young ladies in [other country towns]786-other country towns , content with the teaching of [[their]782-the younger ladies parents]787-their parents , reading the Bible every morning in [[their]782-the younger ladies bedrooms]788-their bedrooms]785-other young ladies in other country towns , content with the teaching of their parents , reading the bible every morning in their bedrooms , and sitting every Sunday in [church]1624-church amongst the well - dressed " sheep "[782-the younger ladies] on the right hand . It was not [their]782-the younger ladies fault if [they]782-the younger ladies failed to satisfy the ideal of [an enthusiastic dreamy boy]790-an enthusiastic dreamy boy , and indeed , [they]782-the younger ladies would have thought [[his]73-lucian feigned woman]791-his feigned woman immodest , absurdly sentimental , a fright ( " never wears stays , [[my]161-edith dear]671-my dear "[161-edith] ) and horrid . At first [he]73-lucian was a good deal grieved at the loss of [that charming tender woman]792-that charming tender woman , the work of [his]73-lucian brain . When [the Miss Dixons]98-the dixons went haughtily by with a scornful waggle , when [the Miss Gervases]103-the gervases passed in [the wagonette]793-the wagonette laughing as the mud splashed [him]73-lucian , [the poor fellow]1631-the poor fellow would look up with a face of grief that must have been very comic ; " like a dying duck , "[166-lieutenant gatwick] as [Edith Gervase]161-edith said . [Edith]161-edith was really very pretty , and [he]73-lucian would have liked to talk to [her]792-that charming tender woman , even about fox - terriers , if [she]792-that charming tender woman would have listened . One afternoon at [the Dixons]98-the dixons ' [he]73-lucian really forced [himself]73-lucian upon [her]792-that charming tender woman , and with all the obtuseness of [an enthusiastic boy]795-an enthusiastic boy tried to discuss the [Lotus Eaters of Tennyson]154-tennyson . It was too absurd .
