"[796-the poor girl] At last [the poor girl]796-the poor girl could bear it no longer : " Yes , it 's very sweet , "[796-the poor girl] [she]796-the poor girl said at last . " When did [you]73-lucian say [you]73-lucian were going to [London]11-london , [Mr. Taylor]79-mr. taylor ? "[73-lucian] It was about the time that [his]73-lucian disappointment became known to [everybody]423-everybody , and the shot told . [He]73-lucian gave [her]792-that charming tender woman a piteous look and slunk off , " just like the dog when [he]73-lucian 's had a whipping , "[2130-a " ministering angel "] to use [Edith]161-edith 's own expression . Two or three lessons of this description produced their due effect ; and when [he]73-lucian saw [a male Dixon]798-a male dixon or [Gervase]161-edith approaching [him]73-lucian [he]73-lucian bit [his]73-lucian lip and summoned up [his]73-lucian courage . But when [he]73-lucian descried [a " ministering angel "]2130-a " ministering angel "[79-mr. taylor] [he]73-lucian made haste and hid behind a hedge or took to [the woods]331-the woods . In course of time the desire to escape became an instinct , to be followed as a matter of course ; in the same way [he]73-lucian avoided the adders on [the mountain]1921-the mountain . [His]73-lucian old ideals were almost if not quite forgotten ; [he]73-lucian knew that [the female of the bête humaine]801-the female of the bête humaine , like the adder , would in all probability sting , and [he]73-lucian therefore shrank from its trail , but without any feeling of special resentment . [The one]802-the one had a poisoned tongue as the other had a poisoned fang , and it was well to leave [them]803-them both alone . Then had come that sudden fury of rage against all humanity , as [he]73-lucian went out of [Caermaen]7-caermaen carrying the book that had been stolen from [him]73-lucian by [the enterprising Beit]804-the enterprising beit . [He]73-lucian shuddered as [he]73-lucian though of how nearly [he]73-lucian had approached the verge of madness , when [his]73-lucian eyes filled with blood and [the earth]333-the earth seemed to burn with fire . [He]73-lucian remembered how [he]73-lucian had looked up to the horizon and the sky was blotched with scarlet ; and [the earth]333-the earth was deep red , with red woods and red fields . There was something of horror in the memory , and in the vision of that wild night walk through [dim country]454-dim country , when every shadow seemed a symbol of some terrible impending doom . The murmur of [the brook]1680-the brook , the wind shrilling through the wood , the pale light flowing from the moldered trunks , and the picture of [his]73-lucian own figure fleeing and fleeting through the shades ; all these seemed unhappy things that told a story in fatal hieroglyphics . And then the life and laws of the sunlight had passed away , and the resurrection and kingdom of [the dead]809-the dead began . Though [his]73-lucian limbs were weary , [he]73-lucian had felt [his]73-lucian muscles grow strong as steel ; [a woman]1770-a woman , [one of [the hated race]812-the hated race]811-one of the hated race , was beside [him]73-lucian in the darkness , and the wild beast woke within [him]73-lucian , ravening for blood and brutal lust ; all the raging desires of the dim race from which [he]73-lucian came assailed [his]73-lucian heart . The ghosts issued out from the weird wood and from [the caves in [the hills]1660-the hills]813-the caves in the hills , besieging [him]73-lucian , as [he]73-lucian had imagined the spiritual legion besieging [Caermaen]7-caermaen , beckoning [him]73-lucian to a hideous battle and a victory that [he]73-lucian had never imagined in [his]73-lucian wildest dreams . And then out of the darkness the kind voice spoke again , and the kind hand was stretched out to draw [him]73-lucian up from the pit . It was sweet to think of that which [he]73-lucian had found at last ; [the boy]1780-the boy 's picture incarnate , all the passion and compassion of [his]73-lucian longing , all the pity and love and consolation . [She]1770-a woman , [that beautiful passionate woman offering up [her]1770-a woman beauty in sacrifice to [him]73-lucian]816-that beautiful passionate woman offering up her beauty in sacrifice to him , [she]1770-a woman was worthy indeed of [his]73-lucian worship . [He]73-lucian remembered how [his]73-lucian tears had fallen upon [her]1770-a woman breast , and how tenderly [she]1770-a woman had soothed [him]73-lucian , whispering those wonderful unknown words that sang to [his]73-lucian heart . And [she]1770-a woman had made [herself]1770-a woman defenseless before [him]73-lucian , caressing and fondling the body that had been so despised . [He]73-lucian exulted in the happy thought that [he]73-lucian had knelt down on the ground before [her]1770-a woman , and had embraced [her]1770-a woman knees and worshipped . [The woman]2029-the woman 's body had become [his]73-lucian religion ; [he]73-lucian lay awake at night looking into the darkness with hungry eyes ; wishing for a miracle , that the appearance of the so - desired form might be shaped before [him]73-lucian . And when [he]73-lucian was alone in quiet places in the wood , [he]73-lucian fell down again on [his]73-lucian knees , and even on [his]73-lucian face , stretching out vain hands in the air , as if they would feel [her]1770-a woman flesh . [[His]73-lucian father]341-his father noticed in those days that the inner pocket of [his]73-lucian coat was stuffed with papers ; [he]341-his father would see [Lucian]73-lucian walking up and down in a secret shady place at [the bottom of [the orchard]1774-the orchard]819-the bottom of the orchard , reading from [his]73-lucian sheaf of manuscript , replacing the leaves , and again drawing them out . [He]73-lucian would walk a few quick steps , and pause as if enraptured , gazing in the air as if [he]73-lucian looked through the shadows of [the world]286-the world into some sphere of glory , feigned by [his]73-lucian thought . [Mr. Taylor]79-mr. taylor was almost alarmed at the sight ; [he]79-mr. taylor concluded of course that [Lucian]73-lucian was writing a book . In the first place , there seemed something immodest in seeing the operation performed under one 's eyes ; it was as if the " make - up "[79-mr. taylor] of [a beautiful actress]822-a beautiful actress were done on the stage , in [full audience]823-full audience ; as if [one saw the rounded calves]824-one saw the rounded calves fixed in position , the fleshings drawn on , the voluptuous outlines of the figure produced by means purely mechanical , blushes mantling from the paint - pot , and the golden tresses well secured by [the wigmaker]825-the wigmaker . Books , [Mr. Taylor]79-mr. taylor thought , should swim into one 's ken mysteriously ; they should appear all printed and bound , without apparent genesis ; just as [children]826-children are suddenly told that [they]826-children have [a little sister]827-a little sister , found by [mamma]828-mamma in [the garden]1648-the garden . But [Lucian]73-lucian was not only engaged in composition ; [he]73-lucian was plainly rapturous , enthusiastic ; [Mr. Taylor]79-mr. taylor saw [him]73-lucian throw up [his]73-lucian hands , and bow [his]73-lucian head with strange gesture . [The parson]1635-the parson began to fear that [[his]1635-the parson son]1798-his son was like [some of [those mad Frenchmen of whom [he]1635-the parson had read]833-those mad frenchmen of whom he had read , [young fellows who had a sort of fury of literature]834-young fellows who had a sort of fury of literature , and gave [their]834-young fellows who had a sort of fury of literature whole lives to it , spending days over a page , and years over a book , pursuing art as [Englishmen]835-englishmen pursue money , building up a romance as if it were a business]832-some of those mad frenchmen of whom he had read , young fellows who had a sort of fury of literature , and gave their whole lives to it , spending days over a page , and years over a book , pursuing art as englishmen pursue money , building up a romance as if it were a business . Now [Mr. Taylor]79-mr. taylor held firmly by the " walking - stick "[79-mr. taylor] theory ; [he]79-mr. taylor believed that [a man of letters]836-a man of letters should have a real profession , some solid employment in life . " Get something to do , "[79-mr. taylor] [he]79-mr. taylor would have liked to say , " and then [you]2131-you can write as much as [you]2131-you please . Look at [Scott]167-scott , look at [Dickens]168-dickens and [Trollope]169-trollope . "[79-mr. taylor] And then there was the social point of view ; it might be right , or it might be wrong , but there could be no doubt that [the literary man]837-the literary man , as such , was not thought much of in English society . [Mr. Taylor]79-mr. taylor knew [his]79-mr. taylor Thackeray , and [he]79-mr. taylor remembered that old Major Pendennis , [society personified]838-society personified , did not exactly boast of [[his]838-society personified nephew]839-his nephew 's occupation . Even [Warrington]170-warrington was rather ashamed to own [his]170-warrington connection with journalism , and [Pendennis]171-pendennis [himself]171-pendennis laughed openly at [his]171-pendennis novel - writing as an agreeable way of making money , a useful appendage to the cultivation of dukes , [his]171-pendennis true business in life . This was the plain English view , and [Mr. Taylor]79-mr. taylor was no doubt right enough in thinking it good , practical common sense . Therefore when [he]79-mr. taylor saw [Lucian]73-lucian loitering and sauntering , musing amorously over [his]73-lucian manuscript , exhibiting manifest signs of that fine fury which [Britons]840-britons have ever found absurd , [he]79-mr. taylor felt grieved at heart , and more than ever sorry that [he]79-mr. taylor had not been able to send [the boy]1780-the boy to [Oxford]14-oxford . " B.N.C. would have knocked all this nonsense out of [him]73-lucian , "[79-mr. taylor] [he]79-mr. taylor thought . " [He]73-lucian would have taken a double First like [[my]865-a young officer poor father]2132-my poor father and made something of a figure in [the world]286-the world . However , it ca n't be helped . "[865-a young officer] [The poor man]842-the poor man sighed , and lit [his]842-the poor man pipe , and walked in another part of [the garden]1648-the garden . But [he]842-the poor man was mistaken in [his]842-the poor man diagnosis of the symptoms . The book that [Lucian]73-lucian had begun lay unheeded in the drawer ; it was a secret work that [he]73-lucian was engaged on , and the manuscripts that [he]73-lucian took out of that inner pocket never left [him]73-lucian day or night . [He]73-lucian slept with them next to [his]73-lucian heart , and [he]73-lucian would kiss [them]844-them when [he]73-lucian was quite alone , and pay [them]844-them such devotion as [he]73-lucian would have paid to [her]845-her whom [they]844-them symbolized . [He]73-lucian wrote on these leaves a wonderful ritual of praise and devotion ; it was the liturgy of [his]73-lucian religion . Again and again [he]73-lucian copied and recopied this madness of [a lover]846-a lover ; dallying all days over the choice of a word , searching for more exquisite phrases . No common words , no such phrases as [he]73-lucian might use in a tale would suffice ; the sentences of worship must stir and be quickened , they must glow and burn , and be decked out as with rare work of jewelry . Every part of that holy and beautiful body must be adored ; [he]73-lucian sought for terms of extravagant praise , [he]73-lucian bent [his]73-lucian soul and mind low before [her]845-her , licking the dust under [her]845-her feet , abased and yet rejoicing as [a Templar]847-a templar before the image of [Baphomet]172-baphomet . [He]73-lucian exulted more especially in the knowledge that there was nothing of the conventional or common in [his]73-lucian ecstasy ; [he]73-lucian was not [the fervent , adoring lover of [Tennyson]154-tennyson 's poems , who loves with passion and yet with a proud respect , with the love always of [a gentleman]1746-a gentleman for [a lady]850-a lady]848-the fervent , adoring lover of tennyson 's poems , who loves with passion and yet with a proud respect , with the love always of a gentleman for a lady . [Annie]75-annie was not [a lady]850-a lady ; [the Morgans]173-the morgans had farmed [[their]173-the morgans land]852-their land for hundreds of years ; [they]173-the morgans were what [Miss Gervase]174-miss gervase and [Miss Colley]164-miss colley and the rest of [them]173-the morgans called [common people]853-common people . [[Tennyson]154-tennyson 's noble gentleman]854-tennyson 's noble gentleman thought of [[their]854-tennyson 's noble gentleman ladies]855-their ladies with something of reticence ; [they]854-tennyson 's noble gentleman imagined [them]855-their ladies dressed in flowing and courtly robes , walking with slow dignity ; [they]854-tennyson 's noble gentleman dreamed of [them]855-their ladies as always stately , [the future mistresses of [[their]855-their ladies houses]857-their houses]856-the future mistresses of their houses , [mothers of [[their]855-their ladies heirs]859-their heirs]858-mothers of their heirs . [Such lovers]860-such lovers bowed , but not too low , remembering [their]860-such lovers own honor , before [those who were to be equal companions]861-those who were to be equal companions and [friends]862-friends as well as [wives]863-wives . It was not such conceptions as these that [he]864-he embodied in the amazing emblems of [his]864-he ritual ; [he]864-he was not , [he]864-he told [himself]864-he , [a young officer]865-a young officer , " something in [the city]1961-the city , "[875-the modest salesman doing his best to spare their blushes] or [a rising barrister]866-a rising barrister engaged to [a Miss Dixon]175-a miss dixon or [a Miss Gervase]174-miss gervase . [He]864-he had not thought of looking out for [a nice little house]867-a nice little house in [a good residential suburb where [they]869-they would have pleasant society]868-a good residential suburb where they would have pleasant society ; there were to be no consultations about wall - papers , or jocose whispers from [friends]862-friends as to the necessity of having [a room that would do for [a nursery]872-a nursery]871-a room that would do for a nursery . [No glad young thing]873-no glad young thing had leant on [his]864-he arm while [they]869-they chose [the suite]874-the suite in white enamel , and china for " [[our]869-they bedroom]2135-our bedroom , "[876-her] [the modest salesman doing [his]875-the modest salesman doing his best to spare their blushes best to spare [their]869-they blushes]875-the modest salesman doing his best to spare their blushes . When [Edith Gervase]161-edith married [she]876-her would get [mamma]828-mamma to look out for [two really good servants]878-two really good servants , " as [we]869-they must begin quietly , "[876-her] and [mamma]828-mamma would make sure that the drains and everything were right . Then [[her]876-her " girl friends]2136-her " girl friends "[876-her] would come on a certain solemn day to see all [her]876-her " lovely things . "[876-her] " Two dozen of everything ! "[876-her] " Look , [Ethel]176-ethel , did [you]176-ethel ever see such ducky frills ? "[876-her] " And [that insertion]2137-that insertion , is n't it quite too sweet ? "[876-her] " [[My]876-her dear]671-my dear [Edith]161-edith , [you]161-edith are [a lucky girl]2139-a lucky girl . "[876-her] " All the underlinen specially made by [Madame Lulu]125-madame lulu ! "[876-her] " What delicious things ! "[876-her] " [I]876-her hope [he]876-her knows what a prize [he]876-her is winning . "[876-her] " Oh ! do look at those lovely ribbon - bows ! "[876-her] " [[You]161-edith darling]2140-you darling , how happy [you]161-edith must be . "[876-her] " Real [Valenciennes]23-valenciennes ! "[880-the lady] Then a whisper in [the lady]880-the lady 's ear , and [her]880-the lady reply , " Oh , do n't , [Nelly]177-nelly ! "[828-mamma] So [they]881-they would chirp over [their]881-they treasures , as in [Rabelais]246-rabelais [they]881-they chirped over [their]881-they cups ; and every thing would be done in due order till the wedding - day , when [mamma]828-mamma , who had strained [her]828-mamma sinews and the commandments to bring the match about , would weep and look indignantly at [the unhappy bridegroom]883-the unhappy bridegroom . " [I]828-mamma hope [you]177-nelly 'll be kind to [her]884-the bride , [Robert]115-herbert . "[828-mamma] Then in a rapid whisper to [the bride]884-the bride : " Mind , [you]177-nelly insist on [Wyman]178-wyman 's flushing the drains when [you]177-nelly come back ; [servants]2141-servants are so careless and dirty too . Do n't let [him]178-wyman go about by [himself]178-wyman in [Paris]25-paris . [Men]1715-men are so queer , [one]1691-one never knows . [You]177-nelly have got the pills ? "[828-mamma] And aloud , after these secreta , " God bless [you]177-nelly , [[my]73-lucian dear]671-my dear ; good - bye ! cluck , cluck , good - bye ! "[73-lucian] There were stranger things written in the manuscript pages that [Lucian]73-lucian cherished , sentences that burnt and glowed like " coals of fire which hath a most vehement flame . "[589-the firm] There were phrases that stung and tingled as [he]73-lucian wrote them , and sonorous words poured out in ecstasy and rapture , as in some of the old litanies . [He]73-lucian hugged the thought that a great part of what [he]73-lucian had invented was in the true sense of the word occult : page after page might have been read aloud to the uninitiated without betraying the inner meaning . [He]73-lucian dreamed night and day over these symbols , [he]73-lucian copied and recopied the manuscript nine times before [he]73-lucian wrote it out fairly in a little book which [he]73-lucian made [himself]73-lucian of a skin of creamy vellum . In [his]73-lucian mania for acquirements that should be entirely useless [he]73-lucian had gained some skill in illumination , or limning as [he]73-lucian preferred to call it , always choosing the obscurer word as the obscurer arts . First [he]73-lucian set [himself]73-lucian to the severe practice of the text ; [he]73-lucian spent many hours and days of toil in struggling to fashion the serried columns of black letter , writing and rewriting till [he]73-lucian could shape the massive character with firm true hand . [He]73-lucian cut [his]73-lucian quills with the patience of [a monk in the scriptorium]885-a monk in the scriptorium , shaving and altering the nib , lightening and increasing the pressure and flexibility of the points , till the pen satisfied [him]73-lucian , and gave a stroke both broad and even . Then [he]73-lucian made experiments in inks , searching for some medium that would rival the glossy black letter of the old manuscripts ; and not till [he]73-lucian could produce a fair page of text did [he]73-lucian turn to the more entrancing labor of the capitals and borders and ornaments . [He]73-lucian mused long over the Lombardic letters , as glorious in their way as [a cathedral]886-a cathedral , and trained [his]73-lucian hand to execute the bold and flowing lines ; and then there was the art of the border , blossoming in fretted splendor all about the page . [[His]73-lucian cousin]1735-his cousin , [Miss Deacon]90-miss deacon , called it all a great waste of time , and [[his]73-lucian father]341-his father thought [he]73-lucian would have done much better in trying to improve [his]73-lucian ordinary handwriting , which was both ugly and illegible . Indeed , there seemed but a poor demand for the limner 's art . [He]73-lucian sent some specimens of [his]73-lucian skill to [an " artistic firm "[589-the firm] in [London]11-london]889-an " artistic firm " in london ; a verse of the " Maud , "[589-the firm] curiously emblazoned , and a Latin hymn with the notes pricked on a red stave . [The firm]589-the firm wrote civilly , telling [him]73-lucian that [his]73-lucian work , though good , was not what [they]589-the firm wanted , and enclosing an illuminated text . " [We]589-the firm have great demand for this sort of thing , "[589-the firm] [they]589-the firm concluded , " and if [you]73-lucian care to attempt something in this style [we]589-the firm should be pleased to look at it . "[589-the firm] The said text was " [Thou]2145-thou , [God]140-god , seest [me]589-the firm . "[589-the firm] The letter was of a degraded form , bearing much the same relation to the true character as a " churchwarden gothic "[90-miss deacon] building does to [Canterbury Cathedral]26-canterbury cathedral ; the colours were varied . The initial was pale gold , the h pink , the o black , the u blue , and the first letter was somehow connected with a bird 's nest containing the young of the pigeon , who were waited on by the female bird . " What a pretty text , "[90-miss deacon] said [Miss Deacon]90-miss deacon . " [I]73-lucian should like to nail it up in [[my]73-lucian room]2146-my room . Why do n't [you]73-lucian try to do something like that , [Lucian]73-lucian ? [You]73-lucian might make something by it . "[73-lucian] " [I]73-lucian sent [them]589-the firm these , "[73-lucian] said [Lucian]73-lucian , " but they do n't like them much . "[90-miss deacon] " [[My]90-miss deacon dear boy]2147-my dear boy ! [I]90-miss deacon should think not ! Like them ! What were [you]73-lucian thinking of to draw those queer stiff flowers all round the border ? [Roses]179-roses ? They do n't look like roses at all events . Where do [you]73-lucian get such ideas from ? "[90-miss deacon] " But the design is appropriate ; look at the words . "[90-miss deacon] " [[My]90-miss deacon dear]671-my dear [Lucian]73-lucian , [I]90-miss deacon ca n't read the words ; it 's such a queer old - fashioned writing . Look how plain that text is ; [one]1691-one can see what it 's about . And this other one ; [I]90-miss deacon ca n't make it out at all . "[90-miss deacon] " It 's a Latin hymn . "[90-miss deacon] " A Latin hymn ? Is it a Protestant hymn ? [I]891-her cousin may be old - fashioned , but Hymns Ancient and Modern is quite good enough for [me]891-her cousin . This is the music , [I]891-her cousin suppose ? But , [[my]891-her cousin dear boy]2147-my dear boy , there are only four lines , and who ever heard of notes shaped like that : [you]73-lucian have made some square and some diamond - shape ? Why did n't [you]73-lucian look in [[your]73-lucian poor mother]2151-your poor mother 's old music ? It 's in the ottoman in [the drawing - room]2152-the drawing - room . [I]891-her cousin could have shown [you]73-lucian how to make the notes ; there are crotchets , [you]73-lucian know , and quavers . "[891-her cousin] [Miss Deacon]90-miss deacon laid down the illuminated [Urbs Beata]180-urbs beata in despair ; [she]90-miss deacon felt convinced that [[her]90-miss deacon cousin]891-her cousin was " next door to [an idiot]2153-an idiot . "[891-her cousin] And [he]891-her cousin went out into [the garden]1648-the garden and raged behind a hedge . [He]891-her cousin broke two flower - pots and hit an apple - tree very hard with [his]891-her cousin stick , and then , feeling more calm , wondered what was the use in trying to do anything . [He]891-her cousin would not have put the thought into words , but in [his]891-her cousin heart [he]891-her cousin was aggrieved that [[his]891-her cousin cousin]1735-his cousin liked the pigeons and the text , and did not like [his]891-her cousin emblematical roses and the Latin hymn . [He]891-her cousin knew [he]891-her cousin had taken great pains over the work , and that it was well done , and being still [a young man]1897-a young man [he]891-her cousin expected praise . [He]891-her cousin found that in [this hard world]895-this hard world there was a lack of appreciation ; a critical spirit seemed abroad . If [he]891-her cousin could have been scientifically observed as [he]891-her cousin writhed and smarted under the strictures of " [the old fool]2154-the old fool , "[181-mamma] as [he]891-her cousin rudely called [[his]891-her cousin cousin]1735-his cousin , the spectacle would have been extremely diverting . [Little boys]897-little boys sometimes enjoy a very similar entertainment ; either with [their]897-little boys tiny fingers or with [mamma]828-mamma 's nail scissors [they]897-little boys gradually deprive a fly of its wings and legs . The odd gyrations and queer thin buzzings of the creature as it spins comically round and round never fail to provide a fund of harmless amusement . [Lucian]73-lucian , indeed , fancied [himself]73-lucian [a very ill - used individual]899-a very ill - used individual ; but [he]73-lucian should have tried to imitate the nervous organization of the flies , which , as [mamma]181-mamma says , " ca n't really feel . "[90-miss deacon] But now , as [he]891-her cousin prepared the vellum leaves , [he]891-her cousin remembered [his]891-her cousin art with joy ; [he]891-her cousin had not labored to do beautiful work in vain . [He]891-her cousin read over [his]891-her cousin manuscript once more , and thought of the designing of the pages . [He]891-her cousin made sketches on furtive sheets of paper , and hunted up books in [[[his]891-her cousin father]341-his father 's library]901-his father 's library for suggestions . There were books about architecture , and medieval iron work , and brasses which contributed hints for adornment ; and not content with mere pictures [he]891-her cousin sought in [the woods]331-the woods and hedges , scanning the strange forms of trees , and the poisonous growth of great water - plants , and the parasite twining of honeysuckle and briony . In one of these rambles [he]891-her cousin discovered a red earth which [he]891-her cousin made into a pigment , and [he]891-her cousin found in the unctuous juice of a certain fern an ingredient which [he]891-her cousin thought made [his]891-her cousin black ink still more glossy . [His]891-her cousin book was written all in symbols , and in the same spirit of symbolism [he]891-her cousin decorated it , causing wonderful foliage to creep about the text , and showing the blossom of certain mystical flowers , with emblems of strange creatures , caught and bound in rose thickets . All was dedicated to love and [a lover]846-a lover 's madness , and there were songs in it which haunted [him]891-her cousin with their lilt and refrain . When the book was finished it replaced the loose leaves as [his]891-her cousin constant companion by day and night . Three times a day [he]891-her cousin repeated [his]891-her cousin ritual to [himself]891-her cousin , seeking out [the loneliest places in [the woods]331-the woods]904-the loneliest places in the woods , or going up to [[his]891-her cousin room]632-his room ; and from the fixed intentness and rapture of [his]891-her cousin gaze , [the father]2070-the father thought [him]891-her cousin still severely employed in the questionable process of composition . At night [he]891-her cousin contrived to wake for [his]891-her cousin strange courtship ; and [he]891-her cousin had a peculiar ceremony when [he]891-her cousin got up in the dark and lit [his]891-her cousin candle . From [a steep and wild hillside]908-a steep and wild hillside , not far from [the house]1762-the house , [he]891-her cousin had cut from time to time five large boughs of spiked and prickly gorse . [He]891-her cousin had brought them into [the house]1762-the house , one by one , and had hidden them in the big box that stood beside [his]891-her cousin bed . Often [he]891-her cousin woke up weeping and murmuring to [himself]891-her cousin the words of one of [his]891-her cousin songs , and then when [he]891-her cousin had lit the candle , [he]891-her cousin would draw out the gorse - boughs , and place them on the floor , and taking off [his]891-her cousin nightgown , gently lay [himself]891-her cousin down on the bed of thorns and spines . Lying on [his]891-her cousin face , with the candle and the book before [him]891-her cousin , [he]891-her cousin would softly and tenderly repeat the praises of [[his]891-her cousin dear]911-his dear , dear [Annie]75-annie , and as [he]891-her cousin turned over page after page , and saw the raised gold of the majuscules glow and flame in the candle - light , [he]891-her cousin pressed the thorns into [his]891-her cousin flesh . At such moments [he]891-her cousin tasted in all its acute savor the joy of physical pain ; and after two or three experiences of such delights [he]891-her cousin altered [his]891-her cousin book , making a curious sign in vermilion on the margin of the passages where [he]891-her cousin was to inflict on [himself]891-her cousin this sweet torture . Never did [he]891-her cousin fail to wake at the appointed hour , a strong effort of will broke through all the heaviness of sleep , and [he]891-her cousin would rise up , joyful though weeping , and reverently set [his]891-her cousin thorny bed upon the floor , offering [his]891-her cousin pain with [his]891-her cousin praise . When [he]891-her cousin had whispered the last word , and had risen from the ground , [his]891-her cousin body would be all freckled with drops of blood ; [he]891-her cousin used to view the marks with pride . Here and there a spine would be left deep in the flesh , and [he]891-her cousin would pull these out roughly , tearing through the skin . On some nights when [he]891-her cousin had pressed with more fervor on the thorns [his]891-her cousin thighs would stream with blood , red beads standing out on the flesh , and trickling down to [his]891-her cousin feet . [He]891-her cousin had some difficulty in washing away the bloodstains so as not to leave any traces to attract the attention of [the servant]912-the servant ; and after a time [he]891-her cousin returned no more to [[his]891-her cousin bed]913-his bed when [his]891-her cousin duty had been accomplished . For a coverlet [he]891-her cousin had a dark rug , a good deal worn , and in this [he]891-her cousin would wrap [his]891-her cousin naked bleeding body , and lie down on the hard floor , well content to add an aching rest to the account of [his]891-her cousin pleasures . [He]891-her cousin was covered with scars , and those that healed during the day were torn open afresh at night ; the pale olive skin was red with the angry marks of blood , and the graceful form of [the young man]2079-the young man appeared like the body of [a tortured martyr]915-a tortured martyr . [He]891-her cousin grew thinner and thinner every day , for [he]891-her cousin ate but little ; the skin was stretched on the bones of [his]891-her cousin face , and the black eyes burnt in dark purple hollows . [[His]891-her cousin relations]916-his relations noticed that [he]891-her cousin was not looking well . " Now , [Lucian]73-lucian , it 's perfect madness of [you]73-lucian to go on like this , "[90-miss deacon] said [Miss Deacon]90-miss deacon , one morning at breakfast . " Look how [your]73-lucian hand shakes ; [some people]468-some people would say that [you]73-lucian have been taking brandy . And all that [you]73-lucian want is a little medicine , and yet [you]73-lucian wo n't be advised . [You]73-lucian know it 's not [my]91-mrs. dixon fault ; [I]91-mrs. dixon have asked [you]73-lucian to try [Dr. Jelly]182-dr. jelly 's Cooling Powders again and again . "[91-mrs. dixon] [He]891-her cousin remembered the forcible exhibition of the powders when [he]891-her cousin was [a boy]1771-a boy , and felt thankful that those days were over . [He]891-her cousin only grinned at [[his]891-her cousin cousin]1735-his cousin and swallowed a great cup of strong tea to steady [his]891-her cousin nerves , which were shaky enough . [Mrs. Dixon]91-mrs. dixon saw [him]891-her cousin one day in [Caermaen]7-caermaen ; it was very hot , and [he]891-her cousin had been walking rather fast . The scars on [his]891-her cousin body burnt and tingled , and [he]891-her cousin tottered as [he]891-her cousin raised [his]891-her cousin hat to [[the vicar]415-the vicar 's wife]416-the vicar 's wife . [She]91-mrs. dixon decided without further investigation that [he]891-her cousin must have been drinking in [public - houses]921-public - houses . " It seems a mercy that poor [Mrs. Taylor]183-mrs. taylor was taken , "[91-mrs. dixon] [she]91-mrs. dixon said to [[her]91-mrs. dixon husband]490-her husband . " [She]183-mrs. taylor has certainly been spared a great deal . [That wretched young man]2156-that wretched young man passed [me]92-mr. dixon this afternoon ; [he]891-her cousin was quite intoxicated . "[92-mr. dixon] " How very said , "[91-mrs. dixon] said [Mr. Dixon]92-mr. dixon . " A little port , [[my]91-mrs. dixon dear]671-my dear ? "[91-mrs. dixon] " Thank [you]550-the doctor , [Merivale]135-merivale , [I]91-mrs. dixon will have another glass of sherry . [Dr. Burrows]88-dr. burrows is always scolding [me]91-mrs. dixon and saying [I]91-mrs. dixon must take something to keep up [my]91-mrs. dixon energy , and this sherry is so weak . "[91-mrs. dixon] [The Dixons]98-the dixons were not teetotalers . [They]923-they regretted it deeply , and blamed [the doctor]550-the doctor , who " insisted on some stimulant . "[92-mr. dixon] However , there was some consolation in trying to convert [the parish]1742-the parish to total abstinence , or , as [they]923-they curiously called it , temperance . [Old women]926-old women were warned of the sin of taking a glass of beer for supper ; [aged laborers]927-aged laborers were urged to try Cork - ho , the new temperance drink ; an uncouth beverage , styled coffee , was dispensed at [the reading - room]928-the reading - room . [Mr. Dixon]92-mr. dixon preached an eloquent " temperance "[92-mr. dixon] sermon , soon after the above conversation , taking as [his]92-mr. dixon text : Beware of the leaven of [the Pharisees]184-the pharisees . In [his]92-mr. dixon discourse [he]92-mr. dixon showed that fermented liquor and leaven had much in common , that beer was at the present day " put away "[92-mr. dixon] during Passover by [the strict Jews]929-the strict jews ; and in a moving peroration [he]92-mr. dixon urged [[his]92-mr. dixon dear brethren]930-his dear brethren , " and more especially [those amongst [us]931-us who are poor in [this world]2159-this world 's goods]2158-those amongst us who are poor in this world 's goods , "[91-mrs. dixon] to beware indeed of that evil leaven which was sapping the manhood of [[our]931-us nation]932-our nation . [Mrs. Dixon]91-mrs. dixon cried after [church]1624-church : " Oh , [Merivale]135-merivale , what a beautiful sermon ! How earnest [you]135-merivale were . [I]550-the doctor hope it will do good . "[550-the doctor] [Mr. Dixon]92-mr. dixon swallowed [his]92-mr. dixon port with great decorum , but [[his]92-mr. dixon wife]934-his wife fuddled [herself]934-his wife every evening with cheap sherry . [She]934-his wife was quite unaware of the fact , and sometimes wondered in a dim way why [she]934-his wife always had to scold [the children]2038-the children after dinner . And so strange things sometimes happened in [the nursery]936-the nursery , and now and then [the children]2038-the children looked queerly at [one another]2011-one another after [a red - faced woman]939-a red - faced woman had gone out , panting . [Lucian]73-lucian knew nothing of [[his]73-lucian accuser]940-his accuser 's trials , but [he]73-lucian was not long in hearing of [his]73-lucian own intoxication . The next time [he]73-lucian went down to [Caermaen]7-caermaen [he]73-lucian was hailed by [the doctor]550-the doctor . " Been drinking again today ? "[73-lucian] " No , "[73-lucian] said [Lucian]73-lucian in a puzzled voice . " What do [you]550-the doctor mean ? "[550-the doctor] " Oh , well , if [you]550-the doctor have n't , that 's all right , as [you]550-the doctor 'll be able to take a drop with [me]550-the doctor . Come along in ? "[550-the doctor] Over the whisky and pipes [Lucian]73-lucian heard of the evil rumors affecting [his]73-lucian character . " [Mrs. Dixon]91-mrs. dixon assured [me]73-lucian [you]73-lucian were staggering from one side of [the street]1858-the street to the other . [You]73-lucian quite frightened [her]91-mrs. dixon , [she]91-mrs. dixon said . Then [she]91-mrs. dixon asked [me]73-lucian if [I]73-lucian recommended [her]91-mrs. dixon to take one or two ounces of spirit at bedtime for the palpitation ; and of course [I]73-lucian told [her]91-mrs. dixon two would be better . [I]73-lucian have [my]73-lucian living to make here , [you]73-lucian know . And upon [my]73-lucian word , [I]73-lucian think [she]91-mrs. dixon wants it ; [she]91-mrs. dixon 's always gurgling inside like waterworks . [I]73-lucian wonder how old [Dixon]91-mrs. dixon can stand it . "[73-lucian] " [I]73-lucian like ' ounces of spirit , ' "[73-lucian] said [Lucian]73-lucian . " That 's taking it medicinally , [I]73-lucian suppose . [I]73-lucian 've often heard of [ladies who have to ' take it medicinally ']2161-ladies who have to ' take it medicinally ' ; and that 's how it 's done ? "[73-lucian] " That 's it . ' [Dr Burrows]185-dr burrows wo n't listen to [me]550-the doctor ' : ' [I]550-the doctor tell [him]185-dr burrows how [I]550-the doctor dislike the taste of spirits , but [he]185-dr burrows says they are absolutely necessary for [my]550-the doctor constitution ' : ' [[my]550-the doctor medical man]2162-my medical man insists on something at bedtime ' ; that 's the style . "[550-the doctor] [Lucian]73-lucian laughed gently ; [all these people]942-all these people had become indifferent to [him]73-lucian ; [he]73-lucian could no longer feel savage indignation at [their]942-all these people little hypocrisies and malignancies . [Their]942-all these people voices uttering calumny , and morality , and futility had become like the thin shrill angry note of a gnat on a summer evening ; [he]73-lucian had [his]73-lucian own thoughts and [his]73-lucian own life , and [he]73-lucian passed on without heeding . " [You]73-lucian come down to [Caermaen]7-caermaen pretty often , do n't [you]73-lucian ? "[550-the doctor] said [the doctor]550-the doctor . " [I]942-all these people 've seen [you]73-lucian two or three times in the last fortnight . "[942-all these people] " Yes , [I]550-the doctor enjoy the walk . "[550-the doctor] " Well , look [me]158-mrs. gervase up whenever [you]550-the doctor like , [you]550-the doctor know . [I]158-mrs. gervase am often in just at this time , and a chat with [a human being]2163-a human being is n't bad , now and then . It 's a change for [me]158-mrs. gervase ; [I]158-mrs. gervase 'm often afraid [I]158-mrs. gervase shall lose [[my]158-mrs. gervase patients]2164-my patients . "[158-mrs. gervase] [The doctor]550-the doctor had the weakness of these terrible puns , dragged headlong into the conversation . [He]550-the doctor sometimes exhibited them before [Mrs. Gervase]158-mrs. gervase , who would smile in a faint and dignified manner , and say : " Ah , [I]550-the doctor see . Very amusing indeed . [We]2165-we had [an old coachmen]2166-an old coachmen once who was very clever , [I]550-the doctor believe , at that sort of thing , but [Mr. Gervase]153-mr. gervase was obliged to send [him]2166-an old coachmen away , the laughter of [the other domestics]2167-the other domestics was so very boisterous . "[550-the doctor] [Lucian]73-lucian laughed , not boisterously , but good - humouredly , at [the doctor]550-the doctor 's joke . [He]73-lucian liked [Burrows]185-dr burrows , feeling that [he]185-dr burrows was [a man]687-a man and not an automatic gabbling machine . " [You]73-lucian look a little pulled down , "[550-the doctor] said [the doctor]550-the doctor , when [Lucian]73-lucian rose to go . " No , [you]73-lucian do n't want [my]1915-the " healthy " boy medicine . Plenty of beef and beer will do [you]73-lucian more good than drugs . [I]1915-the " healthy " boy daresay it 's the hot weather that has thinned [you]73-lucian a bit . Oh , [you]73-lucian 'll be all right again in a month . "[1915-the " healthy " boy] As [Lucian]73-lucian strolled out of [the town]387-the town on [his]73-lucian way [home]308-home , [he]73-lucian passed [a small crowd of urchins assembled at the corner of [an orchard]951-an orchard]950-a small crowd of urchins assembled at the corner of an orchard . [They]950-a small crowd of urchins assembled at the corner of an orchard were enjoying [themselves]950-a small crowd of urchins assembled at the corner of an orchard immensely . [The " healthy "[953-it] boy]1915-the " healthy " boy , the same whom [he]1915-the " healthy " boy had seen some weeks ago operating on a cat , seemed to have recognized [his]1915-the " healthy " boy selfishness in keeping [his]1915-the " healthy " boy amusements to [himself]1915-the " healthy " boy . [He]1915-the " healthy " boy had found a poor lost puppy , a little creature with bright pitiful eyes , almost human in [their]950-a small crowd of urchins assembled at the corner of an orchard fond , friendly gaze . [It]953-it was not a well - bred little dog ; it was certainly not that famous puppy " by [Vick]186-vick out of [Wasp]22-wasp "[957-the leader] ; it had rough hair and a foolish long tail which it wagged beseechingly , at once deprecating severity and asking kindness . The poor animal had evidently been used to gentle treatment ; it would look up in [a boy]1771-a boy 's face , and give a leap , fawning on [him]1771-a boy , and then bark in a small doubtful voice , and cower a moment on the ground , astonished perhaps at the strangeness , the bustle and animation . [The boys]422-the boys were beside [themselves]422-the boys with eagerness ; there was quite a babble of voices , arguing , discussing , suggesting . [Each one]956-each one had a plan of [his]956-each one own which [he]956-each one brought before [the leader]957-the leader , [a stout and sturdy youth]958-a stout and sturdy youth . " Drown [him]953-it ! What be [you]1771-a boy thinkin ' of , [mun]2168-mun ? "[957-the leader] [he]957-the leader was saying . " ' Tain't no sport at all . [You]1771-a boy shut [your]1771-a boy mouth , [gwaes]2169-gwaes . Be [you]1771-a boy goin' to ask [[your]1771-a boy mother]2170-your mother for the boiling - water ? Is , [Bob Williams]133-williams , [I]957-the leader do know all that : but where be [you]1771-a boy a - going to get the fire from ? Be quiet , [mun]2168-mun , ca n't [you]1771-a boy ? [Thomas Trevor]187-thomas trevor , be this dog [yourn]187-thomas trevor or [mine]957-the leader ? "[957-the leader] [He]959-he was [a born leader of [men]1715-men]960-a born leader of men . A singular depression and lowness of spirit showed itself on [the boys]422-the boys ' faces . [They]422-the boys recognized that the threat might very possibly be executed , and [their]422-the boys countenances were at once composed to humble attention . [The puppy]963-the puppy was still cowering on the ground in the midst of [them]422-the boys : [one or two]964-one or two tried to relieve the tension of [their]422-the boys feelings by kicking [him]963-the puppy in the belly with [their]422-the boys hobnail boots . It cried out with the pain and writhed a little , but the poor little beast did not attempt to bite or even snarl . [It]963-the puppy looked up with those beseeching friendly eyes at [its persecutors]965-its persecutors , and fawned on [them]965-its persecutors again , and tried to wag its tail and be merry , pretending to play with a straw on [the road]287-the road , hoping perhaps to win a little favor in that way . [The leader]957-the leader saw the moment for [his]957-the leader master - stroke . [He]957-the leader slowly drew a piece of rope from [his]957-the leader pocket . " What do [you]957-the leader say to that , [mun]2168-mun ? Now , [Thomas Trevor]187-thomas trevor ! [We]422-the boys 'll hang [him]963-the puppy over that there bough . Will that suit [you]957-the leader , [Bobby Williams]133-williams ? "[957-the leader] There was a great shriek of approval and delight . All was again bustle and animation . " [I]957-the leader 'll tie it round [his]963-the puppy neck ? "[957-the leader] " Get out , [mun]2168-mun , [you]957-the leader do n't know how it be done . "[963-the puppy] " Suppose [we]2174-we were to tie up [his]963-the puppy mouth first ? "[1915-the " healthy " boy] [The puppy]963-the puppy still fawned and curried favor , and wagged that sorry tail , and lay down crouching on one side on the ground , sad and sorry in [his]963-the puppy heart , but still with a little gleam of hope ; for now and again [he]963-the puppy tried to play , and put up [his]963-the puppy face , praying with those fond , friendly eyes . And then at last [his]963-the puppy gambols and poor efforts for mercy ceased , and [he]963-the puppy lifted up [his]963-the puppy wretched voice in one long dismal whine of despair . But [he]963-the puppy licked the hand of [the boy that tied the noose]969-the boy that tied the noose . [He]963-the puppy was slowly and gently swung into the air as [Lucian]73-lucian went by unheeded ; [he]73-lucian struggled , and [his]73-lucian legs twisted and writhed . [The " healthy "[978-a little girl] boy]1915-the " healthy " boy pulled the rope , and [[his]1915-the " healthy " boy friends]764-his friends danced and shouted with glee . As [Lucian]73-lucian turned the corner , the poor dangling body was swinging to and fro , the puppy was dying , but [he]963-the puppy still kicked a little . [Lucian]73-lucian went on [his]73-lucian way hastily , and shuddering with disgust . [The young of [the human creature]973-the human creature]972-the young of the human creature were really too horrible ; [they]972-the young of the human creature defiled [the earth]333-the earth , and made existence unpleasant , as the pulpy growth of a noxious and obscene fungus spoils an agreeable walk . The sight of those malignant little animals with mouths that uttered cruelty and filthy , with hands dexterous in torture , and feet swift to run all evil errands , had given [him]73-lucian a shock and broken up the world of strange thoughts in which [he]73-lucian had been dwelling . Yet it was no good being angry with [them]972-the young of the human creature : it was [their]972-the young of the human creature nature to be very loathsome . Only [he]73-lucian wished [they]972-the young of the human creature would go about [their]972-the young of the human creature hideous amusements in [[their]972-the young of the human creature own back gardens]975-their own back gardens where [nobody]1639-nobody could see [them]972-the young of the human creature at work ; it was too bad that [he]73-lucian should be interrupted and offended in [a quiet country road]977-a quiet country road . [He]73-lucian tried to put the incident out of [his]73-lucian mind , as if the whole thing had been a disagreeable story , and the visions amongst which [he]73-lucian wished to move were beginning to return , when [he]73-lucian was again rudely disturbed . [A little girl]978-a little girl , [a pretty child of eight or nine]979-a pretty child of eight or nine , was coming along [the lane]278-the lane to meet [him]73-lucian . [She]978-a little girl was crying bitterly and looking to left and right , and calling out some word all the time . " [Jack]189-jack , [Jack]189-jack , [Jack]189-jack ! [Little Jackie]189-jack ! " [Jackie]189-jack , [Jackie]189-jack , [Jackie]189-jack ! "[978-a little girl] [She]978-a little girl came up to [Lucian]73-lucian , sobbing as if [her]978-a little girl heart would break , and dropped [him]73-lucian an old - fashioned curtsy . "[73-lucian] [He]73-lucian went on , walking as fast as [he]73-lucian could in [his]73-lucian endeavor to get beyond the noise of [the child]983-the child 's crying . It distressed [him]73-lucian , and [he]73-lucian wished to think of other things . [He]73-lucian stamped [his]73-lucian foot angrily on the ground as [he]73-lucian recalled the annoyances of the afternoon , and longed for some hermitage on [the mountains]1825-the mountains , far above the stench and the sound of humanity . A little farther , and [he]73-lucian came to [Croeswen]27-croeswen , where [the road]287-the road branched off to right and left . There was a triangular plot of grass between [the two roads]986-the two roads ; there the cross had once stood , " [the goodly and famous roode "[73-lucian] of the old local chronicle]2185-the goodly and famous roode " of the old local chronicle . The words echoed in [Lucian]73-lucian 's ears as [he]73-lucian went by on the right hand . " There were five steps that did go up to the first pace , and seven steps to the second pace , all of clene hewn ashler . And all above [it]2185-the goodly and famous roode " of the old local chronicle was most curiously and gloriously wrought with thorowgh carved work ; in the highest place was [the Holy Roode]2186-the holy roode with [Christ]190-christ upon the Cross having [Marie]76-mary on the one syde and [John]191-john on the other . And below were six splendent and glisteringe archaungels that bore up [the roode]2187-the roode , and beneath [them]2188-they in [their]2188-they stories were the most fair and noble images of [the xii Apostles]2189-the xii apostles and of divers other Saints and [Martirs]192-martirs . And in [the lowest storie]2190-the lowest storie there was a marvelous imagerie of divers Beasts , such as oxen and horses and swine , and little dogs and peacocks , all done in the finest and most curious wise , so that [they]2188-they all seemed as [they]2188-they were caught in [a Wood of Thorns]2191-a wood of thorns , the which is [their]2188-they torment of this life . And here once in the year was a marvelous solemn service , when [the parson of [Caermaen]7-caermaen]2192-the parson of caermaen came out with [the singers]2193-the singers and [all the people]2194-all the people , singing the psalm Benedicite omnia opera as [they]2188-they passed along [the road]287-the road in [their]2188-they procession . And when [they]2188-they stood at [the roode]2187-the roode [the priest]2197-the priest did there [his]2197-the priest service , making certain prayers for the beasts , and then [he]2197-the priest went up to the first pace and preached a sermon to [the people]654-the people , shewing [them]654-the people that as [[our]2199-our lord]2200-our lord [Jhu]193-jhu dyed upon the Tree of [his]193-jhu deare mercy for [us]2199-our , so [we]2199-our too owe mercy to the beasts [[his]193-jhu Creatures]2201-his creatures , for that [they]2201-his creatures are all [[his]193-jhu poor lieges]2202-his poor lieges and [silly servants]2203-silly servants . And that like as [the Holy Aungells]194-the holy aungells do [their]194-the holy aungells suit to [him]193-jhu on high , and [the Blessed xii Apostles]2204-the blessed xii apostles and [the Martirs]192-martirs , and [all the Blissful Saints]2205-all the blissful saints served [him]193-jhu aforetime on [earth]2206-earth and now praise [him]193-jhu in [heaven]2207-heaven , so also do the beasts serve [him]193-jhu , though [they]194-the holy aungells be in torment of life and below [men]1715-men . For [their]194-the holy aungells spirit goeth downward , as [Holy Writ]195-holy writ teacheth [us]2209-us . "[91-mrs. dixon] It was a quaint old record , a curious relic of what [the modern inhabitants of [Caermaen]7-caermaen]987-the modern inhabitants of caermaen called [the Dark Ages]988-the dark ages . A few of the stones that had formed the base of the cross still remained in position , grey with age , blotched with black lichen and green moss . The remainder of the famous rood had been used to mend [the roads]989-the roads , to build pigsties and [domestic offices]990-domestic offices ; it had turned Protestant , in fact . Indeed , if it had remained , [the parson of [Caermaen]7-caermaen]2192-the parson of caermaen would have had no time for the service ; the coffee - stall , [the Portuguese Missions]992-the portuguese missions , the Society for the Conversion of [the Jews]993-the jews , and important social duties took up all [his]2192-the parson of caermaen leisure . Besides , [he]2192-the parson of caermaen thought the whole ceremony unscriptural . [Lucian]73-lucian passed on [his]73-lucian way , wondering at the strange contrasts of the Middle Ages . How was it that [people who could devise so beautiful a service]994-people who could devise so beautiful a service believed in witchcraft , demoniacal possession and obsession , in the incubus and succubus , and in the Sabbath an in many other horrible absurdities ? It seemed astonishing that [anybody]1722-anybody could even pretend to credit such monstrous tales , but there could be no doubt that the dread of [old women who rode on broomsticks and liked black cats]996-old women who rode on broomsticks and liked black cats was once a very genuine terror . A cold wind blew up from [the river]1634-the river at sunset , and the scars on [his]73-lucian body began to burn and tingle . The pain recalled [his]73-lucian ritual to [him]73-lucian , and [he]73-lucian began to recite it as [he]73-lucian walked along . [He]73-lucian had cut a branch of thorn from the hedge and placed it next to [his]73-lucian skin , pressing the spikes into the flesh with [his]73-lucian hand till the warm blood ran down . [He]73-lucian felt it was an exquisite and sweet observance for [her]998-her sake ; and then [he]73-lucian thought of [the secret golden palace [he]73-lucian was building for [her]998-her]999-the secret golden palace he was building for her , [the rare and wonderful city rising in [his]73-lucian imagination]1000-the rare and wonderful city rising in his imagination . As the solemn night began to close about [the earth]333-the earth , and the last glimmer of the sun faded from [the hills]1660-the hills , [he]73-lucian gave [himself]73-lucian anew to [the woman]2029-the woman , [his]73-lucian body and [his]73-lucian mind , all that [he]73-lucian was , and all that [he]73-lucian had . In the course of the week [Lucian]73-lucian again visited [Caermaen]7-caermaen . [He]73-lucian wished to view [the amphitheatre]1952-the amphitheatre more precisely , to note the exact position of the ancient walls , to gaze up [the valley]270-the valley from certain points within [the town]387-the town , to imprint minutely and clearly on [his]73-lucian mind the surge of [the hills about [the city]1961-the city]1007-the hills about the city , and the dark tapestry of [the hanging woods]1009-the hanging woods . And [he]73-lucian lingered in [the museum]1010-the museum where the relics of the Roman occupation had been stored ; [he]73-lucian was interested in the fragments of tessellated floors , in the glowing gold of drinking cups , the curious beads of fused and colored glass , the carved amber - work , the scent - flagons that still retained the memory of unctuous odors , the necklaces , brooches , hair - pins of gold and silver , and other intimate objects which had once belonged to [Roman ladies]1011-roman ladies . One of the glass flagons , buried in damp earth for many hundred years , had gathered in [its]1012-its dark grave all the splendors of the light , and now shone like an opal with a moonlight glamour and gleams of gold and pale sunset green , and imperial purple . Then there were the wine jars of red earthenware , the memorial stones from [graves]1013-graves , and the heads of [broken gods]1014-broken gods , with fragments of occult things used in the secret rites of [Mithras]196-mithras . [Lucian]73-lucian read on the labels where all these objects were found : in [the churchyard]2085-the churchyard , beneath the turf of [the meadow]1016-the meadow , and in [the old cemetery]1017-the old cemetery near [the forest]452-the forest ; and whenever it was possible [he]73-lucian would make [his]73-lucian way to the spot of discovery , and imagine the long darkness that had hidden gold and stone and amber . All these investigations were necessary for the scheme [he]73-lucian had in view , so [he]73-lucian became for some time quite a familiar figure in [the dusty deserted streets]1019-the dusty deserted streets and in [the meadows]1658-the meadows by [the river]1634-the river . [His]73-lucian continual visits to [Caermaen]7-caermaen were a tortuous puzzle to [the inhabitants]1022-the inhabitants , who flew to [their]1022-the inhabitants windows at the sound of a step on the uneven pavements . [They]1022-the inhabitants were at a loss in [their]1022-the inhabitants conjectures ; [his]73-lucian motive for coming down three times a week must of course be bad , but it seemed undiscoverable . And [Lucian]73-lucian on [his]73-lucian side was at first a good deal put out by occasional encounters with [members of [the Gervase or Dixon or Colley tribes]1024-the gervase or dixon or colley tribes]1023-members of the gervase or dixon or colley tribes ; [he]73-lucian had often to stop and exchange a few conventional expressions , and such meetings , casual as [they]1025-they were , annoyed and distracted [him]73-lucian . [He]73-lucian was no longer infuriated or wounded by sneers of contempt or by the cackling laughter of [the young people]1026-the young people when [they]1026-the young people passed [him]73-lucian on [the road]287-the road ( [his]73-lucian hat was a shocking one and [his]73-lucian untidiness terrible ) , but such incidents were unpleasant just as the smell of a drain was unpleasant , and threw the strange mechanism of [his]73-lucian thoughts out of fear for the time . Then [he]73-lucian had been disgusted by the affair of [the boys]422-the boys and the little dog ; the loathsomeness of it had quite broken up [his]73-lucian fancies . [He]73-lucian had read books of modern occultism , and remembered some of the experiments described . [The adept]1029-the adept , it was alleged , could transfer the sense of consciousness from [his]1029-the adept brain to the foot or hand , [he]1029-the adept could annihilate the world around [him]1029-the adept and pass into another sphere . [Lucian]73-lucian wondered whether [he]73-lucian could not perform some such operation for [his]73-lucian own benefit . [Human beings]1030-human beings were constantly annoying [him]73-lucian and getting in [his]73-lucian way , was it not possible to annihilate the race , or at all events to reduce them to wholly insignificant forms ? A certain process suggested itself to [his]73-lucian mind , a work partly mental and partly physical , and after two or three experiments [he]73-lucian found to [his]73-lucian astonishment and delight that it was successful . Here , [he]73-lucian thought , [he]73-lucian had discovered one of the secrets of true magic ; this was the key to the symbolic transmutations of the Eastern tales . [The adept]1029-the adept could , in truth , change those who were obnoxious to [him]1029-the adept into harmless and unimportant shapes , not as in the letter of the old stories , by transforming [the enemy]1823-the enemy , but by transforming [himself]1029-the adept . [The magician]1033-the magician puts [men]1715-men below [him]1029-the adept by going up higher , as one looks down on [a mountain city from a loftier crag]1035-a mountain city from a loftier crag . The stones on [the road]287-the road and such petty obstacles do not trouble [the wise man]1037-the wise man on the great journey , and so [Lucian]73-lucian , when obliged to stop and converse with [his]73-lucian fellow - creatures , to listen to [their]1030-human beings poor pretences and inanities , was no more inconvenienced than when [he]73-lucian had to climb an awkward stile in the course of a walk . As for the more unpleasant manifestations of [humanity]1038-humanity ; after all they no longer concerned [him]73-lucian . [Men intent on the great purpose]1039-men intent on the great purpose did not suffer the current of [their]1039-men intent on the great purpose thoughts to be broken by the buzzing of a fly caught in a spider 's web , so why should [he]73-lucian be perturbed by the misery of a puppy in the hands of [village boys]1040-village boys ? The fly , no doubt , endured its tortures ; lying helpless and bound in those slimy bands , it cried out in its thin voice when the claws of the horrible monster fastened on it ; but its dying agonies had never vexed the reverie of [a lover]846-a lover . [Lucian]73-lucian saw no reason why [the boys]422-the boys should offend [him]73-lucian more than the spider , or why [he]73-lucian should pity the dog more than [he]73-lucian pitied the fly . The talk of [the men]753-the men and [women]1906-women might be wearisome and inept and often malignant ; but [he]73-lucian could not imagine [an alchemist]1045-an alchemist at the moment of success , [a general in the hour of victory]1046-a general in the hour of victory , or [a financier with a gigantic scheme of swindling well on [the market]1048-the market being annoyed by the buzz of insects]1047-a financier with a gigantic scheme of swindling well on the market being annoyed by the buzz of insects . The spider is , no doubt , [a very terrible brute with a hideous mouth and hairy tiger - like claws when seen through the microscope]1049-a very terrible brute with a hideous mouth and hairy tiger - like claws when seen through the microscope ; but [Lucian]73-lucian had taken away the microscope from [his]73-lucian eyes . [He]73-lucian could now walk [the streets of [Caermaen]7-caermaen]1855-the streets of caermaen confident and secure , without any dread of interruption , for at a moment 's notice the transformation could be effected . Once [Dr. Burrows]88-dr. burrows caught [him]73-lucian and made [him]73-lucian promise to attend [a bazaar that was to be held in aid of [the Hungarian Protestants]197-the hungarian protestants]1051-a bazaar that was to be held in aid of the hungarian protestants ; [Lucian]73-lucian assented the more willingly as [he]73-lucian wished to pay a visit to [certain curious mounds on [a hill a little way out of [the town]387-the town]1053-a hill a little way out of the town]1052-certain curious mounds on a hill a little way out of the town , and [he]73-lucian calculated on slinking off from [the bazaar]1055-the bazaar early in the afternoon . [Lord Beamys]102-lord beamys was visiting [Sir Vivian Ponsonby]198-sir vivian ponsonby , [a local magnate]1056-a local magnate , and had kindly promised to drive over and declare [the bazaar]1055-the bazaar open . It was a solemn moment when [the carriage]1058-the carriage drew up and [the great man]1059-the great man alighted . [He]1059-the great man was rather [an evil - looking old nobleman]1060-an evil - looking old nobleman , but [the clergy]1884-the clergy and [gentry]1062-gentry , [[their]1884-the clergy wives]1063-their wives and [sons]1064-sons and [daughters]421-daughters welcomed [him]1059-the great man with great and unctuous joy . Conversations were broken off in mid - sentence , [slow people]1066-slow people gaped , not realizing why [[their]1066-slow people friends]1067-their friends had so suddenly left [them]1066-slow people , [the Meyricks]1068-the meyricks came up hot and perspiring in fear lest [they]1068-the meyricks should be too late , [Miss Colley]164-miss colley , [a yellow virgin of austere regard]1069-a yellow virgin of austere regard , smiled largely , [Mrs. Dixon]91-mrs. dixon beckoned wildly with [her]91-mrs. dixon parasol to [the " girls "[1072-the archdeacon] who were idly strolling in a distant part of [the field]1629-the field]1070-the " girls " who were idly strolling in a distant part of the field , and [the archdeacon]1072-the archdeacon ran at full speed . Then , when all the due rites had been performed , [the company]1079-the company turned and began to walk towards [the booths of [their]1079-the company small Vanity Fair]1080-the booths of their small vanity fair . "[1083-the old lord] [The old lord]1083-the old lord was leering pleasantly and muttering to [himself]1083-the old lord : " [Some fine gals]2215-some fine gals here . "[92-mr. dixon] The pomp swept slowly across the grass : [the archdeacon]1072-the archdeacon had got hold of [Mr. Dixon]92-mr. dixon , and [they]1085-they were discussing the misdeeds of [some clergyman in [the rural deanery]1087-the rural deanery]1086-some clergyman in the rural deanery . " [I]92-mr. dixon can scarce credit it , "[92-mr. dixon] said [Mr. Dixon]92-mr. dixon . " Oh , [I]1072-the archdeacon assure [you]2212-you , there can be no doubt . There can be no question that there was a procession at [Llanfihangel]28-llanfihangel on the Sunday before Easter ; [the choir]2218-the choir and [minister]2219-minister went round [the church]2220-the church , carrying palm branches in [their]1085-they hands . "[1072-the archdeacon] " Very shocking . "[92-mr. dixon] " It has distressed [the bishop]376-the bishop . "[92-mr. dixon] The " scriptural "[92-mr. dixon] procession led by [Lord Beamys]102-lord beamys broke up when [the stalls]1088-the stalls were reached , and gathered round [the nobleman]1089-the nobleman as [he]102-lord beamys declared [the bazaar]1055-the bazaar open . [Lucian]73-lucian was sitting on a garden - seat , a little distance off , looking dreamily before [him]73-lucian . And all that [he]73-lucian saw was a swarm of flies clustering and buzzing about a lump of tainted meat that lay on the grass . The spectacle in no way interrupted the harmony of [his]73-lucian thoughts , and soon after the opening of [the bazaar]1055-the bazaar [he]73-lucian went quietly away , walking across [the fields]314-the fields in the direction of [the ancient mounds [he]73-lucian desired to inspect]1093-the ancient mounds he desired to inspect . All these journeys of [his]73-lucian to [Caermaen]7-caermaen and [[its]7-caermaen neighborhood]1094-its neighborhood had a peculiar object ; [he]73-lucian was gradually leveling to the dust the squalid kraals of modern times , and rebuilding [the splendid and golden city of [Siluria]29-siluria]1095-the splendid and golden city of siluria . All [this mystic town]1096-this mystic town was for the delight of [[his]73-lucian sweetheart]2035-his sweetheart and [himself]73-lucian ; for [her]2035-his sweetheart [the wonderful villas]1098-the wonderful villas , [the shady courts]1099-the shady courts , the magic of tessellated pavements , and the hangings of rich stuffs with their intricate and glowing patterns . [Lucian]73-lucian wandered all day through [the shining streets]1100-the shining streets , taking shelter sometimes in [the gardens]1101-the gardens beneath the dense and gloomy ilex trees , and listening to the plash and trickle of the fountains . Sometimes [he]73-lucian would look out of a window and watch the crowd and color of [the market - place]1102-the market - place , and now and again [a ship]1103-a ship came up [the river]1634-the river bringing exquisite silks and the merchandise of [unknown lands in [the Far East]30-the far east]1105-unknown lands in the far east . [He]73-lucian had made a curious and accurate map of [the town]387-the town [he]73-lucian proposed to inhabit , in which [every villa]1107-every villa was set down and named . [He]73-lucian drew [his]73-lucian lines to scale with the gravity of [a surveyor]1108-a surveyor , and studied the plan till [he]73-lucian was able to find [his]73-lucian way from [house]1643-house to [house]1643-house on the darkest summer night . On [the southern slopes about [the town]387-the town]1111-the southern slopes about the town there were vineyards , always under a glowing sun , and sometimes [he]73-lucian ventured to [the furthest ridge of [the forest]452-the forest]1113-the furthest ridge of the forest , where [the wild people]1115-the wild people still lingered , that [he]73-lucian might catch the golden gleam of [the city]1961-the city far away , as the light quivered and scintillated on the glittering tiles . And there were gardens outside [the city gates where strange and brilliant flowers grew , filling the hot air with their odor , and scenting the breeze that blew along [the streets]1118-the streets]1117-the city gates where strange and brilliant flowers grew , filling the hot air with their odor , and scenting the breeze that blew along the streets . The dull modern life was far away , and [people who saw [him]73-lucian at this period]1119-people who saw him at this period wondered what was amiss ; the abstraction of [his]73-lucian glance was obvious , even to eyes not over - sharp . But [men]1715-men and [women]1906-women had lost all [their]1122-their power of annoyance and vexation ; [they]1122-their could no longer even interrupt [his]73-lucian thought for a moment . [He]73-lucian could listen to [Mr. Dixon]92-mr. dixon with apparent attention , while [he]73-lucian was in reality enraptured by the entreating music of the double flute , played by [a girl in [the garden of [Avallaunius]31-avallaunius]1124-the garden of avallaunius]1123-a girl in the garden of avallaunius , for that was the name [he]73-lucian had taken . [Mr. Dixon]92-mr. dixon was innocently discoursing archeology , giving a brief résumé of the view expressed by [Mr. Wyndham]200-mr. wyndham at the last meeting of [the antiquarian society]1125-the antiquarian society . " There can be no doubt that [the temple of [Diana]201-diana]2225-the temple of diana stood [there]1751-there in pagan times , "[415-the vicar] [he]92-mr. dixon concluded , and [Lucian]73-lucian assented to the opinion , and asked a few questions which seemed pertinent enough . But all the time the flute notes were sounding in [his]73-lucian ears , and [the ilex]1126-the ilex threw a purple shadow on the white pavement before [[his]73-lucian villa]1127-his villa . [A boy]1771-a boy came forward from [the garden]1648-the garden ; [he]1771-a boy had been walking amongst the vines and plucking the ripe grapes , and the juice had trickled down over [his]1771-a boy breast . Standing beside [the girl]1768-the girl , unashamed in the sunlight , [he]73-lucian began to sing one of [Sappho]202-sappho 's love songs . [His]73-lucian voice was as full and rich as [a woman]1770-a woman 's , but purged of all emotion ; [he]73-lucian was an instrument of music in the flesh . [Lucian]73-lucian looked at [him]73-lucian steadily ; the white perfect body shone against the roses and the blue of the sky , clear and gleaming as marble in the glare of the sun . The words [he]73-lucian sang burned and flamed with passion , and [he]73-lucian was as unconscious of their meaning as the twin pipes of the flute . And [the girl]1768-the girl was smiling . [The vicar]415-the vicar shook hands and went on , well pleased with [his]415-the vicar remarks on the temple of [Diana]201-diana , and also with [Lucian]73-lucian 's polite interest . " [He]73-lucian is by no means wanting in intelligence , "[415-the vicar] [he]415-the vicar said to [[his]415-the vicar family]1134-his family . " A little curious in manner , perhaps , but not stupid . "[134-henrietta] " Oh , [papa]2227-papa , "[134-henrietta] said [Henrietta]134-henrietta , " do n't [you]2227-papa think [he]73-lucian is rather silly ? [He]73-lucian ca n't talk about anythingâ€”anything[204-ben - hur] interesting , [I]0-i mean . And [he]73-lucian pretends to know a lot about books , but [I]0-i heard [him]73-lucian say the other day [he]73-lucian had never read [The Prince of [the House of [David]203-david]32-the house of david or [Ben - Hur]204-ben - hur]1135-the prince of the house of david or ben - hur . Fancy ! " [The vicar]415-the vicar had not interrupted [Lucian]73-lucian . The sun still beat upon the roses , and a little breeze bore the scent of them to [his]73-lucian nostrils together with the smell of grapes and vine - leaves . [He]73-lucian had become curious in sensation , and as [he]73-lucian leant back upon the cushions covered with glistening yellow silk , [he]73-lucian was trying to analyze a strange ingredient in the perfume of the air . [He]73-lucian had penetrated far beyond the crude distinctions of modern times , beyond the rough : "[204-ben - hur] there 's a smell of roses , " "[204-ben - hur] there must be sweetbriar somewhere . " Modern perceptions of odor were , [he]73-lucian knew , far below those of [the savage]2229-the savage in delicacy . [The degraded black fellow of [Australia]33-australia]2230-the degraded black fellow of australia could distinguish odors in a way that made [the consumer of "[204-ben - hur] damper "]2231-the consumer of " damper " stare in amazement , but [the savage]2229-the savage 's sensations were all strictly utilitarian . To [Lucian]73-lucian as [he]73-lucian sat in [the cool porch]2233-the cool porch , [his]73-lucian feet on the marble , the air came laden with scents as subtly and wonderfully interwoven and contrasted as the harmonica of [a great master]2234-a great master . The stained marble of [the pavement]2235-the pavement gave a cool reminiscence of [the Italian mountain]2236-the italian mountain , the blood - red roses palpitating in the sunlight sent out an odor mystical as passion itself , and there was the hint of inebriation in the perfume of the trellised vines . Besides these , [the girl]1768-the girl 's desire and the unripe innocence of [the boy]1780-the boy were as distinct as benzoin and myrrh , both delicious and exquisite , and exhaled as freely as the scent of the roses . But there was another element that puzzled [him]73-lucian , an aromatic suggestion of [the forest]452-the forest . [He]73-lucian understood it at last ; it was the vapor of the great red pines that grew beyond [the garden]1648-the garden ; their spicy needles were burning in the sun , and the smell was as fragrant as the fume of incense blown from far . The soft entreaty of the flute and the swelling rapture of [the boy]1780-the boy 's voice beat on the air together , and [Lucian]73-lucian wondered whether there were in the nature of things any true distinction between the impressions of sound and scent and color . The violent blue of the sky , the song , and the odours seemed rather varied symbols of one mystery than distinct entities . [He]73-lucian could almost imagine that [the boy]1780-the boy 's innocence was indeed a perfume , and that the palpitating roses had become a sonorous chant . In the curious silence which followed the last notes , when [the boy]1780-the boy and [girl]2244-girl had passed under the purple ilex shadow , [he]73-lucian fell into a reverie . The fancy that sensations are symbols and not realities hovered in [his]73-lucian mind , and led [him]73-lucian to speculate as to whether they could not actually be transmuted one into another . It was possible , [he]73-lucian thought , that a whole continent of knowledge had been undiscovered ; the energies of [men]1715-men having been expended in unimportant and foolish directions . Modern ingenuity had been employed on such trifles as [locomotive engines]2246-locomotive engines , electric cables , and [cantilever bridges]2247-cantilever bridges ; on elaborate devices for bringing [uninteresting people]2248-uninteresting people nearer together ; [the ancients]2249-the ancients had been almost as foolish , because [they]2249-the ancients had mistaken the symbol for the thing signified . It was not the material banquet which really mattered , but the thought of it ; it was almost as futile to eat and take emetics and eat again as to invent telephones and high - pressure boilers . As for some other ancient methods of enjoying life , one might as well set [oneself]2250-oneself to improve calico printing at once . "[204-ben - hur] Only in [the garden of [Avallaunius]31-avallaunius]1124-the garden of avallaunius , " said [Lucian]73-lucian to [himself]73-lucian , "[204-ben - hur] is the true and exquisite science to be found . " [He]73-lucian could imagine [a man who was able to live in one sense while [he]73-lucian pleased]2251-a man who was able to live in one sense while he pleased ; to [whom , for example , every impression of touch , taste , hearing , or seeing should be translated into odor]2252-whom , for example , every impression of touch , taste , hearing , or seeing should be translated into odor ; [who at the desired kiss should be ravished with the scent of dark violets , to whom music should be the perfume of a rose - garden]2253-who at the desired kiss should be ravished with the scent of dark violets , to whom music should be the perfume of a rose - garden at dawn . When , now and again , [he]73-lucian voluntarily resumed the experience of common life , it was that [he]73-lucian might return with greater delight to [the garden in [the city of refuge]2255-the city of refuge]2254-the garden in the city of refuge . In the actual world the talk was of [Nonconformists]2256-nonconformists , [the lodger franchise]2257-the lodger franchise , and [the Stock Exchange]2258-the stock exchange ; [people]478-people were constantly reading newspapers , drinking Australian Burgundy , and doing other things equally absurd . [They]478-people either looked shocked when the fine art of pleasure was mentioned , or confused it with going to musical comedies , drinking bad whisky , and keeping late hours in disreputable and vulgar company . [He]73-lucian found to [his]73-lucian amusement that [the profligate]2260-the profligate were by many degrees duller than [the pious]2261-the pious , but that [the most tedious of all]2262-the most tedious of all were [the persons who preached promiscuity]2263-the persons who preached promiscuity , and called [their]2263-the persons who preached promiscuity system of "[204-ben - hur] pigging " the "[204-ben - hur] New Morality . " [He]73-lucian went back to [the city]1961-the city lovingly , because [it]1961-the city was built and adorned for [his]73-lucian love . As [the metaphysicians]2265-the metaphysicians insist on the consciousness of the ego as the implied basis of all thought , so [he]73-lucian knew that it was [she]2266-she in whom [he]73-lucian had found [himself]73-lucian , and through whom and for [whom all the true life existed]2267-whom all the true life existed . [He]73-lucian felt that [Annie]75-annie had taught [him]73-lucian the rare magic which had created [the garden of Avallaunius]1124-the garden of avallaunius . It was for [her]75-annie that [he]73-lucian sought strange secrets and tried to penetrate the mysteries of sensation , for [he]73-lucian could only give [her]75-annie wonderful thoughts and a wonderful life , and a poor body stained with the scars of [his]73-lucian worship . It was with this object , that of making the offering of [himself]73-lucian a worthy one , that [he]73-lucian continually searched for new and exquisite experiences . [He]73-lucian made [lovers]2269-lovers come before [him]73-lucian and confess [their]2269-lovers secrets ; [he]73-lucian pried into the inmost mysteries of innocence and shame , noting how passion and reluctance strive together for the mastery . In [the amphitheatre]1952-the amphitheatre [he]73-lucian sometimes witnessed strange entertainments in which such tales as [Daphnis]205-daphnis and [Chloe]206-chloe and The Golden Ass were performed before [him]73-lucian . These shows were always given at nighttime ; a circle of [torch - bearers]2271-torch - bearers surrounded the stage in the center , and above , all the tiers of seats were dark .
