Windows had been shut down with a crash , [he]73-lucian had noted the pattering footsteps of [people running to shelter]1243-people running to shelter , [the landlady]1223-the landlady 's voice crying to [some one]1245-some one to look at the rain coming in under the door . It was like peering into some old bituminous picture , [one]1691-one could see at last that the mere blackness resolved itself into the likeness of trees and rocks and travelers . And against this background of [[his]73-lucian room]632-his room , and the storm , and the noises of [the street]1858-the street , [his]73-lucian vision stood out illuminated , [he]73-lucian felt [he]73-lucian had descended to the very depths , into the caverns that are hollowed beneath the soul . [He]73-lucian tried vainly to record the history of [his]73-lucian impressions ; the symbols remained in [his]73-lucian memory , but the meaning was all conjecture . The next morning , when [he]73-lucian awoke , [he]73-lucian could scarcely understand or realize the bitter depression of the preceding day . [He]73-lucian found it had all vanished away and had been succeeded by an intense exaltation . Afterwards , when at rare intervals [he]73-lucian experienced the same strange possession of the consciousness , [he]73-lucian found this to be the invariable result , the hour of vision was always succeeded by a feeling of delight , by sensations of brightened and intensified powers . On that bright December day after the storm [he]73-lucian rose joyously , and set about the labor of [the bureau]2582-the bureau with the assurance of success , almost with the hope of formidable difficulties to be overcome . [He]73-lucian had long busied [himself]73-lucian with those curious researches which [Poe]235-edgar allan poe had indicated in the Philosophy of Composition , and many hours had been spent in analyzing the singular effects which may be produced by the sound and resonance of words . But [he]73-lucian had been struck by the thought that in the finest literature there were more subtle tones than the loud and insistent music of " never more , "[73-lucian] and [he]73-lucian endeavored to find the secret of those pages and sentences which spoke , less directly , and less obviously , to the soul rather than to the ear , being filled with a certain grave melody and the sensation of singing voices . It was admirable , no doubt , to write phrases that showed at a glance their designed rhythm , and rang with sonorous words , but [he]73-lucian dreamed of a prose in which the music should be less explicit , of names rather than notes . [He]73-lucian was astonished that morning at [his]73-lucian own fortune and facility ; [he]73-lucian succeeded in covering a page of ruled paper wholly to [his]73-lucian satisfaction , and the sentences , when [he]73-lucian read them out , appeared to suggest a weird elusive chanting , exquisite but almost imperceptible , like the echo of the plainsong reverberated from the vault of [a monastic church]1250-a monastic church . [He]73-lucian thought that such happy mornings well repaid [him]73-lucian for the anguish of depression which [he]73-lucian sometimes had to suffer , and for the strange experience of " possession "[1735-his cousin] recurring at rare intervals , and usually after many weeks of severe diet . [His]73-lucian income , [he]73-lucian found , amounted to sixty - five pounds a year , and [he]73-lucian lived for weeks at a time on fifteen shillings a week . During these austere periods [his]73-lucian only food was bread , at the rate of a loaf a day ; but [he]73-lucian drank huge draughts of green tea , and smoked a black tobacco , which seemed to [him]73-lucian a more potent mother of thought than any drug from [the scented East]1251-the scented east . " [I]1735-his cousin hope [you]73-lucian go to [some nice place]2593-some nice place for dinner , "[1735-his cousin] wrote [[his]73-lucian cousin]1735-his cousin ; " there used to be [some excellent eating - houses in [London]11-london]2594-some excellent eating - houses in london where [one]1691-one could get a good cut from the joint , with plenty of gravy , and a boiled potato , for a shilling . [Aunt Mary]238-aunt mary writes that [you]73-lucian should try [[Mr. Jones]239-mr. jones 's in [Water Street]39-water street]2596-mr. jones 's in water street , [Islington]40-islington , whose father came from near [Caermaen]7-caermaen , and was always most comfortable in [her]238-aunt mary day . [I]1691-one daresay the walk [there]1751-there would do [you]73-lucian good . It is such a pity [you]73-lucian smoke that horrid tobacco . [I]1691-one had a letter from [Mrs. Dolly]240-mrs. dolly ( [Jane Diggs]241-jane diggs , who married [[your]73-lucian cousin]2598-your cousin [John Dolly]242-john dolly ) the other day , and [she]240-mrs. dolly said [they]2599-they would have been delighted to take [you]73-lucian for only twenty - five shillings a week for the sake of [the family]513-the family if [you]73-lucian had not been [a smoker]2601-a smoker . [She]240-mrs. dolly told [me]1691-one to ask [you]73-lucian if [you]73-lucian had ever seen a horse or a dog smoking tobacco . [They]2599-they are [such nice , comfortable people]2602-such nice , comfortable people , and [the children]2038-the children would have been company for [you]73-lucian . [Johnnie]243-johnnie , who used to be such [a dear little fellow]2604-a dear little fellow , has just gone into [an office in [the City]1961-the city]2605-an office in the city , and seems to have excellent prospects . How [I]1691-one wish , [[my]1691-one dear]671-my dear [Lucian]73-lucian , that [you]73-lucian could do something in the same way . Do n't forget [Mr. Jones]239-mr. jones 's in [Water Street]39-water street , and [you]73-lucian might mention [your]73-lucian name to [him]239-mr. jones . "[1691-one] [Lucian]73-lucian never troubled [Mr. Jones]239-mr. jones ; but these letters of [[his]73-lucian cousin]1735-his cousin 's always refreshed [him]73-lucian by the force of contrast . [He]73-lucian tried to imagine [himself]73-lucian [a part of [the Dolly family]1255-the dolly family]1254-a part of the dolly family , going dutifully every morning to [the City]1961-the city on [the bus]1257-the bus , and returning in the evening for high tea . [He]73-lucian could conceive the fine odor of hot roast beef hanging about [the decorous house]1258-the decorous house on Sunday afternoons , [papa]2227-papa asleep in [the dining - room]1260-the dining - room , [mamma]828-mamma lying down , and [the children]2038-the children quite good and happy with [their]2038-the children " Sundays books . "[246-rabelais] In the evening , after supper , [one]1691-one read the Quiver till bedtime . Such pictures as these were to [Lucian]73-lucian a comfort and a help , a remedy against despair . Often when [he]73-lucian felt overwhelmed by the difficulty of the work [he]73-lucian had undertaken , [he]73-lucian thought of the alternative career , and was strengthened . [He]73-lucian returned again and again to that desire of [a prose which should sound faintly , not so much with an audible music , but with the memory and echo of it]1264-a prose which should sound faintly , not so much with an audible music , but with the memory and echo of it . In the night , when the last tram had gone jangling by , and [he]73-lucian had looked out and seen [the street]1858-the street all wrapped about in heavy folds of the mist , [he]73-lucian conducted some of [his]73-lucian most delicate experiments . In that white and solitary midnight of [the suburban street]1266-the suburban street [he]73-lucian experienced the curious sense of being on [a tower , remote and apart and high above all the troubles of [the earth]333-the earth]1267-a tower , remote and apart and high above all the troubles of the earth . The gas lamp , which was nearly opposite , shone in a pale halo of light , and [the houses]2572-the houses [themselves]2572-the houses were merely indistinct marks and shadows amidst that palpable whiteness , shutting out [the world]286-the world and its noises . The knowledge of the swarming life that was so still , though it surrounded [him]73-lucian , made the silence seem deeper than that of [the mountains]1825-the mountains before the dawn ; it was as if [he]73-lucian alone stirred and looked out amidst [a host]1272-a host sleeping at [his]73-lucian feet . The fog came in by the open window in freezing puffs , and as [Lucian]73-lucian watched [he]73-lucian noticed that it shook and wavered like the sea , tossing up wreaths and drifts across the pale halo of the lamp , and , these vanishing , others succeeded . It was as if the mist passed by from [the river]1634-the river to the north , as if it still passed by in the silence . [He]73-lucian would shut [his]73-lucian window gently , and sit down in [[his]73-lucian lighted room]1274-his lighted room with all the consciousness of the white advancing shroud upon [him]73-lucian . It was then that [he]73-lucian found [himself]73-lucian in the mood for curious labors , and able to handle with some touch of confidence the more exquisite instruments of the craft . [He]73-lucian sought for that magic by which all the glory and glamour of mystic chivalry were made to shine through the burlesque and gross adventures of [Don Quixote]244-don quixote , by which [Hawthorne]245-hawthorne had lit [his]245-hawthorne infernal Sabbath fires , and fashioned a burning aureole about the village tragedy of the Scarlet Letter . In [Hawthorne]245-hawthorne the story and the suggestion , though quite distinct and of different worlds , were rather parallel than opposed to one another ; but [Cervantes]237-cervantes had done a stranger thing . [One]1691-one read of [Don Quixote]244-don quixote , beaten , dirty , and ridiculous , mistaking [windmills]1276-windmills for [giants]1277-giants , [sheep for an army]1278-sheep for an army ; but the impression was of [the enchanted forest]1279-the enchanted forest , of [Avalon]41-avalon , of [the San Graal]42-the san graal , " far in [the spiritual city]2608-the spiritual city . "[73-lucian] And [Rabelais]246-rabelais showed [him]73-lucian , beneath the letter , the Tourainian sun shining on [the hot rock above [Chinon]43-chinon]1280-the hot rock above chinon , on the maze of [narrow , climbing streets]1281-narrow , climbing streets , on the high - pitched , gabled roofs , on the grey - blue tourelles , pricking upward from the fantastic labyrinth of walls . [He]73-lucian heard the sound of sonorous plain - song from the monastic choir , of gross exuberant gaiety from [the rich vineyards]1282-the rich vineyards ; [he]73-lucian listened to the eternal mystic mirth of those that halted in the purple shadow of the sorbier by [the white , steep road]1283-the white , steep road . The gracious and ornate châteaux on [the Loire]44-the loire and [the Vienne]45-the vienne rose fair and shining to confront the incredible secrets of vast , dim , far - lifted Gothic naves , that seemed ready to take the great deep , and float away from the mist and dust of [earthly streets]1284-earthly streets to anchor in the haven of [the clear city that hath foundations]1285-the clear city that hath foundations . The rank tale of the garderobe , of [the farm - kitchen]1286-the farm - kitchen , mingled with the reasoned , endless legend of [the schools]1287-the schools , with luminous Platonic argument ; the old pomp of [the Middle Ages]46-the middle ages put on the robe of a fresh life . There was a smell of wine and of incense , of [June meadows]1288-june meadows and of ancient books , and through it all [he]73-lucian hearkened , intent , to the exultation of chiming bells ringing for a new feast in [a new land]1289-a new land . [He]73-lucian would cover pages with the analysis of these marvels , tracking the suggestion concealed beneath the words , and yet glowing like the golden threads in a robe of samite , or like that device of the old binders by which a vivid picture appeared on the shut edges of a book . [He]73-lucian tried to imitate this art , to summon even the faint shadow of the great effect , rewriting a page of Hawthorne , experimenting and changing an epithet here and there , noting how sometimes the alteration of a trifling word would plunge a whole scene into darkness , as if one of those blood - red fires had instantly been extinguished . Sometimes , for severe practice , [he]73-lucian attempted to construct short tales in the manner of this or [that master]1290-that master . [He]73-lucian sighed over these desperate attempts , over the clattering pieces of mechanism which would not even simulate life ; but [he]73-lucian urged [himself]73-lucian to an infinite perseverance . Through the white hours [he]73-lucian worked on amidst the heap and litter of papers ; books and manuscripts overflowed from the bureau to the floor ; and if [he]73-lucian looked out [he]73-lucian saw the mist still pass by , still passing from [the river]1634-the river to the north . It was not till the winter was well advanced that [he]73-lucian began at all to explore [the region in which [he]73-lucian lived]1292-the region in which he lived . Soon after [his]73-lucian arrival in [the grey street]1213-the grey street [he]73-lucian had taken one or two vague walks , hardly noticing where [he]73-lucian went or what [he]73-lucian saw ; but for all the summer [he]73-lucian had shut [himself]73-lucian in [[his]73-lucian room]632-his room , beholding nothing but the form and color of words . For [his]73-lucian morning walk [he]73-lucian almost invariably chose the one direction , going along [the Uxbridge Road]47-the uxbridge road towards [Notting Hill]48-notting hill , and returning by [the same monotonous thoroughfare]1295-the same monotonous thoroughfare . Now , however , when the new year was beginning its dull days , [he]73-lucian began to diverge occasionally to right and left , sometimes eating [his]73-lucian luncheon in odd corners , in [the bulging parlors of eighteenth - century taverns]1296-the bulging parlors of eighteenth - century taverns , that still fronted [the surging sea of [modern streets]582-modern streets]1297-the surging sea of modern streets , or perhaps in [brand new " publics "[73-lucian] on the broken borders of [the brickfields]2532-the brickfields]1299-brand new " publics " on the broken borders of the brickfields , smelling of the clay from which [they]2532-the brickfields had swollen . [He]73-lucian found waste by - places behind railway embankments where [he]73-lucian could smoke [his]73-lucian pipe sheltered from the wind ; sometimes there was a wooden fence by [an old pear - orchard]1301-an old pear - orchard where [he]73-lucian sat and gazed at the wet desolation of [the market - gardens]1302-the market - gardens , munching a few currant biscuits by way of dinner . As [he]73-lucian went farther afield a sense of immensity slowly grew upon [him]73-lucian ; it was as if , from the little island of [[his]73-lucian room]632-his room , that one friendly place , [he]73-lucian pushed out into [the grey unknown]1304-the grey unknown , into [a city that for [him]73-lucian was uninhabited as [the desert]1306-the desert]1305-a city that for him was uninhabited as the desert . [He]73-lucian came back to [[his]73-lucian cell]2567-his cell after these purposeless wanderings always with a sense of relief , with the thought of taking refuge from grey . As [he]73-lucian lit the gas and opened the desk of [[his]73-lucian bureau]2578-his bureau and saw the pile of papers awaiting [him]73-lucian , it was as if [he]73-lucian had passed from the black skies and the stinging wind and the dull maze of [the suburb]1309-the suburb into all the warmth and sunlight and violent color of [the south]1310-the south . It was in this winter after [his]73-lucian coming to [the grey street]1213-the grey street that [Lucian]73-lucian first experienced the pains of desolation . [He]73-lucian had all [his]73-lucian life known the delights of solitude , and had acquired that habit of mind which makes [a man]687-a man find rich company on [the bare hillside]1683-the bare hillside and leads [him]687-a man into the heart of the wood to meditate by [the dark waterpools]1314-the dark waterpools . But now in the blank interval when [he]73-lucian was forced to shut up [his]73-lucian desk , the sense of loneliness overwhelmed [him]73-lucian and filled [him]73-lucian with unutterable melancholy . On such days [he]73-lucian carried about with [him]73-lucian an unceasing gnawing torment in [his]73-lucian breast ; the anguish of the empty page awaiting [him]73-lucian in [[his]73-lucian bureau]2578-his bureau , and the knowledge that it was worse than useless to attempt the work . [He]73-lucian had fallen into the habit of always using this phrase " the work "[73-lucian] to denote the adventure of literature ; it had grown in [his]73-lucian mind to all the austere and grave significance of " the great work "[340-his mother] on the lips of [the alchemists]1316-the alchemists ; it included every trifling and laborious page and the vague magnificent fancies that sometimes hovered below [him]73-lucian . All else had become mere by - play , unimportant , trivial ; the work was the end , and the means and the food of [his]73-lucian lifeâ€”it raised [him]73-lucian up in the morning to renew the struggle , it was the symbol which charmed [him]73-lucian as [he]73-lucian lay down at night . All through the hours of toil at [the bureau]2582-the bureau [he]73-lucian was enchanted , and when [he]73-lucian went out and explored [the unknown coasts]2610-the unknown coasts , the one thought allured [him]73-lucian , and was the colored glass between [his]73-lucian eyes and [the world]286-the world . Then as [he]73-lucian drew nearer [home]308-home [his]73-lucian steps would quicken , and the more weary and grey the walk , the more [he]73-lucian rejoiced as [he]73-lucian thought of [[his]73-lucian hermitage]2613-his hermitage and of the curious difficulties that awaited [him]73-lucian there . But when , suddenly and without warning , the faculty disappeared , when [his]73-lucian mind seemed a hopeless waste from which nothing could arise , then [he]73-lucian became subject to a misery so piteous that [the barbarians themselves]2614-the barbarians themselves would have been sorry for [him]73-lucian . [He]73-lucian had known some foretaste of these bitter and inexpressible griefs in the old country days , but then [he]73-lucian had immediately taken refuge in [the hills]1660-the hills , [he]73-lucian had rushed to [the dark woods]2616-the dark woods as to an anodyne , letting [his]73-lucian heart drink in all the wonder and magic of [the wild land]503-the wild land . Now in these days of January , in [the suburban street]1266-the suburban street , there was [no such refuge]2619-no such refuge . [He]73-lucian had been working steadily for some weeks , well enough satisfied on the whole with the daily progress , glad to awake in the morning , and to read over what [he]73-lucian had written on the night before . The new year opened with faint and heavy weather and a breathless silence in the air , but in a few days the great frost set in . Soon [the streets]1118-the streets began to suggest the appearance of [a beleaguered city]2621-a beleaguered city , the silence that had preceded the frost deepened , and the mist hung over the earth like a dense white smoke . Night after night the cold increased , and [people]478-people seemed unwilling to go abroad , till even [the main thoroughfares]2623-the main thoroughfares were empty and deserted , as if [the inhabitants]1022-the inhabitants were lying close in hiding . It was at this dismal time that [Lucian]73-lucian found [himself]73-lucian reduced to impotence . There was a sudden break in [his]73-lucian thought , and when [he]73-lucian wrote on valiantly , hoping against hope , [he]73-lucian only grew more aghast on the discovery of the imbecilities [he]73-lucian had committed to paper . [He]73-lucian ground [his]73-lucian teeth together and persevered , sick at heart , feeling as if all [the world]286-the world were fallen from under [his]73-lucian feet , driving [his]73-lucian pen on mechanically , till [he]73-lucian was overwhelmed . [He]73-lucian saw the stuff [he]73-lucian had done without veil or possible concealment , a lamentable and wretched sheaf of verbiage , worse , it seemed , than the efforts of [[his]73-lucian boyhood]1821-his boyhood . [He]73-lucian was not longer tautological , [he]73-lucian avoided tautology with the infernal art of [a leader - writer]2627-a leader - writer , filling [his]73-lucian wind bags and mincing words as if [he]73-lucian had been [a trained journalist on the staff of the Daily Post]2628-a trained journalist on the staff of the daily post . There seemed all the matter of an insufferable tragedy in these thoughts ; that [his]73-lucian patient and enduring toil was in vain , that practice went for nothing , and that [he]73-lucian had wasted the labor of [Milton]247-milton to accomplish the tenth - rate . Unhappily [he]73-lucian could not "[340-his mother] give in " ; the longing , the fury for the work burnt within [him]73-lucian like a burning fire ; [he]73-lucian lifted up [his]73-lucian eyes in despair . It was then , while [he]73-lucian knew that [no one]302-no one could help [him]73-lucian , that [he]73-lucian languished for help , and then , though [he]73-lucian was aware that no comfort was possible , [he]73-lucian fervently wished to be comforted . [The only friend [he]73-lucian had]2630-the only friend he had was [[his]73-lucian father]341-his father , and [he]73-lucian knew that [[his]73-lucian father]341-his father would not even understand [his]73-lucian distress . For [him]73-lucian , always , the printed book was the beginning and end of literature ; the agony of [the maker]2539-the maker , [his]73-lucian despair and sickness , were as accursed as the pains of labor . [He]73-lucian was ready to read and admire the work of [the great Smith]248-the great smith , but [he]73-lucian did not wish to hear of the period when [the great Smith]2634-the great smith had writhed and twisted like a scotched worm , only hoping to be put out of [his]2634-the great smith misery , to go mad or die , to escape somehow from the bitter pains . And [Lucian]73-lucian knew [no one else]2635-no one else . Now and then [he]73-lucian read in the paper the fame of [the great littérateurs]2636-the great littérateurs ; [the Gypsies]249-the gypsies were entertaining [the Prince of [Wales]49-wales]2637-the prince of wales , [the Jolly Beggars]2638-the jolly beggars were dining with [the Lord Mayor]2639-the lord mayor , [the Old Mumpers]2640-the old mumpers were mingling amicably and gorgeously with [the leading members of [the Stock Exchange]2258-the stock exchange]2641-the leading members of the stock exchange . [He]73-lucian was so unfortunate as to know [none of [these gentlemen]2644-these gentlemen]2643-none of these gentlemen , but it hardly seemed likely that [they]2644-these gentlemen could have done much for [him]73-lucian in any case . Indeed , in [his]73-lucian heart , [he]73-lucian was certain that help and comfort from without were in the nature of things utterly impossible , [his]73-lucian ruin and grief were within , and only [his]73-lucian own assistance could avail . [He]73-lucian tried to reassure [himself]73-lucian , to believe that [his]73-lucian torments were a proof of [his]73-lucian vocation , that the facility of [the novelist who stood six years deep in contracts to produce romances]2645-the novelist who stood six years deep in contracts to produce romances was a thing wholly undesirable , but all the while [he]73-lucian longed for but a drop of that inexhaustible fluency which [he]73-lucian professed to despise . [He]73-lucian drove [himself]73-lucian out from that dreary contemplation of the white paper and the idle pen . [He]73-lucian went into [the frozen and deserted streets]2646-the frozen and deserted streets , hoping that [he]73-lucian might pluck the burning coal from [his]73-lucian heart , but the fire was not quenched . As [he]73-lucian walked furiously along [the grim iron roads]2647-the grim iron roads [he]73-lucian fancied that [those persons who passed [him]73-lucian cheerfully on [their]2648-those persons who passed him cheerfully on their way to friends and friendly hearths way to [friends]862-friends and friendly hearths]2648-those persons who passed him cheerfully on their way to friends and friendly hearths shrank from [him]73-lucian into the mists as [they]2648-those persons who passed him cheerfully on their way to friends and friendly hearths went by . [Lucian]73-lucian imagined that the fire of [his]73-lucian torment and anguish must in some way glow visibly about [him]73-lucian ; [he]73-lucian moved , perhaps , in a nimbus that proclaimed the blackness and the flames within . [He]73-lucian knew , of course , that in misery [he]73-lucian had grown delirious , that [the well - coated , smooth - hatted personages who loomed out of the fog upon [him]73-lucian]2650-the well - coated , smooth - hatted personages who loomed out of the fog upon him were in reality shuddering only with cold , but in spite of common sense [he]73-lucian still conceived that [he]73-lucian saw on [their]2650-the well - coated , smooth - hatted personages who loomed out of the fog upon him faces an evident horror and disgust , and something of the repugnance that [one]1691-one feels at the sight of a venomous snake , half - killed , trailing its bleeding vileness out of sight . By design [Lucian]73-lucian tried to make for [remote and desolate places]2652-remote and desolate places , and yet when [he]73-lucian had succeeded in touching on [the open country]1978-the open country , and knew that the icy shadow hovering through the mist was a field , [he]73-lucian longed for some sound and murmur of life , and turned again to [roads where pale lamps were glimmering]2654-roads where pale lamps were glimmering , and the dancing flame of firelight shone across the frozen shrubs . And the sight of these homely fires , the thought of affection and consolation waiting by them , stung [him]73-lucian the more sharply perhaps because of the contrast with [his]73-lucian own chills and weariness and helpless sickness , and chiefly because [he]73-lucian knew that [he]73-lucian had long closed an everlasting door between [his]73-lucian heart and such felicities . If those within had come out and had called [him]73-lucian by [his]73-lucian name to enter and be comforted , it would have been quite unavailing , since between [them]2650-the well - coated , smooth - hatted personages who loomed out of the fog upon him and [him]73-lucian there was a great gulf fixed . Perhaps for the first time [he]73-lucian realized that [he]73-lucian had lost the art of humanity for ever . [He]73-lucian had thought when [he]73-lucian closed [his]73-lucian ears to the wood whisper and changed [the fauns]2655-the fauns ' singing for the murmur of [the streets]1118-the streets , the black pools for the shadows and amber light of [London]11-london , that [he]73-lucian had put off the old life , and had turned [his]73-lucian soul to healthy activities , but the truth was that [he]73-lucian had merely exchanged one drug for another . [He]73-lucian could not be human , and [he]73-lucian wondered whether there were some drop of the fairy blood in [his]73-lucian body that made [him]73-lucian foreign and a stranger in [the world]286-the world . [He]73-lucian did not surrender to desolation without repeated struggles . [He]73-lucian strove to allure [himself]73-lucian to [his]73-lucian desk by the promise of some easy task ; [he]73-lucian would not attempt invention , but [he]73-lucian had memoranda and rough jottings of ideas in [his]73-lucian note - books , and [he]73-lucian would merely amplify the suggestions ready to [his]73-lucian hand . But it was hopeless , again and again it was hopeless . As [he]73-lucian read over [his]73-lucian notes , trusting that [he]73-lucian would find some hint that might light up the dead fires , and kindle again that pure flame of enthusiasm , [he]73-lucian found how desperately [his]73-lucian fortune had fallen . [He]73-lucian could see no light , no color in the lines [he]73-lucian had scribbled with eager trembling fingers ; [he]73-lucian remembered how splendid all these things had been when [he]73-lucian wrote them down , but now they were meaningless , faded into grey . The few words [he]73-lucian had dashed on to the paper , enraptured at the thought of the happy hours they promised , had become mere jargon , and when [he]73-lucian understood the idea it seemed foolish , dull , unoriginal . [He]73-lucian discovered something at last that appeared to have a grain of promise , and determined to do [his]73-lucian best to put it into shape , but the first paragraph appalled [him]73-lucian ; it might have been written by [an unintelligent schoolboy]2658-an unintelligent schoolboy . [He]73-lucian tore the paper in pieces , and shut and locked [his]73-lucian desk , heavy despair sinking like lead into [his]73-lucian heart . For the rest of that day [he]73-lucian lay motionless on the bed , smoking pipe after pipe in the hope of stupefying [himself]73-lucian with tobacco fumes . The air in [the room]2083-the room became blue and thick with smoke ; it was bitterly cold , and [he]73-lucian wrapped [himself]73-lucian up in [his]73-lucian great - coat and drew the counterpane over [him]73-lucian . The night came on and the window darkened , and at last [he]73-lucian fell asleep . [He]73-lucian renewed the effort at intervals , only to plunge deeper into misery . [He]73-lucian felt the approaches of madness , and knew that [his]73-lucian only hope was to walk till [he]73-lucian was physically exhausted , so that [he]73-lucian might come [home]308-home almost fainting with fatigue , but ready to fall asleep the moment [he]73-lucian got into bed . [He]73-lucian passed the mornings in a kind of torpor , endeavoring to avoid thought , to occupy [his]73-lucian mind with the pattern of the paper , with the advertisements at the end of a book , with the curious greyness of the light that glimmered through the mist into [[his]73-lucian room]632-his room , with the muffled voices that rumbled now and then from [the street]1858-the street . [He]73-lucian tried to make out the design that had once colored the faded carpet on the floor , and wondered about [the dead artist in [Japan]50-japan]2663-the dead artist in japan , [the adorner of [[his]73-lucian bureau]2578-his bureau]2664-the adorner of his bureau . [He]73-lucian speculated as to what [his]73-lucian thoughts had been as [he]73-lucian inserted the rainbow mother - of - pearl and made that great flight of shining birds , dipping [their]2666-their wings as they rose from the reeds , or how [he]73-lucian had conceived the lacquer dragons in red gold , and [the fantastic houses in [the garden of peach - trees]2668-the garden of peach - trees]2667-the fantastic houses in the garden of peach - trees . But sooner or later the oppression of [his]73-lucian grief returned , the loud shriek and clang of the garden - gate , the warning bell of some passing bicyclist steering through the fog , the noise of [his]73-lucian pipe falling to the floor , would suddenly awaken [him]73-lucian to the sense of misery . [He]73-lucian knew that it was time to go out ; [he]73-lucian could not bear to sit still and suffer . Sometimes [she]2663-the dead artist in japan cut a slice of bread and put it in [his]73-lucian pocket , sometimes [he]73-lucian trusted to the chance of finding [a public - house]2669-a public - house , where [he]73-lucian could have a sandwich and a glass of beer . [He]73-lucian turned always from [the main streets]2670-the main streets and lost [himself]73-lucian in [the intricate suburban byways]2671-the intricate suburban byways , willing to be engulfed in the infinite whiteness of the mist . [The roads]989-the roads had stiffened into iron ridges , the fences and trees were glittering with frost crystals , everything was of strange and altered aspect . [Lucian]73-lucian walked on and on through the maze , now in a circle of [shadowy villas]2673-shadowy villas , awful as [the buried streets of [Herculaneum]51-herculaneum]2674-the buried streets of herculaneum , now in lanes dipping onto [open country]2675-open country , that led [him]73-lucian past great elm - trees whose white boughs were all still , and past the bitter lonely fields where the mist seemed to fade away into grey darkness . As [he]73-lucian wandered along [these unfamiliar and ghastly paths]2676-these unfamiliar and ghastly paths [he]73-lucian became the more convinced of [his]73-lucian utter remoteness from all humanity , [he]73-lucian allowed that grotesque suggestion of there being something visibly amiss in [his]73-lucian outward appearance to grow upon [him]73-lucian , and often [he]73-lucian looked with a horrible expectation into the faces of [those who passed by]2677-those who passed by , afraid lest [his]73-lucian own senses gave [him]73-lucian false intelligence , and that [he]73-lucian had really assumed some frightful and revolting shape . It was curious that , partly by [his]73-lucian own fault , and largely , no doubt , through the operation of mere coincidence , [he]73-lucian was once or twice strongly confirmed in this fantastic delusion . [He]73-lucian came one day into [a lonely and unfrequented byway]2678-a lonely and unfrequented byway , [a country lane]2679-a country lane falling into ruin , but still fringed with elms that had formed an avenue leading to [the old manor - house]2680-the old manor - house . It was now [the road of communication between [two far outlying suburbs]2682-two far outlying suburbs]2681-the road of communication between two far outlying suburbs , and on these winter nights lay as black , dreary , and desolate as [a mountain track]2683-a mountain track . Soon after the frost began , [a gentleman]1746-a gentleman had been set upon in [this lane]2685-this lane as [he]73-lucian picked [his]73-lucian way between the corner where [the bus]1257-the bus had set [him]73-lucian down , and [[his]73-lucian home]1651-his home where the fire was blazing , and [[his]73-lucian wife]934-his wife watched the clock . [He]73-lucian was stumbling uncertainly through the gloom , growing a little nervous because the walk seemed so long , and peering anxiously for the lamp at the end of [[his]73-lucian street]2689-his street , when the two footpads rushed at [him]73-lucian out of the fog . [One]1691-one caught [him]73-lucian from behind , the other struck [him]73-lucian with a heavy bludgeon , and as [he]73-lucian lay senseless [they]2691-they robbed [him]73-lucian of [his]73-lucian watch and money , and vanished across [the fields]314-the fields . The next morning all [the suburb]1309-the suburb rang with the story ; [the unfortunate merchant]2694-the unfortunate merchant had been grievously hurt , and [wives]863-wives watched [[their]863-wives husbands]2696-their husbands go out in the morning with sickening apprehension , not knowing what might happen at night . [Lucian]73-lucian of course was ignorant of all these rumors , and struck into [the gloomy by - road]2697-the gloomy by - road without caring where [he]73-lucian was or whither the way would lead [him]73-lucian . [He]73-lucian had been driven out that day as with whips , another hopeless attempt to return to the work had agonised [him]73-lucian , and existence seemed an intolerable pain . As [he]73-lucian entered the deeper gloom , where the fog hung heavily , [he]73-lucian began , half consciously , to gesticulate ; [he]73-lucian felt convulsed with torment and shame , and it was a sorry relief to clench [his]73-lucian nails into [his]73-lucian palm and strike the air as [he]73-lucian stumbled heavily along , bruising [his]73-lucian feet against the frozen ruts and ridges . [His]73-lucian impotence was hideous , [he]73-lucian said to [himself]73-lucian , and [he]73-lucian cursed [himself]73-lucian and [his]73-lucian life , breaking out into a loud oath , and stamping on the ground . Suddenly [he]73-lucian was shocked at a scream of terror , it seemed in [his]73-lucian very ear , and looking up [he]73-lucian saw for a moment [a woman]1770-a woman gazing at [him]73-lucian out of the mist , [her]1770-a woman features distorted and stiff with fear . A momentary convulsion twitched [her]1770-a woman arms into the ugly mimicry of a beckoning gesture , and [she]1770-a woman turned and ran for dear life , howling like a beast . [Lucian]73-lucian stood still in [the road]287-the road while [the woman]2029-the woman 's cries grew faint and died away . [His]73-lucian heart was chilled within [him]73-lucian as the significance of this strange incident became clear . [He]73-lucian remembered nothing of [his]73-lucian violent gestures ; [he]73-lucian had not known at the time that [he]73-lucian had sworn out loud , or that [he]73-lucian was grinding [his]73-lucian teeth with impotent rage . [He]73-lucian only thought of that ringing scream , of the horrible fear on the white face that had looked upon [him]73-lucian , of [the woman]2029-the woman 's headlong flight from [his]73-lucian presence . [He]73-lucian stood trembling and shuddering , and in a little while [he]73-lucian was feeling [his]73-lucian face , searching for some loathsome mark , for the stigmata of evil branding [his]73-lucian forehead . [He]73-lucian staggered homewards like [a drunken man]2702-a drunken man , and when [he]73-lucian came into [the Uxbridge Road]47-the uxbridge road [some children]2703-some children saw [him]73-lucian and called after [him]73-lucian as [he]73-lucian swayed and caught at the lamp - post . When [he]73-lucian got to [[his]73-lucian room]632-his room [he]73-lucian sat down at first in the dark . [He]73-lucian did not dare to light the gas . Everything in [the room]2083-the room was indistinct , but [he]73-lucian shut [his]73-lucian eyes as [he]73-lucian passed the dressing - table , and sat in a corner , [his]73-lucian face turned to the wall . And when at last [he]73-lucian gathered courage and the flame leapt hissing from the jet , [he]73-lucian crept piteously towards the glass , and ducked [his]73-lucian head , crouching miserably , and struggling with [his]73-lucian terrors before [he]73-lucian could look at [his]73-lucian own image . To the best of [his]73-lucian power [he]73-lucian tried to deliver [himself]73-lucian from these more grotesque fantasies ; [he]73-lucian assured [himself]73-lucian that there was nothing terrific in [his]73-lucian countenance but sadness , that [his]73-lucian face was like the face of [other men]2706-other men . Yet [he]73-lucian could not forget that reflection [he]73-lucian had seen in [the woman]2029-the woman 's eyes , how the surest mirrors had shown [him]73-lucian a horrible dread , [her]2029-the woman soul itself quailing and shuddering at an awful sight . [Her]2029-the woman scream rang and rang in [his]73-lucian ears ; [she]2029-the woman had fled away from [him]73-lucian as if [he]73-lucian offered some fate darker than death . [He]73-lucian looked again and again into the glass , tortured by a hideous uncertainty . [His]73-lucian senses told [him]73-lucian there was nothing amiss , yet [he]73-lucian had had a proof , and yet , as [he]73-lucian peered most earnestly , there was , it seemed , something strange and not altogether usual in the expression of the eyes . Perhaps it might be the unsteady flare of the gas , or perhaps a flaw in the cheap looking - glass , that gave some slight distortion to the image . [He]73-lucian walked briskly up and down [the room]2083-the room and tried to gaze steadily , indifferently , into [his]73-lucian own face . [He]73-lucian would not allow [himself]73-lucian to be misguided by a word . When [he]73-lucian had pronounced [himself]73-lucian incapable of humanity , [he]73-lucian had only meant that [he]73-lucian could not enjoy the simple things of common life . [A man]687-a man was not necessarily monstrous , merely because [he]687-a man did not appreciate high tea , a quiet chat about [the neighbors]2710-the neighbors , and a happy noisy evening with [the children]2038-the children . But with what message , then , did [he]73-lucian appear charged that [the woman]2029-the woman 's mouth grew so stark ? [Her]2029-the woman hands had jerked up as if they had been pulled with frantic wires ; [she]2029-the woman seemed for the instant like a horrible puppet . [Her]2029-the woman scream was a thing from the nocturnal Sabbath . [He]73-lucian lit a candle and held it close up to the glass so that [his]73-lucian own face glared white at [him]73-lucian , and the reflection of [the room]2083-the room became an indistinct darkness . [He]73-lucian saw nothing but the candle flame and [his]73-lucian own shining eyes , and surely they were not as the eyes of [common men]2714-common men . As [he]73-lucian put down the light , a sudden suggestion entered [his]73-lucian mind , and [he]73-lucian drew a quick breath , amazed at the thought . [He]73-lucian hardly knew whether to rejoice or to shudder . For the thought [he]73-lucian conceived was this : that [he]73-lucian had mistaken all the circumstances of the adventure , and had perhaps repulsed [a sister who would have welcomed [him]73-lucian to the Sabbath]2715-a sister who would have welcomed him to the sabbath . [He]73-lucian lay awake all night , turning from one dreary and frightful thought to the other , scarcely dozing for a few hours when the dawn came . [He]73-lucian tried for a moment to argue with [himself]73-lucian when [he]73-lucian got up ; knowing that [his]73-lucian true life was locked up in [the bureau]2582-the bureau , [he]73-lucian made a desperate attempt to drive the phantoms and hideous shapes from [his]73-lucian mind . [He]73-lucian was assured that [his]73-lucian salvation was in the work , and [he]73-lucian drew the key from [his]73-lucian pocket , and made as if [he]73-lucian would have opened the desk . But the nausea , the remembrances of repeated and utter failure , were too powerful . For many days [he]73-lucian hung about [the Manor Lane]2717-the manor lane , half dreading , half desiring another meeting , and [he]73-lucian swore [he]73-lucian would not again mistake the cry of rapture , nor repulse the arms extended in a frenzy of delight . In those days [he]73-lucian dreamed of some dark place where [they]2718-they might celebrate and make the marriage of the Sabbath , with such rites as [he]73-lucian had dared to imagine . It was perhaps only the shock of a letter from [[his]73-lucian father]341-his father that rescued [him]73-lucian from these evident approaches to madness . [Mr. Taylor]79-mr. taylor wrote how [they]2718-they had missed [him]73-lucian at Christmas , how [the farmers]1677-the farmers had inquired after [him]73-lucian , of the homely familiar things that recalled [his]73-lucian boyhood , [[his]73-lucian mother]340-his mother 's voice , the friendly fireside , and the good old fashions that had nurtured [him]73-lucian . [He]73-lucian remembered that [he]73-lucian had once been [a boy , loving the cake and puddings and the radiant holly]2722-a boy , loving the cake and puddings and the radiant holly , and all the seventeenth - century mirth that lingered on in [the ancient farmhouses]2723-the ancient farmhouses . And there came to [him]73-lucian the more holy memory of Mass on Christmas morning . How sweet the dark and frosty earth had smelt as [he]73-lucian walked beside [[his]73-lucian mother]340-his mother down [the winding lane]2725-the winding lane , and from the stile near [the church]2220-the church [they]2718-they had seen [the world]286-the world glimmering to the dawn , and the wandering lanthorns advancing across [the fields]314-the fields . Then [he]73-lucian had come into [the church]2220-the church and seen [it]2220-the church shining with candles and holly , and [[his]73-lucian father]341-his father in pure vestments of white linen sang the longing music of the liturgy at the altar , and [the people]654-the people answered [him]73-lucian , till the sun rose with the grave notes of [the Paternoster]2732-the paternoster , and a red beam stole through the chancel window . The worst horror left [him]73-lucian as [he]73-lucian recalled the memory of these dear and holy things . [He]73-lucian cast away the frightful fancy that the scream [he]73-lucian had heard was a shriek of joy , that the arms , rigidly jerked out , invited [him]73-lucian to an embrace . Indeed , the thought that [he]73-lucian had longed for such an obscene illusion , that [he]73-lucian had gloated over the recollection of that stark mouth , filled [him]73-lucian with disgust . [He]73-lucian resolved that [his]73-lucian senses were deceived , that [he]73-lucian had neither seen nor heard , but had for a moment externalized [his]73-lucian own slumbering and morbid dreams . It was perhaps necessary that [he]73-lucian should be wretched , that [his]73-lucian efforts should be discouraged , but [he]73-lucian would not yield utterly to madness . Yet when [he]73-lucian went abroad with such good resolutions , it was hard to resist an influence that seemed to come from without and within . [He]73-lucian did not know it , but [people]478-people were everywhere talking of the great frost , of the fog that lay heavy on [London]11-london , making [the streets]1118-the streets dark and terrible , of strange birds that came fluttering about the windows in [the silent squares]2735-the silent squares . [The Thames]52-the thames rolled out duskily , bearing down the jarring ice - blocks , and as [one]1691-one looked on the black water from [the bridges]2737-the bridges it was like a river in a northern tale . To [Lucian]73-lucian it all seemed mythical , of the same substance as [his]73-lucian own fantastic thoughts . [He]73-lucian rarely saw a newspaper , and did not follow from day to day the systematic readings of the thermometer , the reports of ice - fairs , of [coaches driven]2738-coaches driven across [the river]1634-the river at [Hampton]53-hampton , of the skating on [the fens]2740-the fens ; and hence [the iron roads]2741-the iron roads , the beleaguered silence and the heavy folds of mist appeared as amazing as a picture , significant , appalling . [He]73-lucian could not look out and see [a common suburban street]2742-a common suburban street foggy and dull , nor think of [the inhabitants]1022-the inhabitants as at work or sitting cheerfully eating nuts about [their]1022-the inhabitants fires ; [he]73-lucian saw a vision of [a grey road]2744-a grey road vanishing , of [dim houses]2745-dim houses all empty and deserted , and the silence seemed eternal . And when [he]73-lucian went out and passed through [street]2746-street after [street]2746-street , all void , by the vague shapes of [houses]2748-houses that appeared for a moment and were then instantly swallowed up , it seemed to [him]73-lucian as if [he]73-lucian had strayed into [a city that had suffered some inconceivable doom]2749-a city that had suffered some inconceivable doom , that [he]73-lucian alone wandered where myriads had once dwelt . It was [a town as great as [Babylon]54-babylon , terrible as [Rome]55-rome]2750-a town as great as babylon , terrible as rome , marvelous as [Lost Atlantis]56-lost atlantis , set in the midst of [a white wilderness surrounded by waste places]2751-a white wilderness surrounded by waste places . It was impossible to escape from [it]2750-a town as great as babylon , terrible as rome ; if [he]73-lucian skulked between [hedges]2752-hedges , and crept away beyond [the frozen pools]2753-the frozen pools , presently the serried stony lines confronted [him]73-lucian like an army , and far and far [they]2754-they swept away into the night , as some fabled wall that guards [an empire in [the vast dim East]2756-the vast dim east]2755-an empire in the vast dim east . Or in [that distorting medium of the mist]2757-that distorting medium of the mist , changing all things , [he]73-lucian imagined that [he]73-lucian trod [an infinite desolate plain]2758-an infinite desolate plain , abandoned from ages , but circled and encircled with dolmen and menhir that loomed out at [him]73-lucian , gigantic , terrible . All [London]11-london was [one grey temple of an awful rite]2759-one grey temple of an awful rite , ring within ring of wizard stones circled about [some central place]2760-some central place , every circle was an initiation , every initiation eternal loss . Or perhaps [he]73-lucian was astray for ever in [a land of grey rocks]2761-a land of grey rocks . [He]73-lucian had seen the light of [home]308-home , the flicker of the fire on the walls ; close at hand , it seemed , was the open door , and [he]73-lucian had heard dear voices calling to [him]73-lucian across the gloom , but [he]73-lucian had just missed the path . The lamps vanished , the voices sounded thin and died away , and yet [he]73-lucian knew that [those within]2763-those within were waiting , that [they]2763-those within could not bear to close the door , but waited , calling [his]73-lucian name , while [he]73-lucian had missed the way , and wandered in [the pathless desert of the grey rocks]2764-the pathless desert of the grey rocks . Fantastic , hideous , [they]2763-those within beset [him]73-lucian wherever [he]73-lucian turned , piled up into strange shapes , pricked with sharp peaks , assuming the appearance of goblin towers , swelling into a vague dome like a fairy rath , huge and terrible . And as one dream faded into another , so these last fancies were perhaps the most tormenting and persistent ; [the rocky avenues]2765-the rocky avenues became the camp and fortalice of [some half - human , malignant race who swarmed in hiding , ready to bear [him]73-lucian away into [the heart of [their]2766-some half - human , malignant race who swarmed in hiding , ready to bear him away into the heart of their horrible hills horrible hills]2767-the heart of their horrible hills]2766-some half - human , malignant race who swarmed in hiding , ready to bear him away into the heart of their horrible hills . It was awful to think that all [his]73-lucian goings were surrounded , that in the darkness [he]73-lucian was watched and surveyed , that every step but led [him]73-lucian deeper and deeper into [the labyrinth]2768-the labyrinth . When , of an evening , [he]73-lucian was secure in [[his]73-lucian room]632-his room , the blind drawn down and the gas flaring , [he]73-lucian made vigorous efforts toward sanity . It was not of [his]73-lucian free will that [he]73-lucian allowed terror to overmaster [him]73-lucian , and [he]73-lucian desired nothing better than a placid and harmless life , full of work and clear thinking . [He]73-lucian knew that [he]73-lucian deluded [himself]73-lucian with imagination , that [he]73-lucian had been walking through [London]11-london suburbs and not through Pandemonium , and that if [he]73-lucian could but unlock [his]73-lucian bureau all those ugly forms would be resolved into the mist . But it was hard to say if [he]73-lucian consoled [himself]73-lucian effectually with such reflections , for the return to common sense meant also the return to the sharp pangs of defeat . It recalled [him]73-lucian to the bitter theme of [his]73-lucian own inefficiency , to the thought that [he]73-lucian only desired one thing of life , and that this was denied [him]73-lucian . [He]73-lucian was willing to endure the austerities of [a monk in a severe cloister]2770-a monk in a severe cloister , to suffer cold , to be hungry , to be lonely and friendless , to forbear all the consolation of friendly speech , and to be glad of all these things , if only [he]73-lucian might be allowed to illuminate the manuscript in quietness . It seemed a hideous insufferable cruelty , that [he]73-lucian should so fervently desire that which [he]73-lucian could never gain . [He]73-lucian was led back to the old conclusion ; [he]73-lucian had lost the sense of humanity , [he]73-lucian was wretched because [he]73-lucian was [an alien]2771-an alien and [a stranger amongst [citizens]2773-citizens]2772-a stranger amongst citizens . It seemed probable that the enthusiasm of literature , as [he]73-lucian understood it , the fervent desire for the fine art , had in it something of the inhuman , and dissevered the enthusiast from [his]73-lucian fellow - creatures . It was possible that [the barbarian]2774-the barbarian suspected as much , that by some slow process of rumination [he]73-lucian had arrived at [his]73-lucian fixed and inveterate impression , by no means a clear reasoned conviction ; [the average Philistine]2775-the average philistine , if pressed for the reasons of [his]2775-the average philistine dislike , would either become inarticulate , ejaculating "[340-his mother] faugh " and "[340-his mother] pah " like [an old - fashioned Scots Magazine]2776-an old - fashioned scots magazine , or else [he]2775-the average philistine would give some imaginary and absurd reason , alleging that [all "[340-his mother] littery men]2777-all " littery men " were poor , that [composers]2778-composers never cut [their]2778-composers hair , that [painters]2779-painters were rarely [public - school men]2780-public - school men , that [sculptors]2781-sculptors could n't ride straight to hounds to save [their]2781-sculptors lives , but clearly these imbecilities were mere afterthoughts ; [the average man]2782-the average man hated [the artist]620-the artist from a deep instinctive dread of all that was strange , uncanny , alien to [his]2782-the average man nature ; [he]2782-the average man gibbered , uttered [his]2782-the average man harsh , semi - bestial "[340-his mother] faugh , " and dismissed [Keats]250-keats to [his]250-keats gallipots from much the same motives as usually impelled [the black savages]2784-the black savages to dismiss [the white man]2785-the white man on an even longer journey . [Lucian]73-lucian was not especially interested in this hatred of [the barbarian]2774-the barbarian for [the maker]2539-the maker , except from this point , that it confirmed [him]73-lucian in [his]73-lucian belief that the love of art dissociated [the man]647-the man from [the race]2789-the race . One touch of art made [the whole world]2790-the whole world alien , but surely miseries of [the civilized man]2791-the civilized man cast amongst [savages]2792-savages were not so much caused by dread of [their]2792-savages ferocity as by the terror of [his]73-lucian own thoughts ; [he]73-lucian would perhaps in [his]73-lucian last despair leave [his]73-lucian retreat and go forth to perish at [their]2792-savages hands , so that [he]73-lucian might at least die in company , and hear the sound of speech before death . And [Lucian]73-lucian felt most keenly that in [his]73-lucian case there was a double curse ; [he]73-lucian was as isolated as [Keats]250-keats , and as inarticulate as [[his]73-lucian reviewers]2793-his reviewers . The consolation of the work had failed [him]73-lucian , and [he]73-lucian was suspended in the void between [two worlds]2794-two worlds . It was no doubt the composite effect of [his]73-lucian failures , [his]73-lucian loneliness of soul , and solitude of life , that had made [him]73-lucian invest [those common streets]2795-those common streets with such grim and persistent terrors . [He]73-lucian had perhaps yielded to a temptation without knowing that [he]73-lucian had been tempted , and , in the manner of [De Quincey]251-de quincey , had chosen the subtle in exchange for the more tangible pains . Unconsciously , but still of free will , [he]73-lucian had preferred the splendor and the gloom of a malignant vision before [his]73-lucian corporal pains , before the hard reality of [his]73-lucian own impotence . It was better to dwell in vague melancholy , to stray in [the forsaken streets of [a city]2797-a city doomed from ages]2796-the forsaken streets of a city doomed from ages , to wander amidst forlorn and desperate rocks than to awake to a gnawing and ignoble torment , to confess that [a house of business]1188-a house of business would have been more suitable and more practical , that [he]73-lucian had promised what [he]73-lucian could never perform . Even as [he]73-lucian struggled to beat back the phantasmagoria of the mist , and resolved that [he]73-lucian would no longer make all [the streets]1118-the streets a stage of apparitions , [he]73-lucian hardly realized what [he]73-lucian had done , or that [the ghosts [he]73-lucian had called]2800-the ghosts he had called might depart and return again . [He]73-lucian continued [his]73-lucian long walks , always with the object of producing a physical weariness and exhaustion that would enable [him]73-lucian to sleep of nights . But even when [he]73-lucian saw [the foggy and deserted avenues]2801-the foggy and deserted avenues in their proper shape , and allowed [his]73-lucian eyes to catch the pale glimmer of the lamps , and the dancing flame of the firelight , [he]73-lucian could not rid [himself]73-lucian of the impression that [he]73-lucian stood afar off , that between those hearths and [himself]73-lucian there was a great gulf fixed . As [he]73-lucian paced down the footpath [he]73-lucian could often see plainly across the frozen shrubs into [the homely and cheerful rooms]2802-the homely and cheerful rooms . Sometimes , late in the evening , [he]73-lucian caught a passing glimpse of [the family]513-the family at tea , [father]480-father , [mother]346-mother , and [children]826-children laughing and talking together , well pleased with [each other]1165-each other 's company . Sometimes [a wife]2808-a wife or [a child]2809-a child was standing by the garden gate peering anxiously through the fog , and the sight of it all , all the little details , the hideous but comfortable armchairs turned ready to the fire , maroon - red curtains being drawn close to shut out the ugly night , the sudden blaze and illumination as the fire was poked up so that it might be cheerful for [father]480-father ; these trivial and common things were acutely significant . They brought back to [him]73-lucian the image of [a dead boyâ€”himself]2811-a dead boyâ€”himself[340-his mother] . [They]1317-they recalled [the shabby old " parlor "[1320-he] in [the country]459-the country , with [its]1318-the shabby old " parlor " in the country , with its shabby old furniture and fading carpet , and renewed a whole atmosphere of affection and homely comfort shabby old furniture and fading carpet , and renewed a whole atmosphere of affection and homely comfort]1318-the shabby old " parlor " in the country , with its shabby old furniture and fading carpet , and renewed a whole atmosphere of affection and homely comfort . [[His]1320-he mother]340-his mother would walk to the end of [the drive]1322-the drive and look out for [him]1320-he when [he]1320-he was late ( wandering then about [the dark woodlands]1323-the dark woodlands ) ; on winter evenings [she]340-his mother would make the fire blaze , and have [his]1320-he slippers warming by the hearth , and there was probably buttered toast " as a treat . "[1691-one] [He]1320-he dwelt on all these insignificant petty circumstances , on the genial glow and light after [the muddy winter lanes]1324-the muddy winter lanes , on the relish of the buttered toast and the smell of the hot tea , on [the two old cats curled fast asleep before the fender]1325-the two old cats curled fast asleep before the fender , and made [them]1325-the two old cats curled fast asleep before the fender [instruments of exquisite pain and regret]1326-instruments of exquisite pain and regret . [Each of these strange houses that [he]1320-he passed]1327-each of these strange houses that he passed was identified in [his]1320-he mind with [[his]1320-he own vanished [home]308-home]1328-his own vanished home ; all was prepared and ready as in the old days , but [he]1320-he was shut out , judged and condemned to wander in the frozen mist , with weary feet , anguished and forlorn , and [[they]1330-they that would pass from within to help [him]1320-he]1331-they that would pass from within to help him could not , neither could [he]1320-he pass to [them]1330-they . Again , for the hundredth time , [he]1320-he came back to the sentence : [he]1320-he could not gain the art of letters and [he]1320-he had lost the art of humanity . [He]1320-he saw the vanity of all [his]1320-he thoughts ; [he]1320-he was [an ascetic]1332-an ascetic caring nothing for warmth and cheerfulness and the small comforts of life , and yet [he]1320-he allowed [his]1320-he mind to dwell on such things . If one of [those passers - by]1333-those passers - by , who walked briskly , eager for [home]308-home , should have pitied [him]1320-he by some miracle and asked [him]1320-he to come in , it would have been worse than useless , yet [he]1320-he longed for pleasures that [he]1320-he could not have enjoyed . It was as if [he]1320-he were come to [a place of torment]1335-a place of torment , where [they]1330-they who could not drink longed for water , where [they]1330-they who could feel no warmth shuddered in the eternal cold . [He]1320-he was oppressed by [the grim conceit]1336-the grim conceit that [he]1320-he [himself]1320-he still slept within the matted thicket , imprisoned by [the green bastions of [the Roman fort]347-the roman fort]1337-the green bastions of the roman fort . [He]1320-he had never come out , but [a changeling]1339-a changeling had gone down [the hill]268-the hill , and now stirred about [the earth]333-the earth . Beset by such ingenious terrors , it was not wonderful that outward events and common incidents should abet [his]1320-he fancies . [He]1320-he had succeeded one day in escaping from the mesh of [the streets]1118-the streets , and fell on [a rough and narrow lane that stole into [a little valley]1344-a little valley]1343-a rough and narrow lane that stole into a little valley . For the moment [he]1320-he was in a somewhat happier mood ; the afternoon sun glowed through the rolling mist , and the air grew clearer . [He]1320-he saw [quiet and peaceful fields]1345-quiet and peaceful fields , and a wood descending in a gentle slope from [an old farmstead of warm red brick]1346-an old farmstead of warm red brick . [The farmer]1776-the farmer was driving the slow cattle home from [the hill]268-the hill , and [his]1776-the farmer loud halloo to [his]1776-the farmer dog came across [the land]462-the land a cheerful mellow note . From another side [a cart]1350-a cart was approaching [the clustered barns]1351-the clustered barns , hesitating , pausing while the great horses rested , and then starting again into lazy motion . In [the well of [the valley]270-the valley]269-the well of the valley a wandering line of bushes showed where [a brook crept in and out amongst the meadows]1354-a brook crept in and out amongst the meadows , and , as [Lucian]73-lucian stood , lingering , on [the bridge]2283-the bridge , a soft and idle breath ruffled through the boughs of a great elm . [He]1320-he felt soothed , as by calm music , and wondered whether it would not be better for [him]1320-he to live in [some such quiet place]1356-some such quiet place , within reach of [the streets]1118-the streets and yet remote from [them]1118-the streets . [It]1358-it seemed a refuge for still thoughts ; [he]1320-he could imagine [himself]1320-he sitting at rest beneath the black yew tree in [the farm garden]1359-the farm garden , at the close of a summer day . [He]1320-he had almost determined that [he]1320-he would knock at the door and ask if [they]1360-they would take [him]1320-he as [a lodger]1361-a lodger , when [he]1320-he saw [a child]2809-a child running towards [him]1320-he down [the lane]278-the lane . It was [a little girl]978-a little girl , with bright curls tossing about [her]978-a little girl head , and , as [she]978-a little girl came on , the sunlight glowed upon [her]978-a little girl , illuminating [her]978-a little girl brick - red frock and the yellow king - cups in [her]978-a little girl hat . [She]978-a little girl had run with [her]978-a little girl eyes on the ground , chirping and laughing to [herself]978-a little girl , and did not see [Lucian]73-lucian till [she]978-a little girl was quite near [him]73-lucian . [She]978-a little girl started and glanced into [his]73-lucian eyes for a moment , and began to cry ; [he]73-lucian stretched out [his]73-lucian hand , and [she]978-a little girl ran from [him]73-lucian screaming , frightened no doubt by what was to [her]978-a little girl a sudden and strange apparition . [He]73-lucian turned back towards [London]11-london , and the mist folded [him]73-lucian in its thick darkness , for on that evening it was tinged with black . It was only by the intensest strain of resolution that [he]73-lucian did not yield utterly to the poisonous anodyne which was always at hand . It had been a difficult struggle to escape from [the mesh of [the hills]1660-the hills]1365-the mesh of the hills , from the music of the fauns , and even now [he]73-lucian was drawn by the memory of these old allurements . But [he]73-lucian felt that here , in [his]73-lucian loneliness , [he]73-lucian was in greater danger , and beset by a blacker magic . Horrible fancies rushed wantonly into [his]73-lucian mind ; [he]73-lucian was not only ready to believe that something in [his]73-lucian soul sent a shudder through all that was simple and innocent , but [he]73-lucian came trembling [home]308-home one Saturday night , believing , or half - believing , that [he]73-lucian was in communion with evil . [He]73-lucian had passed through the clamorous and blatant crowd of [the " high street]2812-the " high street , "[1389-the english working class] where , as [one]1691-one climbed [the hill]268-the hill , [the shops]1370-the shops seemed all aflame , and the black night air glowed with the flaring gas - jets and the naphtha - lamps , hissing and wavering before the February wind . Voices , raucous , clamant , abominable , were belched out of [the blazing public - houses]1371-the blazing public - houses as the doors swung to and fro , and above these doors were hideous brassy lamps , very slowly swinging in a violent blast of air , so that they might have been infernal thuribles , censing [the people]654-the people . [Some man]1373-some man was calling [his]1373-some man wares in one long continuous shriek that never stopped or paused , and , as a respond , a deeper , louder voice roared to [him]1373-some man from across [the road]287-the road . [An Italian]1375-an italian whirled the handle of [his]1375-an italian piano - organ in a fury , and a ring of imps danced mad figures around [him]1375-an italian , danced and flung up [their]1376-their legs till the rags dropped from some of [them]1376-their , and [they]1376-their still danced on . A flare of naphtha , burning with a rushing noise , threw a light on one point of the circle , and [Lucian]73-lucian watched [a lank girl of fifteen]1377-a lank girl of fifteen as [she]1377-a lank girl of fifteen came round and round to the flash . [She]1377-a lank girl of fifteen was quite drunk , and had kicked [her]1377-a lank girl of fifteen petticoats away , and [the crowd]1837-the crowd howled laughter and applause at [her]1377-a lank girl of fifteen . [Her]1377-a lank girl of fifteen black hair poured down and leapt on [her]1377-a lank girl of fifteen scarlet bodice ; [she]1377-a lank girl of fifteen sprang and leapt round the ring , laughing in Bacchic frenzy , and led the orgy to triumph . [People]478-people were crossing to and fro , jostling against each other , swarming about [certain shops and stalls]1380-certain shops and stalls in a dense dark mass that quivered and sent out [feelers as if it were one writhing organism]1381-feelers as if it were one writhing organism . A little farther [a group of young men , arm in arm]1382-a group of young men , arm in arm , were marching down [the roadway]2584-the roadway chanting some music - hall verse in full chorus , so that it sounded like plainsong . An impossible hubbub , a hum of [voices angry as swarming bees , the squeals of five or six girls who ran in and out , and dived up dark passages and darted back into the crowd]1384-voices angry as swarming bees , the squeals of five or six girls who ran in and out , and dived up dark passages and darted back into the crowd ; all these mingled together till [his]1375-an italian ears quivered . [A young fellow]1385-a young fellow was playing the concertina , and [he]1385-a young fellow touched the keys with such slow fingers that the tune wailed solemn into a dirge ; but there was nothing so strange as the burst of sound that swelled out when the public - house doors were opened . [He]73-lucian walked amongst [these people]1386-these people , looked at [their]1386-these people faces , and looked at [[the children]2038-the children amongst [them]1386-these people]1388-the children amongst them . [He]73-lucian had come out thinking that [he]73-lucian would see [the English working class]1389-the english working class , " [the best - behaved and the best - tempered crowd in [the world]286-the world]2813-the best - behaved and the best - tempered crowd in the world , "[1429-a tall and lovely young woman who seemed to be alone] enjoying the simple pleasure of the Saturday night 's shopping . [Mother]252-mother bought the joint for Sunday 's dinner , and perhaps a pair of boots for [father]480-father ; [father]480-father had an honest glass of beer , and [the children]2038-the children were given bags of sweets , and then [all these worthy people]1393-all these worthy people went decently [home]308-home to [their]1393-all these worthy people well - earned rest . [De Quincey]251-de quincey had enjoyed the sight in [his]251-de quincey day , and had studied the rise and fall of onions and potatoes . [Lucian]73-lucian , indeed , had desired to take these simple emotions as an opiate , to forget the fine fret and fantastic trouble of [his]73-lucian own existence in plain things and the palpable joy of rest after labor . [He]73-lucian was only afraid lest [he]73-lucian should be too sharply reproached by the sight of [these men who fought bravely year after year against starvation , who knew nothing of intricate and imagined grief , but only the weariness of relentless labor]1395-these men who fought bravely year after year against starvation , who knew nothing of intricate and imagined grief , but only the weariness of relentless labor , of the long battle for [[their]1395-these men who fought bravely year after year against starvation , who knew nothing of intricate and imagined grief , but only the weariness of relentless labor wives]1063-their wives and [children]826-children . It would be pathetic , [he]73-lucian thought , to see [them]1395-these men who fought bravely year after year against starvation , who knew nothing of intricate and imagined grief , but only the weariness of relentless labor content with so little , brightened by the expectation of a day 's rest and a good dinner , forced , even then , to reckon every penny , and to make [[their]1395-these men who fought bravely year after year against starvation , who knew nothing of intricate and imagined grief , but only the weariness of relentless labor children]1398-their children laugh with halfpence . Either [he]73-lucian would be ashamed before so much content , or else [he]73-lucian would be again touched by the sense of [his]73-lucian inhumanity which could take no interest in the common things of life . But still [he]73-lucian went to be at least taken out of [himself]73-lucian , to be forced to look at another side of [the world]286-the world , so that [he]73-lucian might perhaps forget a little while [his]73-lucian own sorrows . [He]73-lucian was fascinated by what [he]73-lucian saw and heard . [He]73-lucian wondered whether [De Quincey]251-de quincey also had seen the same spectacle , and had concealed [his]73-lucian impressions out of reverence for [the average reader]1400-the average reader . Here there were no simple joys of [honest toilers]1401-honest toilers , but wonderful orgies , that drew out [his]73-lucian heart to horrible music . At first the violence of sound and sight had overwhelmed [him]73-lucian ; the lights flaring in the night wind , the array of naphtha lamps , the black shadows , the roar of voices . The dance about the piano - organ had been the first sign of an inner meaning , and the face of [the dark girl]1402-the dark girl as [she]1402-the dark girl came round and round to the flame had been amazing in its utter furious abandon . And what songs [they]1403-their were singing all around [him]73-lucian , and what terrible words rang out , only to excite peals of laughter . In [the public - houses]1404-the public - houses [[the workmen]1405-the workmen 's wives]1406-the workmen 's wives , [the wives of [small tradesmen]1408-small tradesmen]1407-the wives of small tradesmen , decently dressed in black , were drinking [their]1403-their faces to a flaming red , and urging [[their]1403-their husbands]2696-their husbands to drink more . [Beautiful young women]1410-beautiful young women , flushed and laughing , put [their]1410-beautiful young women arms round [the men]753-the men 's necks and kissed [them]753-the men , and then held up the glass to [their]1410-beautiful young women lips . In the dark corners , at the openings of [side streets]1412-side streets , [the children]2038-the children were talking together , instructing [each other]1165-each other , whispering what [they]2038-the children had seen ; [a boy of fifteen]1415-a boy of fifteen was plying [a girl of twelve]1416-a girl of twelve with whisky , and presently [they]2038-the children crept away . [Lucian]73-lucian passed [them]2038-the children as [they]2038-the children turned to go , and [both]1859-both looked at [him]73-lucian . [The boy]1780-the boy laughed , and [the girl]1768-the girl smiled quietly . It was above all in the faces around [him]73-lucian that [he]73-lucian saw the most astounding things , the Bacchic fury unveiled and unashamed . To [his]73-lucian eyes it seemed as if [these revelers]1420-these revelers recognized [him]73-lucian as [a fellow]1421-a fellow , and smiled up in [his]73-lucian face , aware that [he]73-lucian was in the secret . Every instinct of religion , of [civilization even]1422-civilization even , was swept away ; [they]1420-these revelers gazed at [one another]2011-one another and at [him]73-lucian , absolved of all scruples , children of [the earth]333-the earth and nothing more . Now and then [a couple]1425-a couple detached [themselves]1425-a couple from [the swarm]1426-the swarm , and went away into the darkness , answering the jeers and laughter of [[their]1425-a couple friends]1067-their friends as [they]1425-a couple vanished . On the edge of [the pavement]2235-the pavement , not far from where [he]73-lucian was standing , [Lucian]73-lucian noticed [a tall and lovely young woman who seemed to be alone]1429-a tall and lovely young woman who seemed to be alone . [She]1429-a tall and lovely young woman who seemed to be alone was in the full light of a naphtha flame , and [her]1429-a tall and lovely young woman who seemed to be alone bronze hair and flushed cheeks shone illuminate as [she]1429-a tall and lovely young woman who seemed to be alone viewed the orgy . [She]1429-a tall and lovely young woman who seemed to be alone had dark brown eyes , and a strange look as of an old picture in [her]1429-a tall and lovely young woman who seemed to be alone face ; and [her]1429-a tall and lovely young woman who seemed to be alone eyes brightened with an urgent gleam . [He]73-lucian saw [the revelers]1430-the revelers nudging [each other]1165-each other and glancing at [her]1429-a tall and lovely young woman who seemed to be alone , and [two or three young men]1432-two or three young men went up and asked [her]1429-a tall and lovely young woman who seemed to be alone to come for a walk . [She]1429-a tall and lovely young woman who seemed to be alone shook [her]1429-a tall and lovely young woman who seemed to be alone head and said " No thank [you]73-lucian "[1429-a tall and lovely young woman who seemed to be alone] again and again , and seemed as if [she]1429-a tall and lovely young woman who seemed to be alone were looking for [somebody in the crowd]1433-somebody in the crowd . " [I]1429-a tall and lovely young woman who seemed to be alone 'm expecting [a friend]2815-a friend , "[1429-a tall and lovely young woman who seemed to be alone] [she]1429-a tall and lovely young woman who seemed to be alone said at last to [a man who proposed a drink and a walk afterwards]1434-a man who proposed a drink and a walk afterwards ; and [Lucian]73-lucian wondered what kind of [friend]1435-friend would ultimately appear . Suddenly [she]1429-a tall and lovely young woman who seemed to be alone turned to [him]73-lucian as [he]73-lucian was about to pass on , and said in a low voice : " [I]1464-the chapel 'll go for a walk with [you]73-lucian if [you]73-lucian like ; [you]73-lucian just go on , and [I]1464-the chapel 'll follow in a minute . "[1464-the chapel] For a moment [he]73-lucian looked steadily at [her]1429-a tall and lovely young woman who seemed to be alone . [He]73-lucian saw that the first glance has misled [him]73-lucian ; [her]1429-a tall and lovely young woman who seemed to be alone face was not flushed with drink as [he]73-lucian had supposed , but it was radiant with the most exquisite color , a red flame glowed and died on [her]1429-a tall and lovely young woman who seemed to be alone cheek , and seemed to palpitate as [she]1429-a tall and lovely young woman who seemed to be alone spoke . The head was set on the neck nobly , as in a statue , and about the ears the bronze hair strayed into little curls . [She]1429-a tall and lovely young woman who seemed to be alone was smiling and waiting for [his]73-lucian answer . [He]73-lucian muttered something about being very sorry , and fled down [the hill]268-the hill out of [the orgy]1437-the orgy , from the noise of roaring voices and the glitter of the great lamps very slowly swinging in the blast of wind . [He]73-lucian knew that [he]73-lucian had touched the brink of utter desolation ; there was death in [the woman]2029-the woman 's face , and [she]1429-a tall and lovely young woman who seemed to be alone had indeed summoned [him]73-lucian to [the Sabbath]57-the sabbath . Somehow [he]73-lucian had been able to refuse on the instant , but if [he]73-lucian had delayed [he]73-lucian knew [he]73-lucian would have abandoned [himself]73-lucian to [her]1429-a tall and lovely young woman who seemed to be alone , body and soul . [He]73-lucian locked [himself]73-lucian in [[his]73-lucian room]632-his room and lay trembling on the bed , wondering if some subtle sympathy had shown [the woman]2029-the woman [[her]2029-the woman perfect companion]1441-her perfect companion . [He]73-lucian looked in the glass , not expecting now to see certain visible and outward signs , but searching for the meaning of that strange glance that lit up [his]73-lucian eyes .
