The gold , the great and glowing masterpiece , would never shine amongst the dead ashes and smoking efforts of the crucible , but in the course of the life , in the interval between the failures , [he]73-lucian might possibly discover curious things . These were the good nights that [he]73-lucian could look back on without any fear or shame , when [he]73-lucian had been happy and content on a diet of bread and tea and tobacco , and could hear of some imbecility passing into its hundredth thousand , and laugh cheerfullyâ€”if[90-miss deacon] only that last page had been imagined aright , if the phrases noted in the still hours rang out [their]1506-their music when [he]1507-he read them in the morning . [He]1507-he remembered the drolleries and fantasies that [the worthy Miss Deacon]90-miss deacon used to write to [him]1507-he , and how [he]1507-he had grinned at [her]90-miss deacon words of reproof , admonition , and advice . [She]90-miss deacon had once instigated [Dolly fils]257-dolly fils to pay [him]1507-he a visit , and [that young prop of respectability]1508-that young prop of respectability had talked about the extraordinary running of [Bolter]258-bolter at the Scurragh meeting in [Ireland]66-ireland ; and then , glancing at [Lucian]73-lucian 's books , had inquired whether any of them had " warm bits . "[73-lucian] [He]1507-he had been kind though patronizing , and seemed to have moved freely in [the most brilliant society of [Stoke Newington]67-stoke newington]1509-the most brilliant society of stoke newington . [He]1507-he had not been able to give any information as to the present condition of [[Edgar Allan Poe]235-edgar allan poe 's old school]1510-edgar allan poe 's old school . It appeared eventually that [his]1507-he report at [home]308-home had not been a very favorable one , for no invitation to high tea had followed , as [Miss Deacon]90-miss deacon had hoped . [The Dollys]259-the dollys knew [many nice people , who were well off]1512-many nice people , who were well off , and [[Lucian]73-lucian 's cousin]1513-lucian 's cousin , as [she]90-miss deacon afterwards said , had done [her]1513-lucian 's cousin best to introduce [him]1507-he to the beau monde of [those northern suburbs]1514-those northern suburbs . But after the visit of [the young Dolly]260-the young dolly , with what joy [he]1507-he had returned to the treasures which [he]1507-he had concealed from profane eyes . [He]1507-he had looked out and seen [[his]1507-he visitor]1515-his visitor on board [the tram]1516-the tram at [the street corner]1517-the street corner , and [he]1507-he laughed out loud , and locked [his]1507-he door . There had been moments when [he]1507-he was lonely , and wished to hear again the sound of friendly speech , but , after such an irruption of suburban futility , it was a keen delight , to feel that [he]1507-he was secure on [[his]1507-he tower]1518-his tower , that [he]1507-he could absorb [himself]1507-he in [his]1507-he wonderful task as safe and silent as if [he]1507-he were in mid - desert . But there was one period that [he]1507-he dared not revive ; [he]1507-he could no bear to think of those weeks of desolation and terror in the winter after [his]1507-he coming to [London]11-london . [His]1507-he mind was sluggish , and [he]1507-he could not quite remember how many years had passed since that dismal experience ; it sounded all an old story , but yet it was still vivid , a flaming scroll of terror from which [he]1507-he turned [his]1507-he eyes away . One awful scene glowed into [his]1507-he memory , and [he]1507-he could not shut out the sight of an orgy , of [dusky figures whirling in a ring]1519-dusky figures whirling in a ring , of lurid naphtha flares blazing in the darkness , of great glittering lamps , like infernal thuribles , very slowly swaying in a violent blast of air . And there was something else , something which [he]1507-he could not remember , but it filled [him]1507-he with terror , but it slunk in the dark places of [his]1507-he soul , as a wild beast crouches in the depths of [a cave]1520-a cave . Again , and without reason , [he]1507-he began to image to [himself]1507-he [that old moldering house in [the field]1629-the field]1521-that old moldering house in the field . With what a loud incessant noise the wind must be clamoring about on this fearful night , how the great elm swayed and cried in the storm , and the rain dashed and pattered on the windows , and dripped on the sodden earth from the shaking shrubs beside the door . [He]1507-he moved uneasily on [his]1507-he chair , and struggled to put the picture out of [his]1507-he thoughts ; but in spite of [himself]1507-he [he]1507-he saw the stained uneven walls , that ugly blot of mildew above the window , and perhaps a feeble gleam of light filtered through the blind , and [some one , unhappy above all and for ever lost]1523-some one , unhappy above all and for ever lost , sat within [the dismal room]1524-the dismal room . Or rather , every window was black , without a glimmer of hope , and [he]1507-he who was shut in thick darkness heard the wind and the rain , and the noise of the elm - tree moaning and beating and weeping on the walls . For all [his]1507-he effort the impression would not leave [him]1507-he , and as [he]1507-he sat before [his]1507-he desk looking into the vague darkness [he]1507-he could almost see [that chamber which [he]1507-he had so often imagined]1525-that chamber which he had so often imagined ; the low whitewashed ceiling held up by a heavy beam , the smears of smoke and long usage , the cracks and fissures of the plaster . Old furniture , shabby , deplorable , battered , stood about [the room]2083-the room ; there was a horsehair sofa worn and tottering , and a dismal paper , patterned in a livid red , blackened and moldered near the floor , and peeled off and hung in strips from the dank walls . And there was that odor of decay , of the rank soil steaming , of rotting wood , a vapor that choked the breath and made the heart full of fear and heaviness . [Lucian]73-lucian again shivered with a thrill of dread ; [he]73-lucian was afraid that [he]73-lucian had overworked [himself]73-lucian and that [he]73-lucian was suffering from the first symptoms of grave illness . [His]73-lucian mind dwelt on confused and terrible recollections , and with a mad ingenuity gave form and substance to phantoms ; and even now [he]73-lucian drew a long breath , almost imagining that the air in [[his]73-lucian room]632-his room was heavy and noisome , that it entered [his]73-lucian nostrils with some taint of the crypt . And [his]73-lucian body was still languid , and though [he]73-lucian made a half motion to rise [he]73-lucian could not find enough energy for the effort , and [he]73-lucian sank again into the chair . At all events , [he]73-lucian would think no more of [that sad house in [the field]1629-the field]1528-that sad house in the field ; [he]73-lucian would return to those long struggles with letters , to the happy nights when [he]73-lucian had gained victories . [He]73-lucian remembered something of [his]73-lucian escape from the desolation and the worse than desolation that had obsessed [him]73-lucian during that first winter in [London]11-london . [He]73-lucian had gone free one bleak morning in February , and after those dreary terrible weeks the desk and the heap and litter of papers had once more engulfed and absorbed [him]73-lucian . And in the succeeding summer , of a night when [he]73-lucian lay awake and listened to the birds , shining images came wantonly to [him]73-lucian . For an hour , while the dawn brightened , [he]73-lucian had felt the presence of an age , the resurrection of the life that [the green fields]1530-the green fields had hidden , and [his]73-lucian heart stirred for joy when [he]73-lucian knew that [he]73-lucian held and possessed all the loveliness that had so long moldered . [He]73-lucian could scarcely fall asleep for eager and leaping thoughts , and as soon as [his]73-lucian breakfast was over [he]73-lucian went out and bought paper and pens of [a certain celestial stationer in [Notting Hill]48-notting hill]1531-a certain celestial stationer in notting hill . [The street]1858-the street was not changed as [he]73-lucian passed to and fro on [his]73-lucian errand . [The rattling wagons]1533-the rattling wagons jostled by at intervals , a rare hansom came spinning down from [London]11-london , there sounded the same hum and jangle of [the gliding trams]1534-the gliding trams . The languid life of [the pavement]2235-the pavement was unaltered ; [a few people , un - classed , without salience or possible description]1536-a few people , un - classed , without salience or possible description , lounged and walked from east to west , and from west to east , or slowly dropped into [the byways]1537-the byways to wander in [the black waste to the north]1538-the black waste to the north , or perhaps go astray in [the systems that stretched towards [the river]1634-the river]1539-the systems that stretched towards the river . [He]73-lucian glanced down [these by - roads]1541-these by - roads as [he]73-lucian passed , and was astonished , as always , at [their]1541-these by - roads mysterious and desert aspect . Some were utterly empty ; lines of [neat , appalling residences]1542-neat , appalling residences , trim and garnished as if for occupation , edging [the white glaring road]1543-the white glaring road ; and [not a soul]1448-not a soul was abroad , and not a sound broke [their]1541-these by - roads stillness . It was a picture of the desolation of midnight lighted up , but empty and waste as the most profound and solemn hours before the day . Other of [these by - roads]1541-these by - roads , of [older settlement]1546-older settlement , were furnished with [more important houses , standing far back from the pavement]1547-more important houses , standing far back from the pavement , each in a little wood of greenery , and thus [one]1691-one might look down as through [a forest vista]1549-a forest vista , and see a way smooth and guarded with low walls and yet untrodden , and all a leafy silence . Here and there in [some of these echoing roads]1550-some of these echoing roads [a figure]1551-a figure seemed lazily advancing in the distance , hesitating and delaying , as if lost in the labyrinth . It was difficult to say which were [the more dismal]1552-the more dismal , [these deserted streets that wandered away to right and left , or [the great main thoroughfare]1554-the great main thoroughfare with [its]1554-the great main thoroughfare narcotic and shadowy life]1553-these deserted streets that wandered away to right and left , or the great main thoroughfare with its narcotic and shadowy life . For the latter appeared vast , interminable , grey , and [those who traveled by [it]1554-the great main thoroughfare]1555-those who traveled by it were scarcely real , the bodies of [the living]1556-the living , but rather the uncertain and misty shapes that come and go across [the desert]1306-the desert in an Eastern tale , when [men]1715-men look up from the sand and see [a caravan]1559-a caravan pass [them]1715-men , all in silence , without a cry or a greeting . So [they]1715-men passed and repassed each other on [those pavements]1560-those pavements , appearing and vanishing , each intent on [his]1561-his own secret , and wrapped in obscurity . [One]1691-one might have sworn that not [a man]687-a man saw [[his]687-a man neighbor who met [him]687-a man or jostled [him]687-a man]1564-his neighbor who met him or jostled him , that here [every one]1450-every one was a phantom for the other , though the lines of [their]1715-men paths crossed and recrossed , and [their]1715-men eyes stared like the eyes of [live men]1566-live men . When [two]1567-two went by together , [they]1715-men mumbled and cast distrustful glances behind [them]1715-men as though afraid all [the world]286-the world was an enemy , and the pattering of feet was like the noise of a shower of rain . Curious appearances and simulations of life gathered at points in [the road]287-the road , for at intervals [the villas]2293-the villas ended and [shops]1233-shops began in a dismal row , and looked so hopeless that [one]1691-one wondered who could buy . There were [women]1906-women fluttering uneasily about [the greengrocers]1574-the greengrocers , and shabby things in rusty black touched and retouched the red lumps that [an unshaven butcher]1575-an unshaven butcher offered , and already in the corner public there was a confused noise , with a tossing of voices that rose and fell like a Jewish chant , with the senseless stir of marionettes jerked into an imitation of gaiety . Then , in crossing [a side street]2442-a side street that seemed like grey mid - winter in stone , [he]687-a man trespassed from [one world]1577-one world to another , for [an old decayed house amidst [its]1578-an old decayed house amidst its garden garden]1578-an old decayed house amidst its garden held the opposite corner . The laurels had grown into black skeletons , patched with green drift , the ilex gloomed over [the porch]2373-the porch , [the deodar]1580-the deodar had blighted the flower - beds . Dark ivies swarmed over an elm - tree , and a brown clustering fungus sprang in gross masses on [the lawn]1714-the lawn , showing where the roots of dead trees moldered . [The blue verandah]1582-the blue verandah , the blue balcony over the door , had faded to grey , and the stucco was blotched with ugly marks of weather , and a dank smell of decay , that vapor of black rotten earth in [old town gardens]1583-old town gardens , hung heavy about the gates . And then [a row of [musty villas]1585-musty villas]1584-a row of musty villas had pushed out in [shops]1233-shops to the pavement , and the things in faded black buzzed and stirred about the limp cabbages , and the red lumps of meat . It was [the same terrible street]1587-the same terrible street , whose pavements [he]687-a man had trodden so often , where sunshine seemed but a gaudy light , where the fume of burning bricks always drifted . On black winter nights [he]687-a man had seen the sparse lights glimmering through the rain and drawing close together , as [the dreary road]1588-the dreary road vanished in long perspective . Perhaps this was its most appropriate moment , when nothing of [[its]1578-an old decayed house amidst its garden smug villas and [skeleton shops]1590-skeleton shops]1589-its smug villas and skeleton shops remained but the bright patches of [their]1589-its smug villas and skeleton shops windows , when [the old house]1591-the old house amongst [its]1578-an old decayed house amidst its garden moldering shrubs was but a dark cloud , and [the streets to the north]1592-the streets to the north and south seemed like starry wastes , beyond them the blackness of infinity . Always in the daylight it had been to [him]687-a man abhorred and abominable , and [its]1578-an old decayed house amidst its garden grey houses and purlieus had been fungus - like sproutings , an efflorescence of horrible decay . But on that bright morning neither [the dreadful street]1593-the dreadful street nor those who moved about [it]1593-the dreadful street appalled [him]687-a man . [He]687-a man returned joyously to [[his]687-a man den]1594-his den , and reverently laid out the paper on [his]687-a man desk . The world about [him]687-a man was but a grey shadow hovering on a shining wall ; its noises were faint as the rustling of trees in a distant wood . The lovely and exquisite forms of those who served [the Amber Venus]69-the amber venus were [his]687-a man distinct , clear , and manifest visions , and for one amongst [them]1595-them who came to [him]687-a man in a fire of bronze hair [his]687-a man heart stirred with the adoration of love . [She]69-the amber venus it was who stood forth from [all the rest and fell down prostrate before the radiant form in amber]1596-all the rest and fell down prostrate before the radiant form in amber , drawing out [her]69-the amber venus pins in curious gold , [her]69-the amber venus glowing brooches of enamel , and pouring from a silver box all [her]69-the amber venus treasures of jewels and precious stones , chrysoberyl and sardonyx , opal and diamond , topaz and pearl . And then [she]69-the amber venus stripped from [her]69-the amber venus body [her]69-the amber venus precious robes and stood before [the goddess]1597-the goddess in the glowing mist of [her]69-the amber venus hair , praying that to [her]69-the amber venus who had given all and came naked to [the shrine]1598-the shrine , love might be given , and the grace of [Venus]261-venus . And when at last , after strange adventures , [her]69-the amber venus prayer was granted , then when the sweet light came from [the sea]1719-the sea , and [[her]69-the amber venus lover]1600-her lover turned at dawn to that bronze glory , [he]687-a man saw beside [him]687-a man a little statuette of amber . And in [the shrine]1598-the shrine , far in [Britain]2-britain where the black rains stained the marble , [they]1602-they found the splendid and sumptuous statue of [the Golden Venus]1603-the golden venus , the last fine robe of silk that [the lady]880-the lady had dedicated falling from [her]880-the lady fingers , and the jewels lying at [her]880-the lady feet . And [her]880-the lady face was like [the lady]880-the lady 's face when the sun had brightened it on that day of [her]880-the lady devotion . The bronze mist glimmered before [Lucian]73-lucian 's eyes ; [he]73-lucian felt as though the soft floating hair touched [his]73-lucian forehead and [his]73-lucian lips and [his]73-lucian hands . The fume of burning bricks , the reek of cabbage water , never reached [his]73-lucian nostrils that were filled with the perfume of rare unguents , with the breath of the violet sea in [Italy]70-italy . [His]73-lucian pleasure was an inebriation , an ecstasy of joy that destroyed all the vile Hottentot kraals and mud avenues as with one white lightning flash , and through the hours of that day [he]73-lucian sat enthralled , not contriving a story with patient art , but rapt into another time , and entranced by the urgent gleam in [the lady]880-the lady 's eyes . The little tale of [The Amber Statuette]262-the amber statuette had at last issued from [a humble office]1607-a humble office in the spring after [[his]73-lucian father]341-his father 's death . [The author]591-the author was utterly unknown ; [[the author]591-the author 's Murray]1611-the author 's murray was [a wholesale stationer and printer in process of development]1612-a wholesale stationer and printer in process of development , so that [Lucian]73-lucian was astonished when the book became a moderate success . [The reviewers]616-the reviewers had been sadly irritated , and even now [he]73-lucian recollected with cheerfulness an article in an influential daily paper , an article pleasantly headed : " Where are the disinfectants ? "[73-lucian] And thenâ€”but all the months afterwards seemed doubtful , there were only broken revelations of the laborious hours renewed , and the white nights when [he]73-lucian had seen the moonlight fade and the gaslight grow wan at the approach of dawn . [He]73-lucian listened . Surely that was the sound of rain falling on sodden ground , the heavy sound of great swollen drops driven down from wet leaves by the gust of wind , and then again the strain of boughs sang above the tumult of the air ; there was a doleful noise as if the storm shook the masts of [a ship]1103-a ship . [He]73-lucian had only to get up and look out of the window and [he]73-lucian would see [the treeless empty street]3217-the treeless empty street , and the rain starring the puddles under the gas - lamp , but [he]73-lucian would wait a little while . [He]73-lucian tried to think why , in spite of all [his]73-lucian resolutions , a dark horror seemed to brood more and more over all [his]73-lucian mind . How often [he]73-lucian had sat and worked on just such nights as this , contented if the words were in accord though the wind might wail , though the air were black with rain . Even about the little book that [he]73-lucian had made there seemed some taint , some shuddering memory that came to [him]73-lucian across the gulf of forgetfulness . Somehow the remembrance of the offering to [Venus]261-venus , of the phrases that [he]73-lucian had so lovingly invented , brought back again the dusky figures that danced in the orgy , beneath the brassy glittering lamps ; and again the naphtha flares showed the way to [the sad house in [the fields]314-the fields]3218-the sad house in the fields , and the red glare lit up the mildewed walls and the black hopeless windows . [He]73-lucian gasped for breath , [he]73-lucian seemed to inhale a heavy air that reeked of decay and rottenness , and the odor of the clay was in [his]73-lucian nostrils . That unknown cloud that had darkened [his]73-lucian thoughts grew blacker and engulfed [him]73-lucian , despair was heavy upon [him]73-lucian , [his]73-lucian heart fainted with a horrible dread . In a moment , it seemed , a veil would be drawn away and certain awful things would appear . [He]73-lucian strove to rise from [his]73-lucian chair , to cry out , but [he]73-lucian could not . Deep , deep the darkness closed upon [him]73-lucian , and the storm sounded far away . [The Roman fort]347-the roman fort surged up , terrific , and [he]73-lucian saw the writhing boughs in a ring , and behind them a glow and heat of fire . There were hideous shapes that swarmed in the thicket of the oaks ; [they]3221-they called and beckoned to [him]73-lucian , and rose into the air , into the flame that was smitten from heaven about the walls . And amongst [them]3221-they was the form of [the beloved]2491-the beloved , but jets of flame issued from [her]2491-the beloved breasts , and beside [her]2491-the beloved was [a horrible old woman]3223-a horrible old woman , naked ; and [they]3221-they , too , summoned [him]73-lucian to mount [the hill]268-the hill . [He]73-lucian heard [Dr. Burrows]88-dr. burrows whispering of the strange things that had been found in [[old Mrs. Gibbon]74-old mrs. gibbon 's cottage]1729-old mrs. gibbon 's cottage , obscene figures , and unknown contrivances . [She]3223-a horrible old woman was [a witch]3226-a witch , [he]73-lucian said , and [the mistress of [witches]3228-witches]3227-the mistress of witches . [He]73-lucian fought against the nightmare , against the illusion that bewildered [him]73-lucian . All [his]73-lucian life , [he]73-lucian thought , had been an evil dream , and for [the common world]3229-the common world [he]73-lucian had fashioned an unreal red garment , that burned in [his]73-lucian eyes . Truth and the dream were so mingled that now [he]73-lucian could not divide one from the other . [He]73-lucian had let [Annie]75-annie drink [his]73-lucian soul beneath [the hill]268-the hill , on the night when the moonfire shone , but [he]73-lucian had not surely seen [her]75-annie exalted in the flame , [the Queen of the Sabbath]3231-the queen of the sabbath . Dimly [he]73-lucian remembered [Dr. Burrows]88-dr. burrows coming to see [him]73-lucian in [London]11-london , but had [he]73-lucian not imagined all the rest ? Again [he]73-lucian found [himself]73-lucian in [the dusky lane]3232-the dusky lane , and [Annie]75-annie floated down to [him]73-lucian from the moon above [the hill]268-the hill . [His]73-lucian head sank upon [her]75-annie breast again , but , alas , it was aflame . And [he]73-lucian looked down , and [he]73-lucian saw that [his]73-lucian own flesh was aflame , and [he]73-lucian knew that the fire could never be quenched . There was a heavy weight upon [his]73-lucian head , [his]73-lucian feet were nailed to the floor , and [his]73-lucian arms bound tight beside [him]73-lucian . [He]73-lucian seemed to [himself]73-lucian to rage and struggle with the strength of [a madman]2021-a madman ; but [his]73-lucian hand only stirred and quivered a little as it lay upon the desk . Again [he]73-lucian was astray in the mist ; wandering through the waste avenues of [a city that had been ruined from ages]3235-a city that had been ruined from ages . [It]3235-a city that had been ruined from ages had been splendid as [Rome]55-rome , terrible as [Babylon]54-babylon , and for ever the darkness had covered [it]3235-a city that had been ruined from ages , and [it]3235-a city that had been ruined from ages lay desolate for ever in [the accursed plain]3236-the accursed plain . And far and far [the grey passages]3237-the grey passages stretched into the night , into [the icy fields]3238-the icy fields , into [the place of eternal gloom]3239-the place of eternal gloom . Ring within ring [the awful temple]3240-the awful temple closed around [him]73-lucian ; unending circles of vast stones , circle within circle , and every circle less throughout all ages . In the center was [the sanctuary of the infernal rite]3241-the sanctuary of the infernal rite , and [he]73-lucian was borne thither as in the eddies of a whirlpool , to consummate [his]73-lucian ruin , to celebrate the wedding of [the Sabbath]3242-the sabbath . [He]73-lucian flung up [his]73-lucian arms and beat the air , resisting with all [his]73-lucian strength , with muscles that could throw down mountains ; and this time [his]73-lucian little finger stirred for an instant , and [his]73-lucian foot twitched upon the floor . Then suddenly a flaring street shone before [him]73-lucian . There was darkness round about [him]73-lucian , but it flamed with hissing jets of light and naphtha fires , and great glittering lamps swayed very slowly in a violent blast of air . A horrible music , and the exultation of discordant voices , swelled in [his]73-lucian ears , and [he]73-lucian saw [an uncertain tossing crowd of dusky figures]3243-an uncertain tossing crowd of dusky figures that circled and leapt before [him]73-lucian . There was a noise like the chant of the lost , and then there appeared in the midst of the orgy , beneath a red flame , the figure of [a woman]1770-a woman . [Her]1770-a woman bronze hair and flushed cheeks were illuminate , and an argent light shone from [her]1770-a woman eyes , and with a smile that froze [his]73-lucian heart [her]1770-a woman lips opened to speak to [him]73-lucian . [The tossing crowd]3245-the tossing crowd faded away , falling into a gulf of darkness , and then [she]1770-a woman drew out from [her]1770-a woman hair pins of curious gold , and glowing brooches in enamel , and poured out jewels before [him]73-lucian from a silver box , and then [she]1770-a woman stripped from [her]1770-a woman body [her]1770-a woman precious robes , and stood in the glowing mist of [her]1770-a woman hair , and held out [her]1770-a woman arms to [him]73-lucian . But [he]73-lucian raised [his]73-lucian eyes and saw the mould and decay gaining on the walls of [a dismal room]3246-a dismal room , and a gloomy paper was dropping to the rotting floor . A vapor of the grave entered [his]73-lucian nostrils , and [he]73-lucian cried out with a loud scream ; but there was only an indistinct guttural murmur in [his]73-lucian throat . And presently [the woman]2029-the woman fled away from [him]73-lucian , and [he]73-lucian pursued [her]1770-a woman . [She]1770-a woman fled away before [him]73-lucian through [midnight country]3248-midnight country , and [he]73-lucian followed after [her]1770-a woman , chasing [her]1770-a woman from thicket to thicket , from [valley]3249-valley to [valley]3249-valley . And at last [he]73-lucian captured [her]1770-a woman and won [her]1770-a woman with horrible caresses , and [they]3251-they went up to celebrate and make the marriage of [the Sabbath]3242-the sabbath . [They]3251-they were within the matted thicket , and [they]3251-they writhed in the flames , insatiable , for ever . [They]3251-they were tortured , and tortured [one another]2011-one another , in the sight of [thousands who gathered thick about]3254-thousands who gathered thick about [them]3251-they ; and [their]3251-they desire rose up like a black smoke . Without , the storm swelled to the roaring of an awful sea , the wind grew to a shrill long scream , the elm - tree was riven and split with the crash of a thunderclap . To [Lucian]73-lucian the tumult and the shock came as a gentle murmur , as if [a brake stirred before a sudden breeze in summer]3255-a brake stirred before a sudden breeze in summer . And then a vast silence overwhelmed [him]73-lucian . A few minutes later there was a shuffling of feet in [the passage]3256-the passage , and the door was softly opened . [A woman]1770-a woman came in , holding a light , and [she]1770-a woman peered curiously at the figure sitting quite still in the chair before the desk . [The woman]2029-the woman was half dressed , and [she]2029-the woman had let [her]2029-the woman splendid bronze hair flow down , [her]2029-the woman cheeks were flushed , and as [she]2029-the woman advanced into [the shabby room]1800-the shabby room , the lamp [she]2029-the woman carried cast quaking shadows on the moldering paper , patched with marks of rising damp , and hanging in strips from the wet , dripping wall . The blind had not been drawn , but no light or glimmer of light filtered through the window , for a great straggling box tree that beat the rain upon the panes shut out even the night . [The woman]2029-the woman came softly , and as [she]2029-the woman bent down over [Lucian]73-lucian an argent gleam shone from [her]2029-the woman brown eyes , and the little curls upon [her]2029-the woman neck were like golden work upon marble . [She]2029-the woman put [her]2029-the woman hand to [his]73-lucian heart , and looked up , and beckoned to [some one who was waiting by the door]3261-some one who was waiting by the door . "[263-joe] Come in , [Joe]263-joe , " [she]2029-the woman said . "[263-joe] It 's just as [I]0-i thought it would be : ' Death by misadventure ' " ; and [she]2029-the woman held up a little empty bottle of dark blue glass that was standing on the desk . "[263-joe] [He]263-joe would take it , and [I]0-i always knew [he]263-joe would take a drop too much one of these days . " "[263-joe] What 's all those papers that [he]263-joe 's got there ? " "[263-joe] Did n't [I]0-i tell [you]263-joe ? It was crool to see [him]263-joe . [He]263-joe got it into ' is ' ead [he]263-joe could write a book ; [he]263-joe 's been at it for the last six months . Look ' ere . " [She]3262-she spread the neat pile of manuscript broadcast over the desk , and took a sheet at haphazard . It was all covered with illegible hopeless scribblings ; only here and there it was possible to recognize a word . "[263-joe] Why , [nobody]1639-nobody could read it , if [they]1639-nobody wanted to . " "[0-i] It 's all like that . [He]263-joe thought it was beautiful . [I]0-i used to ' ear [him]263-joe jabbering to [himself]263-joe about it , dreadful nonsense it was [he]263-joe used to talk . [I]0-i did [my]0-i best to tongue [him]263-joe out of it , but it was n't any good . " "[263-joe] [He]263-joe must have been a bit dotty . [He]263-joe 's left [you]0-i everything . " "[263-joe] Yes . " "[0-i] [You]0-i 've got evidence to show [he]263-joe took the stuff . " "[None-None] Yes , to be sure [I]0-i have . [The doctor]550-the doctor told [him]263-joe [he]263-joe would be certain to do for [himself]263-joe , and [he]263-joe was found two or three times quite silly in [the streets]1118-the streets . [They]1618-they had to drag [him]263-joe away from [a house in [Halden Road]71-halden road]1619-a house in halden road . [He]263-joe was carrying on dreadful , shaking at the gaite , and calling out it was ' is ' ome and [they]1618-they would n't let [him]263-joe in . [I]0-i heard [Dr. Manning]264-dr. manning [myself]0-i tell ' [i]0-i m in [this very room]1620-this very room that [he]263-joe 'd kill ' imself one of these days . [Joe]263-joe ! Are n't [you]263-joe ashamed of [yourself]263-joe . [I]0-i declare [you]263-joe 're quite rude , and it 's almost Sunday too . Bring the light over here , ca n't [you]263-joe ? " [The man]647-the man took up the blazing paraffin lamp , and set it on the desk , beside the scattered heap of that terrible manuscript . The flaring light shone through the dead eyes into [the dying brain]1622-the dying brain , and there was a glow within , as if great furnace doors were opened .
